title: Product Marketing Manager (Remote)
description:
**WHO WE ARE**



Parse Biosciences is a global life sciences company whose mission is to accelerate progress in human health and scientific research. Empowering researchers to perform single cell sequencing with unprecedented scale and ease, our pioneering approach has enabled groundbreaking discoveries in cancer treatment, tissue repair, stem cell therapy, kidney and liver disease, brain development, and the immune system.



Founded based on a transformative technology invented at the University of Washington, Parse has raised over $100 million and is used by over 1,000 labs across the world. Our growing portfolio of products includes Evercode Whole Transcriptome, Evercode TCR, Gene Capture, and a software tool for data analysis.



Parse Biosciences is based in Seattle, Washington's vibrant South Lake Union district, where we recently opened a 34,000 square foot headquarters and state-of-the-art laboratory.


**THE POSITION**



The **Product Marketing Manager** will be responsible for developing and communicating product messaging to inform existing and potential customers. This role will focus on planning and creating collateral that delivers compelling messaging around the company's portfolio. This role will involve collaborating with product management and R&D to produce content that is informed by customer perspective and technical product knowledge. Candidates should be organized, with a strong scientific background and a storyteller's flair. The ideal candidate is excited about the field of single-cell genomics and invigorated by working together across a multi-functional team.


**IN THIS POSITION, YOU WILL:**


* Create content for omni-channel marketing efforts in support of the product portfolio and new product initiatives with an eye toward segment-specific value propositions, market benchmarks, and product differentiation
* Target positioning and messaging relevant to customer segment and buyer journey stage
* Develop marketing personas, customer segmentation strategies, customer journeys, and key messaging
* Manage the collateral calendar, creation of supporting elements, and review efforts
* Collaborate with branding, design, technical writing, public relations, and search engine optimization experts for high impact campaigns and materials
* Collaborate with Product Managers to develop effective messaging and product campaigns
* Stay up-to-date on advances in single-cell genomics, company technology, and the broader competitive landscape


**FOR THIS POSITION, WE LOOK FOR**


* Bachelor's degree in life sciences or related discipline
* 3+ years of relevant experience in product marketing, product management, or customer application support in genomics, with preference for experience in field of single cell sequencing
* A proactive attitude with the ability to work both independently and collaboratively with a team
* Ability to communicate clearly to a technical audience (both written and verbal)
* Strong time management and organizational skills, with a proven ability to meet deadlines


*Parse Biosciences is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender perception or identity, national origin, age, marital status, protected veteran status, disability status, or any other status protected by federal, state, or local law.*


*COVID-19 Vaccination Requirement: Parse Biosciences has a COVID-19 vaccination policy that applies to all employees regardless of work location, except as prohibited by applicable law. As such, newly hired employees are required to be fully vaccinated prior to commencing employment, subject to reasonable accommodation and other requirements of applicable federal, state, and local law. Being fully vaccinated means that an individual is at least two weeks past their final (or only) dose of an authorized COVID-19 vaccine regimen. Exemptions will be considered for medical conditions/disabilities and sincerely held religious beliefs, observations, or practices.*

title: Full-Time Junior Project Manager
description:
**Role Description:**

**corecubed** is an award-winning full-service marketing agency focused on accelerating growth for care providers. Our expert marketers, strategists, and creatives are committed to producing exceptional results for our clients.

Work with other talented, enthusiastic, and fun professionals who want to maintain a healthy work-life balance! Perfect for working around children’s schedules, **corecubed**’s award-winning care marketing experts are seeking a full-time project manager to join their remote workforce. With core values of quality, focus, profitability, passion, and teamwork, the selected candidate will share in our commitment to offering unparalleled care marketing expertise that helps our clients succeed.

**What you’ll receive:**

* A fully remote position: work where you choose
* Flexible schedule: 40 hours per week
* Competitive pay
* Paid time off and profit sharing after one year

**What you’ll do:**

* Respond to inquiries from care companies seeking **corecubed** services
* Set up meetings and meet with inquiries to educate them about **corecubed** services
* Understand all **corecubed** services, pricing and proposals
* Manage client projects as assigned
* Provide top-quality customer service in accordance with **corecubed**’s 14 customer service points
* Delegate project tasks to other team members
* Track project and budget status weekly and serve as the conduit for workflow between clients and **corecubed** team members
* Supervise projects and administrative details to ensure the timely completion of projects and that client expectations are not only met but exceeded
* Perform other duties as needed
* Training will be provided

**Requirements:**

* Proactive, enthusiastic, responsive, self-starter
* Detail-oriented with the ability to manage multiple projects
* Strong communication and interpersonal skills
* Highly motivated and able to organize complex situations
* Comfort with online management tools and digital marketing
* The ability to learn new online programs easily and quickly
* Previous experience in advertising, marketing, and/or sales a plus, especially in the fields of healthcare, home care, home health, and/or senior care
* A bachelor's degree in marketing, communications, business or other related fields is a plus.

**Experience with these software tools a plus:**

* Microsoft Office
* G-Suite tools including Gmail, Calendar, Sites, Sheets
* Calendly
* Basecamp
* Box
* WordPress
* Agency Analytics

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Pay: $24.00 - $27.00 per hour

Expected hours: 40 per week

Benefits:

* Flexible schedule
* Paid time off

Compensation package:

* Bonus opportunities

Schedule:

* Monday to Friday

Work Location: Remote

title: Director of Marketing
description:
At Miaplaza, our vision is to make online learning more effective than ever before. We apply the most successful approaches in virtual education to create online learning platforms where students from different backgrounds can be successful. Our platforms, Miacademy for K-8 and MiaPrep for high school students, are designed to cater to diverse educational needs, including those of kids with learning disabilities.

Miaplaza embraces diversity and equal opportunity. We are committed to building a team that represents a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills. The more inclusive we are, the better our work will be.

Our student base is growing rapidly and we are currently hiring for multiple positions across several departments! Our expansion stems from two key factors: our commitment to providing exceptional educational content to our students by scaling our team with passionate individuals, and our pursuit of new opportunities to enhance our students' learning experiences by broadening our capabilities and expertise as an organization.

You can hear our CEO, Johannes Ziegler, discuss our company in this podcast: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=7mabdbqbSco&t=23s&ab\\_channel=Universit%C3%A4tStuttgart.

We are seeking an experienced, resourceful, hands-on marketing professional who can drive Miaplaza’s advertising, brand-building, and SEO initiatives. The Director of Marketing manages and grows the marketing team and works closely with senior management and our product and content teams to build world-class K-12 education services and solutions. The ideal candidate has a deep understanding of Facebook and Google advertising, is comfortable working with data analytics and marketing metrics, and brings an appreciation for the unique requirements of online education marketing.

**Key Responsibilities:**

Online Marketing & Paid Advertising

* Develop and manage paid advertising campaigns across various platforms (e.g., Facebook Ads, Google Ads, YouTube Ads) to reach parents, educators, and students effectively and efficiently.
* Analyze campaign performance data and optimize campaigns and budgets based on key metrics (e.g., cost-per-acquisition, conversion rate, return on investment).
* Stay up-to-date on best practices for online advertising platforms and adapt strategies accordingly.
* Experiment with new ad formats and targeting options to maximize reach and engagement.
* Develop and implement a comprehensive SEO strategy.
* Identify and leverage partnerships with relevant online communities and influencers.

User Acquisition

* Lead and manage user acquisition campaigns across various channels (e.g., paid advertising, organic search, content marketing, partnerships).
* Analyze marketing data and performance metrics to identify areas for improvement and optimize campaigns.
* Collaborate with the product development team to ensure effective messaging and positioning of new offerings.

Brand Management & Communications

* Build and strengthen the Miaplaza brand identity and reputation.
* Develop and manage comprehensive communication strategies across all channels (e.g., website, social media, email, public relations).
* Oversee the creation of high-quality marketing materials, including website content, blog posts, social media posts, email campaigns, and press releases.

Strategic Leadership

* Develop and execute a comprehensive marketing strategy aligned with Miaplaza's vision and growth objectives.
* Manage our current marketing team and grow the department.
* Conduct market research and competitor analysis to identify opportunities and threats, and inform strategic decisions.
* Stay informed about emerging trends in online education and marketing technology to ensure Miaplaza stays competitive and innovative.
* Employ first-principles thinking to gain a deep understanding of core objectives and customer needs, while critically assessing and challenging both existing approaches and conventional marketing wisdom.

**Requirements:**

* Full-time availability
* Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Business Administration, Marketing, Technology or a related field.
* Minimum of 3 years’ experience in online marketing, paid online advertising and SEO.
* Proficiency in data analysis and reporting.
* Strong writing and editing skills.
* Experience with managing other marketing professionals.
* Understanding of the EdTech space and its trends is a plus.
* Passion for education and a commitment to improving learning outcomes.

**Benefits:** We offer health, dental, and vision insurance for all full-time employees! Our health insurance also includes specialty care like fertility benefits and chiropractic care. We want our employees to have the care and support they need.

* Health insurance
* Dental insurance
* Vision insurance
* 401(k) with employer matching
* Employee assistance program
* Flexible schedule
* Flexible spending account
* Health savings account
* Life insurance
* Paid time off
* Parental leave
* Employee discounts
* Paid floating holidays
* Tuition assistance

Please include a cover letter detailing why you would be a good candidate for this position, a resume, and professional references.

**Job Type:** Full-time, exempt employee

**Salary:** $80,000 - $120,000 annual salary

**Work Location:** Remote

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $80,000.00 - $120,000.00 per year

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* 401(k) matching
* Dental insurance
* Employee assistance program
* Employee discount
* Flexible schedule
* Flexible spending account
* Health insurance
* Health savings account
* Paid time off
* Parental leave
* Retirement plan
* Tuition reimbursement
* Vision insurance

Schedule:

* Choose your own hours

Work Location: Remote

title: Marketing Manager
description:
Working 100% remotely, with flexible hours, as a part of a growing and thriving team, this rewarding position is exclusively for those with experience in digital marketing, to help drive results for clients. You'll be learning new software, diving into marketing techniques, helping to think of and implement ideas, while being part of a growing company.


**About Us:**


*We help lawn, landscape, & outdoor living companies eliminate instability, fuel growth, and shape a lasting legacy with year-round, specialized marketing systems.* *We are passionate team of people - who recognize we are making a difference in our clients lives.* *Our clients choose and stay with HALSTEAD because we deliver best-in-class results and ROI while establishing and maintaining meaningful relationships!*


*Highly regarded as an industry leader, we are growing quickly! We are active leaders in pushing the rapidly growing landscape industry forward through education and partnerships with prominent associations and brands.*


**Benefits/Salary/Perks:**


* Salary range $45,000-$65,000 annually (based on depth of marketing experience).
* 100% remote, flexible work hours.
* 100% health insurance premium paid by company.
* 50% of dental premium paid by company.
* Optional vision insurance.
* 401k with 100% match on the first 3% of compensation + 50% match on the next 2% of compensation
* Paid training/professional development.
* Snack, coffee, and tea subscriptions.
* Paid holidays.
* 15 PTO days in your first year with more added each year.


**High-level responsibilities include:**



To be happy in this role, you will want to have a hunger for learning, a drive for attention to detail, passion to do things the right way, even when no one is looking and not be afraid to ask questions. A college degree is not necessary. It’s the curiosity, drive, & pride that help here. You'll be bringing your marketing experience in one more of these digital marketing disciplines: Meta Ads, Google Ads, SEO, Copywriting, SEO, Blog publishing, social media content development, Email Marketing, Bing Ads, and/or Linkedin Ads. The ideal candidate has experience in multiple disciplines.



Your daily work will include a dynamic list of work including things such curating images, posting on Facebook, reorganizing the company's marketing reporting dashboards, creating review management accounts, running Meta Ads, or publishing an article. While you won't experience work in all of these examples, the work you contribute to will depend on a combination of your skills, company needs, and your interests.


**Tactical responsibilities, typical day stuff:**

  


* Creating initial social media campaigns, account setups for cold, retargeting, events, videos, +.
* Managing existing campaigns - retargeting, cold, optimizing for lead generation by using alternative campaign types, creating new audiences, and/or new ads.
* Write compelling, relevant copy.
* Creating graphics to use in ads on Canva, and sometimes working with our graphic designer for more advanced campaigns/needs.
* Developing and sharing new ideas on ways to reach, or exceed goals.
* Analyzing data and asking questions, identifying issues and coming up with ideas.
* Conducting market research.
* Conduct competitor analysis.
* Review data in Semrush.
* Proactively research the latest data and updates to paid media platforms.
* Preparing statuses, updating reports/updates.
* Initiating, or attending zoom meetings with team members for collaboration, training, and workshops.
* Diving into learning/training on advanced integration for ongoing improvements in or troubleshooting tracking forms and calls from websites.
* Document changes in company training/process platform.
* Setup events on paid media and drive campaigns.
* Post already-written articles to blogs/websites.
* Create emails using existing email templates
* Update reputation management accounts.
* Setting up new call tracking accounts
* Assist with one time internal initiatives and projects that results in improved client satisfaction and/or process improvements.
* Support client facing team, and have client facing exposure when team members are on PTO.
* Conduct keyword and location research.
* Other marketing initiatives.
* Post already-written articles to blogs/websites.
* Work with writers to help them get info they need to complete articles.
* Add customers to email lists.
* Setting up new call tracking accounts
* Help troubleshoot a call tracking issue.
* Help organize training material.
* Update scheduling software.
* Identify lessons learned that can be applied to future clients and projects.
* Identify best practices and opportunities for project teams to improve their effectiveness and efficiency.
* Document and share business requirements and updates.
* Identify, implement, and document process improvements in training software.
* Assist with documenting monthly budget and resource reporting and analysis.
* Update Asana task and project templates and other project management tools.
* Assist with one time internal initiatives and projects that results in improved client satisfaction and/or process improvements.


**To feel great about the job you’re doing and in order to be successful you’ll want to have the following:**



* Dependable: in a remote world, your teammates, and our clients, have to be able to depend on you in terms of timeline and quality of work.
* Working knowledge/understanding and experience in multiple disciplines of digital marketing.
* Organizational skills: You’ll be juggling different tasks, account managers needs, other tasks, meetings, deadlines, +.
* Time-management skills: To be successful in this role you’ll need to be able to prioritize your time where it will make the most impact.
* Technical and computer skills: You’ll use tools like Slack, SemRush, HubSpot, Asana, and Zoom, Mailchimp, among many other tools.
* Drive and self-motivation: This role requires you to be goal-oriented, self-driven, and motivated to push yourself to succeed.
* A willingness and desire to learn new things and commitment to personal and team development.


**Measurable areas of success, how you will know that you are doing a great job:**


* Client and Team happiness/feedback of experience and deliverables.
* Not missing small details.
* Timely delivery of Tasks/Projects.

  


* **Please note: Due to excessive fraud we are seeing in the recruiting industry at the moment, please note:**


* **We will not ask you for personal information like your home address, banking info via pdf - we may however ask you for a written interview that will not include personal identifiable info.**
* **We don't mail checks or payments for anything, during the interview process, including towards equipment. We actually never mail check payments!!**
* **We won't ask for payment from you!**


***If you are in doubt about whether or not a contact to you is a legitimate HALSTEAD employee, please feel free to text our business line at 845-475-8162 to verify identity. We are only able to respond with yes or no at this number and not able to provide status or other details :).***

title: Manager, Marketing Research & Operations
description:
**Pay Philosophy**
The typical starting salary range for this role is determined by a number of factors including skills, experience, education, certifications and location. The full salary range for this role reflects the competitive labor market value for all employees in these positions across the national market and provides an opportunity to progress as employees grow and develop within the role. Some roles at Liberty Mutual have a corresponding compensation plan which may include commission and/or bonus earnings at rates that vary based on multiple factors set forth in the compensation plan for the role.

 **Description**Responsible for marketing operations and research. Leads team that is tasked with planning and operations across all GRS NA marketing deliverables. Conducts market surveys and research, to inform progress of GRS NA with clients and brokers and to understand areas of strength and opportunity, engaging with business partners to refine strategies. Designs, manages, and/or supports high impact projects across the entire SBU. Drives adoption of marketing tools and technologies.

 **Responsibilities**

  

1. Responsible for overseeing the development, implementation and execution of intelligence (consumer, competitor, market, industry) and marketing analysis efforts. Identifies trends and insights from across research studies to define new issues and opportunities. Influences decision makers to consider and take action on insights.
  

2. Performs operational analysis and coordinates operational excellence across the marketing team. Provides thorough analysis within market, micro/macro, and competitive landscapes. Engages with external creative agency and media partners to support GRSNA priorities.
  

3. Leads identification, management of and adoption of of marketing tools and technologies to support our frontline discussions. Sponsors projects that drive change across GRSNA Marketing or the SBU as a whole.
  

4. Designs, manages, and/or supports high impact projects for GRSNA in the areas of marketing strategy development, competitive analysis, and special studies.
  

5. Identify strategic and operating issues associated with projects that lead to new projects and analyses. Coaches, develops and motivates direct reports.
  

6. Provides feedback, training, guidance and development of direct reports and other cross functional professionals. Defines individual objectives, evaluates and holds team accountable to high performance. Provides feedback for growth improvements and development plans. Ensures team alignment with project and unit objectives.

**Qualifications*** In-depth comprehensive, relevant and current knowledge and understanding of buyers, segments, brokers, competitors and market conditions.
* Advanced knowledge and experience with business and marketing strategy.
* Ability to translate key business and marketplace insights into actionable strategies.
* In depth knowledge of different types of marketing research, including the benefits and limitations of each.
* Expert knowledge of marketing databases and querying tools.
* Proven ability to influence other leaders across an organization.
* Ability to adapt style to fit situational need and work well in the face of ambiguity.
* Management experience and/or advanced business degree preferred.
* Ability to communicate effectively and persuasively to achieve impactful strategies across the organization as normally acquired through a bachelor's degree in a business-related field (or equivalent experience) As normally acquired through 10+ years of progressively more responsible and related work experience.

**About Us**
At Liberty Mutual, our purpose is to help people embrace today and confidently pursue tomorrow. That's why we provide an environment focused on openness, inclusion, trust and respect. Here, you'll discover our expansive range of roles, and a workplace where we aim to help turn your passion into a rewarding profession.  

  

Liberty Mutual has proudly been recognized as a "Great Place to Work" by Great Place to Work® US for the past several years. We were also selected as one of the "100 Best Places to Work in IT" on IDG's Insider Pro and Computerworld's 2020 list. For many years running, we have been named by Forbes as one of America's Best Employers for Women and one of America's Best Employers for New Graduates as well as one of America's Best Employers for Diversity. To learn more about our commitment to diversity and inclusion please visit: https://jobs.libertymutualgroup.com/diversity-inclusion  

  

We value your hard work, integrity and commitment to make things better, and we put people first by offering you benefits that support your life and well-being. To learn more about our benefit offerings please visit: https://LMI.co/Benefits  

  

Liberty Mutual is an equal opportunity employer. We will not tolerate discrimination on the basis of race, color, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, religion, age, disability, veteran's status, pregnancy, genetic information or on any basis prohibited by federal, state or local law.

**Fair Chance Notices**

* California
* San Francisco
* Los Angeles
* Philadelphia

title: Marketing Manager
description:
```Job Overview:  
We are seeking a highly skilled and motivated Marketing Manager to join our team. As a Marketing Manager, you will be responsible for developing and implementing marketing strategies to promote our products and services. You will work closely with cross-functional teams to drive product awareness, generate leads, and increase customer engagement. If you have a passion for marketing and a proven track record of success, we want to hear from you!

You drive sales for the company and profit 10% - 15% of total sale per order/transaction. You’d be promoting your 5% off first order coupon using “Your-Code” to target new customers on any physical or digital platform to drive sales. We should be able to track your sales by tracing orders that redeemed your coupon code. You are encouraged to request access to our social media platforms in order to drive sales. You can use any sales tactics of your choice and comfort to drive sales. You can cold call, email, contact near by residents via mail or email to market the shop. Based on your experience, you’ll eventually be able to request current customers contact to market to our clients.

This position provides a fair opportunity to individuals that are willing to secure a living. Your earnings are based on your work. You are your own boss and staff. You will not be monitored or micromanaged. The more sales you drive, the more you earn. There is no such thing as maximum limit in this role.

There are many sport events around the city, tech companies during the day and meetings as well as parties everyday. You can use your sales tactics to sell Pizzas to these parties. We can provide some sources to contact the customers but you will be contacting them via phone, email or in person at your own convenience. Who wouldn’t want Pizza? Its your mission to find customers, we will take care of having the orders ready and delivered to their footsteps.

Job Types: Full-time, Part-time

Pay: $500.00 - $10,000.00 per week

Expected hours: 16 – 40 per week

Benefits:

* Employee discount
* Flexible schedule
* Retirement plan

Schedule:

* 10 hour shift
* 12 hour shift
* 4 hour shift
* 8 hour shift
* Day shift
* Monday to Friday
* Weekends as needed

Supplemental pay types:

* Commission pay

Work Location: Remote

title: Marketing and Events Coordinator
description:
**Company**: Merge Labs, Inc. (Merge)  

**Role**: Marketing and Events Coordinator  

**Location**: United States, Work from Home + travel  

**Benefits**: Comprehensive Medical/Dental/Life and Stock Option Plan  

**Compensation**: $60,000

 **About Merge**:  

Merge is an educational technology company that develops the award-winning Merge Cube and hands-on digital learning platform, Merge EDU. Our product ecosystem is a curriculum-aligned augmented reality solution for K-12 classrooms, libraries, STEM labs and makerspaces. Our customers are K-12 educators, administrators, and leaders.

 **Your Mission:**  

We are looking for an energetic Marketing and Events Coordinator to plan and execute marketing initiatives. These include, but are not limited to coordinating and representing Merge at events around the country, cultivating press coverage and influencers, creating presentations, and creating marketing collateral. As you achieve success at Merge, you will have growth opportunities to build and lead teams. This position will involve frequent travel.

 **Responsibilities:**

* Plan, coordinate and attend events around the country. This includes managing logistics and helping set up and staff Merge’s trade show presence
* Brainstorm, research and coordinate potential PR and marketing initiatives and programs
* Cultivate relationships with education influencers
* Host webinars about Merge EDU
* Manage Facebook group / help create engagement across social media
* Brainstorm and coordinate creation of marketing collateral assets

 **Qualifications:**

* Bachelor’s degree in marketing, business, technology, or equivalent experience
* 2+ years of experience relevant to the Responsibility stated above. Experience performing such responsibilities for education technology is preferred
* Highly proficient, articulate and accurate with both written and verbal communication, including presentations
* Outstanding interpersonal skills is required
* Strong organization skills is required
* Flexible approach, able to navigate uncertainty and change
* Ability and willingness to travel for events on a fairly regular basis (expected to be approximately 2 per month) is a requirement
* Driven, self-motivated, enthusiastic and with a “can do” attitude

title: Budget & Traffic Coordinator
description:
**About the team**
------------------


Zillow is building a world-class creative organization that drives the vision and development of compelling Brand, B2C and B2B communications for all customer touchpoints in the U.S. As a brand, Zillow brought transparency to the real estate market 15+ years ago by allowing buyers and sellers to see the value of every home—and we are reinventing the industry again. Today, we're going beyond search and find and helping our customers get home by connecting them to Premier Agents, Zillow Home Loans, and new tools and resources that make it easier for them to get the home of their dreams, whether they're buying or renting.
  

Zillow’s in-house agency, StudioZ, is responsible for delivering relevant and engaging experiences for our customers and partners through understanding the business and delivering compelling creative ideas and content across all mediums, including integrated campaigns and channel specific content, activations, and experiences.  

ZMedia is the team that develops the marketing strategy and execution of paid channels (including Video, Audio, Digital, Search, Social, etc) to meet business goals. We help people discover Zillow and connect them to our tools and services to get them into their next home. Our growing team is customer focused, collaborative, data-informed, and innovative. We work with a breadth of partners to support business goals and deliver impactful marketing campaigns.**About the role**
------------------


Enjoy making complex work look effortless? Constantly looking for opportunities for greater integration, efficiency, and collaboration within the team and beyond? If you like the details, connecting dots, creating clarity, and leading continuous improvement, then we want to hear from you!


We are seeking a Budget and Traffic Coordinator to join our engaged and highly skilled Studio and Media teams driving the trafficking process and monthly billing by collaborating with Studio Project Management, Media leads and other agency teams.


We are looking for someone who can be a trusted partner to media and project managers as well as across the marketing organization. This role requires a strong collaborator who is invested in the success of the team!

**You Will Get To**
-------------------

**Lead ongoing implementation of our billing and trafficking process, by:**

* Owning the full cycle of media billing (purchase orders, payments, and reconciliation) by serving as a liaison across involved teams; Finance, AP, media, media agency.
* Collaborating with team leads and agency to ensure billing accuracy.
* Preparing ad-hoc reports and analysis as necessary
* Working with cross functional teams to develop key process improvements such as workflow, information organization, standardization, and process documentation.
* Leading and executing the creative trafficking process across all channels.
* Using your keen analytical mind for understanding how projects, people, and processes can work together for maximum efficiency.
* Bringing current knowledge of media, accounting, and project management together.


This role has been categorized as a Remote position. “Remote” employees do not have a permanent corporate office workplace and, instead, work from a physical location of their choice which must be identified to the Company. Employees may live in any of the 50 US States, with limited exceptions. In certain cases, an employee in a remote-designated job may need to live in a specific region or time zone to support customers or clients as part of their role.
In California, Colorado, Connecticut, Hawaii, Nevada, New York and Washington the standard base pay range for this role is $62,400.00 - $99,600.00 Annually. This base pay range is specific to California, Colorado, Connecticut, Hawaii, Nevada, New York and Washington and may not be applicable to other locations.
In addition to a competitive base salary this position is also eligible for equity awards based on factors such as experience, performance and location. Actual amounts will vary depending on experience, performance and location.**Who you are**
---------------

**Who you are:**

* Bachelor’s Degree with emphasis on Business, Media Advertising and/or Finance.
* Detail oriented and highly accurate with the initiative to follow through and prioritize various workloads.
* Able to multi-task, solve problems and work within timelines in a professional and objective manner.
* Excellent verbal and written communication, organizational, interpersonal, and analytical skills.
* Proficient in MS Office and skilled in Excel.
* Solid understanding of accounting principles and terminology.
* Agency experience and media background is a plus.

**Get to know us**
------------------


Zillow is reimagining real estate to make home a reality for more and more people.


As the most-visited real estate website in the United States, Zillow® and its affiliates help movers find and win their home through digital solutions, first class partners, and easier buying, selling, financing and renting experiences. Millions of people visit Zillow Group sites every month to start their home search, and now they can rely on Zillow to help make it easier to move. The work we do helps people get home and no matter what job you're in, you will play a critical role in making home a reality for more and more people.


Our efforts to streamline the real estate transaction are supported by a deep-rooted culture of innovation, our passion to redefine the employee experience, a fundamental commitment to Equity and Belonging, and world-class benefits. These benefits include comprehensive medical, dental, vision, life, and disability coverages as well as parental leave, family benefits, retirement contributions, and paid time off. We’re also setting the standard for work experiences of the future, where our employees are supported in doing their best work and living a flexible, well-balanced life. But don’t just take our word for it. Read recent reviews on Glassdoor and recent recognition from multiple organizations, including: the 100 Best Companies to Work For, Glassdoor Employees’ Choice Award, Bloomberg Gender-Equality Index, Human Rights Campaign (HRC) Corporate Equity Index, and TIME 100 Most Influential Companies list.

*Zillow Group is an equal opportunity employer committed to fostering an inclusive, innovative environment with the best employees. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please contact us at RecruitingAccessibility@zillowgroup.com.*

*Applicants who receive job offers from Zillow Group will be asked to sign a Proprietary Rights Agreement which includes confidentiality, intellectual property assignment, customer and employee non-solicitation, and non-competition provisions. If you are contacted for a role at Zillow Group and wish to review a copy of the Proprietary Rights Agreement prior to receiving an offer, you may request a copy from your Recruiter.*

title: Marketing Events Manager
description:
Your responsibilities


* Events are one of the most important marketing channels within Olympus. The Marketing Events Manager is responsible for supporting the delivery of the region-UI event and exhibition strategy, through partnering with Business Units and Marketing to identify key events, leading on event planning and administrative processes, and supporting Marketing with the creation and delivery
  

Key responsibilities
  

  

Lead delivery of the OUI marketing annual events strategy, to include full planning processes, maintenance and communication of the events calendar and supporting Business Units outline event plans, objectives and delivery of KPIs.
  

Partner with Marketing colleagues to ensure effective management of all event deliverables, including booth concept, design, production, execution and marcoms.
  

Attendance and stand management at key industry events.
  
* Lead delivery of Event2Lead processes in ACE. Partnering with Business Units to ensure leads are followed-up within appropriate timeframes.
Gain and document necessary data from events (e.g., event participants, costs, booth visits, attendees to symposia and workshops).
  

Lead on annualised event supplier review processes.
  

Representing region OUI on event/congress related matters.
  

Contribute to marketing meetings.
  

Undertake other duties as required.
  
Your qualification


Degree (or comparable) in event management or related field desirable.
  

Min. 5 years of work experience in planning and managing events/exhibitions, preferably for medical congresses or in another B2B field.
  

Strong agile project management
  

Results oriented and diligent
  

Excellent team player using with ability to align people with different functions on different hierarchy levels (collateral leadership)
  

Highly motivated.
  

Willing to challenge the status quo to improve.
  

Ability to present complex information in a structured and balanced manner.
  

Strong numerical and analytical skills with the ability to plan, focus, and execute.
  

Clear and concise written and spoken communication skills.
  

Willing to travel and occasionally work unsocial hours subject to business requirements.
  

Computer skills including Microsoft Office suite.
  
Your competencies


Patient Focus
  

Integrity
  

Innovation
  

Impact
  

Empathy
  
Your benefits


* Generous annual leave entitlement
* Comprehensive company pension scheme
* Private medical cover
* Free annual health check
* Subsidised gym membership
* Employee discounts

title: Copywriter / Content Writer
description:
Our ideal candidate for the position of Copywriter/Content Writer embodies the perfect fusion of creativity and strategic thinking. At Designity, we're in search of an individual who can seamlessly blend the art of storytelling with proactive problem-solving skills. This individual will be instrumental in driving engagement and delivering impactful content across various platforms.


Whether specializing as a Copywriter, Content Writer, or both, our ideal candidate possesses a versatile skill set. From crafting compelling narratives to optimizing content for SEO, they have a keen eye for detail and a knack for captivating audiences. Collaboration is key at Designity, and our ideal Copywriter/Content Writer thrives in a team environment, working closely with internal stakeholders to ensure that every piece of content aligns with brand messaging and objectives.

  

Designity is a subscription-based (https://www.designity.com/pricing) collaborative creative platform that enables creatives and businesses to collaborate more effectively through unique and innovative model (https://www.designity.com/). This collaborative approach has convinced both small and large companies, including Calendly, Kung Fu Tea, and Marriott Hotels, to use Designity for their design and marketing efforts instead of traditional, costly, and inefficient alternatives.


We are transforming the creative industry, moving away from outdated and ineffective marketing and design methods (https://www.designity.com/compare). Companies typically hire in-house designers, which is costly, time-consuming, skill-limiting, and requires substantial supervision. Working with traditional design and marketing agencies offers an alternative but at a high cost. Marketplaces like Upwork and Fiverr claim to offer a more affordable solution, but their model lacks reliability and optimization for creative services, causing frustration for businesses.


While we still operate like a startup (it can get very fast-paced at times) we are in full scale- up mode. If you are looking for a clear career growth plan, fully remote work, flexible hours, the opportunity to work a variety of projects, and quality content for your portfolio, Designity is the place for you to learn, develop, and grow into the creative thought leader that you've always wanted to be.


**Responsibilities:**


* Creative Content Development: Crafting engaging content, including captivating campaigns and informative blogs, to effectively showcase client projects and products, resonating with diverse audiences.
* Strategic SEO Implementation: Employing SEO best practices to optimize content, driving web traffic and improving online visibility to enhance the reach and impact of our messaging.
* Cross-Functional Collaboration: Collaborating closely with the Creative Director and internal teams to gather product content for utilization across various channels, ensuring consistency in brand messaging and coherence in communication.
* Voice and Tone Management: Developing content guidelines to establish the tone and voice of the brand, ensuring alignment with overarching brand strategies to maintain brand identity and integrity.
* Continuous Improvement: Keeping abreast of industry trends and best practices, providing valuable input on project plans, and sharing content management best practices with internal stakeholders to foster ongoing improvement and growth.


**Qualifications:**


* Diverse Background: Whether you specialize as a Copywriter, Content Writer, or possess experience in both roles with experience ranging from 1 year as an Emerging Creative to 10 plus years as a Professional Creative, we welcome individuals with a diverse background in content creation.
* Strong Writing Skills: Capable of crafting engaging narratives that resonate with various audiences, demonstrating proficiency in language and storytelling.
* SEO Expertise: Proficiency in optimizing content for search engines, ensuring maximum visibility and engagement across various platforms.
* Creative Problem-Solving: Proven ability to approach challenges with creativity and strategic thinking, finding innovative solutions to drive engagement and achieve objectives.
* Collaborative Nature: Thrives in a team environment, adept at working closely with internal stakeholders to ensure alignment with brand messaging and objectives.
* Adaptability: Ability to adapt writing style and tone to suit the needs of different projects and audiences, while maintaining consistency with brand identity.
* Attention to Detail: Keen eye for detail, with a commitment to delivering error-free content that meets high-quality standards.
* Time Management: Effective at managing deadlines and prioritizing tasks in a fast-paced environment, delivering high-quality work on schedule.
* Passion for Creativity: Genuine passion for storytelling and creativity, with a drive to make a meaningful impact through impactful content creation.


**Additional Information:**


* Fully remote - Opportunity to work as a 1099 freelancer or full-time employee.
* 401(k) and health insurance benefits after 3 months as a W-2 employee.
* Flexible paid vacations, company holidays, and mental health days for all W-2 employees.
* Flexible hours within the USA and Canada.
* Opportunity to expand your portfolio with unique projects.
* “No Meetings Monday's, and Wednesday's”


*At Designity, all employment decisions are based on business needs, qualifications, and merit. Designity is an Equal Opportunity Employer. The more inclusive we are, the better our work will be. We believe that a workforce diverse in cultures, perspectives, skills, and experiences will benefit our team, clients, and products.*


**Creative Disclaimer:**


*In order to be considered for this position, it is required that you include a portfolio of your relevant work and any specific projects as requested in the application. Without these materials, your application will not be reviewed.*


*Compensation is based on experience level: $36,000 - $80,000 + bonus*

title: Marketing Manager
description:
**Summary:**



The Marketing Manager will have a proven track record in developing and executing successful marketing campaigns, a deep understanding of consumer behavior, and the ability to collaborate across cross-functional teams. As a key member of our team, the Marketing Manager will play a crucial role in developing and implementing strategic marketing plans to drive brand awareness, customer acquisition, customer engagement, and business growth.

  


**Roles & Responsibilities:**


* Create and execute multi-channel marketing plans to drive awareness, engagement and sales, aligning with overall business objectives.


* Manage the brand and consumer journey, ensuring consistency across all consumer touchpoints.


* Work closely with ecommerce, sales, product marketing, partnerships and operations teams to ensure cohesive and aligned strategies.


* Be the voice of our customer internally.


* Collaborate with design and creative teams to develop compelling marketing campaigns and content.


* Utilize data analytics to measure and optimize the performance of digital campaigns.


* Monitor and report on the return on investment (ROI) of marketing activities.


* Manage marketing budgets effectively, ensuring optimal allocation of resources for maximum impact.


* Performs other duties as required.

  


**Education & Experience:**


* Bachelor's degree in Marketing, Business, or a related field. MBA is a plus.


* Proven experience (5+ years) in evolving marketing roles with consumer companies; Consumer Packaged Goods (CPG) experience preferred.


* Strong understanding of effective customer and acquisition marketing tactics, digital marketing, the marketing ecosystem and consumer behavior.


* Analytical mindset with a focus on data-driven decision-making.


* Excellent written and verbal communication and interpersonal skills.


* Proficiency in project management tools and marketing software.

  


**Functional/Technical Knowledge, Skills & Abilities:**


* Organizational skills with an ability to take initiative and multitask.


* Problem-solving skills in standardized situations.


* Ability to work in both team and independent environments.


* Proficiency in Microsoft Office


* Positive attitude and commitment to company values.


* Sense of urgency and ownership of tasks.


* Flexibility to adapt to fluctuating business demands.


* Passion for earth-derived medicinal products.

  


**Physical Demands and Work Environment:**


* Physical agility and stamina may be required.


* Ability to sit or stand for extended periods.


* Manual dexterity for repetitive tasks.

  


**Compensation:**



$95,000.00 - $107,500.00 salary

  


**Benefits:**



Charlotte's Web offers a diverse, quality work environment, a great compensation package, and a comprehensive benefits package. Our benefits include medical/dental/vision insurance, pet insurance, 401K match, short and long-term disability, flexible PTO, and sick time. We are an Equal Opportunity Employer.



Employees may be eligible for a discretionary bonus in addition to base pay. Annual bonuses are designed to reward individual contributions as well as allow employees to share in company results.



Recruiting for this role ends on 3/6/2024.

  


**Location:**



US required. We are pleased to offer this opportunity in CA, CO, CT, FL, IL, MA, MI, NY, OH, TN, TX, VA, & WI.

title: Program Marketing Manager
description:
The organization is responsible for repurposing and synthesizing engaging content using the appropriate digital channels such as literature, eBooks, blogs, videos, web, or social media for deployment. The objective is to present a compelling and consistent brand to our customers and target markets. The Marcom team works globally to ensure our content and processes align with all regions, such as the Americas, Greater China, Asia Pacific, and EMEAI.

**The Program Marketing Managers are experts in these three key areas:**

* **Design campaigns and programs** — create strategic and tactical plans based on campaign objectives and goals for industry and solution segments and product portfolio categories.
* **Marketing mix of tactics and channels** — defining whether reputation, awareness, consideration, demand generation, digital, or other outbound marketing push best fit the program’s requirements. Activities include crafting and deploying email journeys, advertising plans, social media content, and other marketing instruments to support campaign goals.
* **End-to-end management** — Measure the impact and success of the program with the ability to quickly pivot to change the Marcom mix if metrics are not meeting the established objectives.

The Program Marketing Manager role partners with industry solution managers, product marketing managers, and content experts to create the campaign program while coordinating and aligning with other departments such as field marketing. The Program Marketing Manager will also leverage and repurpose content to create collateral assets such as white papers, web pages, case studies, brochures, blogs, and social posts.

**Responsibilities:**

* Performs end-to-end campaign management by identifying the appropriate mix of marketing tactics to achieve specified campaign goals set by the campaign lead.

Optimizes campaign performance by conducting actionable reviews with respective stakeholders.

* Creates a strategy plan for various outbound marketing assets to support the marketing tactics identified across various stages of the buying journey using respective digital channels to increase demand, awareness, and thought leadership.
* Develops compelling content by repurposing existing assets — synthesizing and elevating for top and mid-funnel uses while ensuring editorial quality.

Creates, monitors, and publishes campaign results using visual metrics to measure the effectiveness of the tactics.

* Collaborates with cross-functional teams — from creative design, product marketing, web, and legal to produce effective promotional materials.

**Requirements:**

* **10 month position with possibility of extension**
* **Work Location: Remote- US**
* **Looking for someone with ~7 years experience**
* **Bachelor’s degree (business / marketing)** or equivalent plus four to five years in a high-tech marketing communications (Marcom) role.
* **Experience creating Marcom campaign programs** with successful execution using a mix of digital channels.
* **Excellent English-speaking / writing, communication, and presentation skills with a proven track record of journalistic and editorial content creation and editing.**
* Passion for writing engaging professional technology-based content.
* Experience in leading and managing the execution of processes, projects, and tactics.
* Ability to work independently to prioritize tactics based on importance and urgency to meet deadlines.
* **Excellent working knowledge of digital marketing tools, preferably Eloqua, and content management workflow tools.**

Job Types: Full-time, Contract

Salary: Up to $55.00 per hour

Expected hours: 40 per week

Education:

* Bachelor's (Required)

Experience:

* Program Marketing Manager: 7 years (Required)
* creating Marcom campaign programs: 7 years (Required)
* Marketing communications: 7 years (Required)
* journalistic and editorial content creation and editing: 5 years (Required)
* writing technology-based content: 4 years (Required)
* digital marketing tools: 6 years (Required)
* Eloqua: 5 years (Required)
* content management workflow tools: 6 years (Required)
* Design campaigns and programs: 5 years (Required)
* Marketing mix of tactics and channels: 5 years (Required)
* Creates, monitors, and publishes campaign results: 7 years (Required)
* End-to-end marketing management: 7 years (Required)

Work Location: Remote

title: Marketing Account Manager (Remote)
description:
**Join the Jairus Marketing Adventure!** **Account Manager Wanted!**

  

We’re looking for someone with **marketing agency experience** to join our team! *Applicants not meeting this requirement will not be considered for the position.* Please be sure your resume reflects the agencies you have worked with.

  

On your resume or cover letter, we want to see examples of the following:


* Experience managing multiple (8-10) clients using multiple marketing channels.
* A track record of delivering projects on/ahead of schedule.
* Your comfort level in a fast-paced environment.
* Experience pulling data out of/editing at least one of the industry-leading CRMs (Salesforce, HubSpot, Marketo).

  


*Please note: Applicants that do not meet these requirements will not be considered for the position.*

  

**The Role: Account Manager**



As an integral part of our Client Success team, Account Managers are the vital link between our clients and our internal fulfillment team. Working in collaboration with Jairus Account Directors, you'll play a key role in executing client strategy, ensuring project excellence, and nurturing client relationships.

  

**Responsibilities:**


* **Strategic Execution Support:** Assist Account Directors in executing client strategy and delivering SOW on time and at the expected quality and quantity.
* **Process Expertise:** Understand and follow internal processes and workflows, utilizing project management systems to ensure timely and budget-friendly client work delivery.
* **Digital Platform Proficiency:** Be familiar with social/digital platforms, advertising platforms, CRMs, and email platforms to support client SOW execution.
* **Onboarding Wizard:** Facilitate new client onboarding efforts in collaboration with support team members.
* **Relationship Building:** Develop and maintain strong relationships with key accounts, participating in strategy and performance discussions to optimize client performance.
* **Results Reporting:** Adhere to results reporting SOPs, working with Account Directors to analyze and report metrics to clients.

  


**✨** **Requirements:**


* **Project Management Prowess:** Ability to manage multiple projects, deadlines, and changing priorities.
* **Client Relationship Guru:** Strong ability to build and maintain relationships with clients.
* **Communication Maestro:** Excellent communication and negotiation skills.
* **Project Brief Virtuoso:** Ability to gather information and assemble project briefs for presentation to internal teams.
* **Leadership Star:** Possess leadership qualities and the ability to work independently and as part of a team.
* **Healthcare Enthusiast:** Experience with healthcare clients is a plus!
* **Startup Spirit:** Eager to work in a fast-paced startup environment with many opportunities to grow and learn.
* **Speed Enthusiast:** Thrives in a fast-paced environment, making quick decisions without sacrificing quality.
* **Experienced Expert:** At least 2 years experience in a full service digital marketing agency specializing in B2B services.

  



**Jairus Marketing's Core Values:**


* **Christ-Driven:** Although it's not mandatory for our team to hold specific faith traditions, we're dedicated to steering the ship of our organization with the lively spirit of Christian principles like the Golden Rule *(Matthew 7:12)* and a Commitment to Excellence *(Colossians 3:23)*.
* **Committed to Excellence:** Our work matters, weaving magic that positively impacts others' well-being. People count on us for amazing things, and we're here to honor that request!
* **Team Dedication:** Marketing is a team sport—help your teammates, ask for help, and let's win together!
* **Continuous Improvement:** Stay at the forefront of the dynamic marketing terrain—strive to outshine yesterday and elevate our client service game!
* **Ambiguity Masters:** Navigate the gray zones of marketing with discernment and make informed decisions with limited information.

  



️ **Meet Our CEO:**



Curious about who we are and why we do what we do? Check out this video from our CEO: https://bit.ly/3IlMMru

 **Tech-Specs:** BYOL (Bring Your Own Laptop).

  


**EEO Statement:**



Jairus Marketing provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws.

title: SEO Manager
description:
Go Fish Digital is looking for a bright, motivated individual to bolster our team of top-notch SEOs.


The role of the SEO Strategist is to create and execute SEO strategies that align with our client's KPIs. They are responsible for meeting timelines and delivering high-quality work. An SEO Strategist leads the strategy by evaluating the work we've completed to determine its effectiveness. They adjust the strategy as needed to get the best results possible. The SEO Strategist communicates what we've done, the impact it's had, and the direction of the ongoing strategy so that clients can see the value of our work and understand how it aligns with the client's goals. They are problem solvers who can evaluate shifts in the organic search landscape. The SEO Strategist also seeks opportunities to collaborate with other channels to create a seamless cross-channel strategy.


**You will:**

  

* Oversee tactical work and execute strategy for technical and on-page deliverables around client's goals (pivot strategy when needed)
* Create in-depth reports that paint the story of the results
* Possess strong communication skills and the ability to explain SEO strategies simply and effectively
* Ensure the client understands SEO strategy (do they know why we're doing what we're doing)
* Support the overall SEO department strategies and growth
* Communicate gaps in SEO strategies and processes to the SEO leadership team to continue the growth and improvement of the department


**You should have some or all of the following attributes:**

  

* Demonstrate alignment with our company values and applied knowledge of search engine optimization
* Proven organizational, project, and time management skills
* Excellent communication and presentation skills, both written and verbal, with the ability to provide actionable insights for all levels of an organization
* Possess keen critical thinking and analytical skills
* Proven skills with Google Business Apps, especially Google Sheets
* Minimum of 2-3 years of hands-on experience managing SEO campaigns
* Experience with creating client strategy, communication, management, and proactive account performance troubleshooting
* Experience with industry-standard SEO tools such as Screaming Frog, Moz, Ahrefs, SEMRush, STAT, etc.
* Agency experience is a plus


**\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_**


**Guidelines for Your Application**


**What We Need:** Alongside your resume, craft a one-page cover letter that gives us some perspective into your unique journey and passion for this role. Don't forget to mention your salary expectations.


**Handling Attachments:** Some platforms can be tricky. If limited to one file, combine your resume and cover letter. Bonus points for work samples — links in CVs or resumes are good, too!


**The Weight of the Cover Letter:** It's more than just a formality – it's our first introduction to you. Make it count. Without it, your application won't be reviewed.


**Note on ‘Quick Apply':** This feature can sometimes miss essential details. Ensure all our requirements are met — incomplete applications won't progress.

  

**Adherence to these guidelines is paramount.**


Missing out will cost you a spot in the process. And then, we all miss out. And that bums us out. Don't bum us out. We value attention to detail, and this is your chance to show that off.


We appreciate the effort you put into your application and look forward to getting to know you better!


**\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_**


**Work Location**


Our office is located in downtown Raleigh, NC. We offer a flexible, hybrid work schedule so that you can work from home, at a coffee shop, or meet with your team in person at our Raleigh office if you are local to Raleigh.


We are open to remote work in the U.S. (preferably EST) for the right candidate.  

  

**Benefits & Culture**


We offer great health care benefits (with a significant portion paid by the company) and a flexible, balanced work schedule. With our trusting and flexible work culture comes responsibility, so you'll need to be disciplined enough to get things done without someone watching over your shoulder. We are looking for someone to bring great ideas and work above and beyond our core hours of 8:00 to 4:00 each day when needed.


We are proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees. Our community becomes more confident, creative, and productive when our team members can be authentic at work.

title: Marketing Product Manager
description:
Want to be part of an amazing team, hell-bent on crafting a better future? We're always looking for creative people who care!



We are analysts. Creators. Designers. Doers. Dreamers. Explorers. Geeks. Hipsters. Leaders. Learners. Renegades. Seekers. Strategists. Visionaries. And we fundamentally believe that we're better together.



We are looking for a **Marketing Product Manager** to join our enterprise tech client's team.


**Would you like to…**


* Be responsible for driving product value proposition design.
* Work closely with product development and engineering on planning, pricing, positioning, and business/revenue strategy for product(s).
* Oversee the development of company marketing programs.
* Be responsible for assessment of potential markets, product life cycle planning, go-to-market strategies, development of product strategies, definition of promotional activities and product launch.
* Play an instrumental part in designing, developing, and launching end-to-end marketing campaigns to drive lead opportunities for sales.


**We would like you to have…**


* 5-7 years work-related experience in a leadership role preferred.
* Enterprise experience is preferred.
* Marketing experience with high technology products preferred.
* B2B or B2C Marketing experience preferred.
* Strong project management and strategic skills required.
* Understands the sales and business cycle.
* Understands ROI Analysis.
* Excellent oral and written communication skills required.
* Must have strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
* Must have the ability to work under constant deadline pressure and manage multiple projects.
* Must be detail oriented, have strong cross group collaboration skills, pro-active and managing multiple projects is a must. Must know how to prioritize tasks.
* Experience with Microsoft products preferred.
* Web/online (HTML/SharePoint) experience preferred.


**Would you like to work for an organization that…**


* Embraces work-life balance – our employees' well-being remains a top priority for us
* Promotes a culture of learning and advocacy across the globe - diversity will enable us to strengthen our impact
* Offers a comprehensive benefits package effective Day 1. Options include health, vision, & dental insurance, FSAs, discounts on pet insurance, PTO, paid holidays, and more
* Encourages innovation and experimentation
* Emphasizes and rewards collaboration
* Works remotely. We continue to safeguard the health of our employees so our interviewing and on-boarding process will remain virtual until further notice


**Compensation Range:** $62-$67/hr.



This compensation range is indicative of the role. Compensation offered is on the basis of evaluation during interview process, the candidates range and depth of experience, business and market financials and internal pay parity.


**Want to know more?**



Check us out at https://www.designit.com/. Just so you know, we don't have a dress code, but we do have a strict no jerk policy.


*Designit is committed to ensuring that all candidates have an equal opportunity to be considered for employment. Please let us know if you need any reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process.*

title: Marketing Analyst
description:

title: Senior Enterprise Marketing Manager
description:
Please be aware we have noticed an increase in hiring scams potentially targeting Seismic candidates. Read our full statement on our Career's page.


#### **Seismic, a rapidly growing Forbes Cloud 100 company, i****s the global leader in enablement, helping make sales teams better by becoming more productive and engaging with buyers in a compelling way.** **Seismic's** **platform provides continuous guidance to improve behavior, content, and skills to win more deals and deliver better experiences. Nearly 2,000 organizations including IBM and American Express have made Seismic their enablement platform of choice. Seismic integrates with business-critical platforms including Microsoft, Salesforce, Google and Adobe.** **Seismic is headquartered in San Diego, with offices across North America, Europe, Australia and China.**


#### **Seismic is committed to building an inclusive workplace that ignites growth for our employees and creates a culture of belonging that allows all employees to be seen and valued for who they are. Learn more about DEI at Seismic** **here****.**


The Seismic North America Marketing team is looking for an experienced B2B ABM/field marketing leader who will be responsible for developing the marketing strategy for the Enterprise business segment and driving highly targeted ABX campaigns to generate net new and customer expansion pipeline and revenue growth. Accountable for meeting and exceeding quarterly and annual pipeline targets for this segment.



The ideal candidate is someone who excels at equal parts strategy and hands-on execution (across events, webinars, digital, social, email, content, web, and more), can lead cross-functional teams to deliver on time and on budget, and values a close partnership with sales leaders.



Reporting to the head of North America Marketing, you're responsible for working with leaders across sales, inside sales, product marketing, customer success and revenue operations to orchestrate multi-channel ABX campaigns that optimize the pipeline engine for the Enterprise segment in North America.


*This is an individual contributor role.*


**What you will be doing:**


* Drive the annual and quarterly Enterprise GTM/marketing strategy – focused on pipeline generation, pipeline acceleration and increased bookings – to meet short-term and future quarter pipeline targets for new and expansion business
* Design and execute highly targeted ABX campaigns (1:1 and 1:few) across all channels (including events, email, paid advertising, social, web, personalized content, gifting, webinars, workshops, direct mail and more) mapped to the customer lifecycle
* Project manage the various workstreams necessary to produce deliverables, assets and events aligned to ABX strategy
* Collaborate with revenue operations to build the right metrics, targets, routing and dashboards relevant to the Enterprise GTM
* Leverage ABX technology (i.e. 6Sense) for account tracking, personalization and intent, and help automate ABX/MQA workflows and insights for Sales
* Partner with Inside Sales to ensure they have guidance and resources to translate MQAs and leads into pipeline for the business
* Regularly share pipeline performance reporting and insights with senior leadership along with actionable recommendations for improvement
* Scope and manage Enterprise field marketing budget


**What you bring to the team:**


* 8-12 years of experience marketing to B2B Enterprise prospects and customers in a fast-paced environment
* A track record of launching successful ABX (1:1 and 1:few) and field campaigns that have resulted in pipeline generation, pipeline acceleration and increased bookings
* Understanding of customer experience journeys and touchpoints that leverage paid and unpaid channels (including events and digital events) to achieve business and marketing objectives
* Extensive experience working with sales, inside sales, product marketing and customer marketing in order to activate campaigns and programs
* A "test and learn" mindset with strong proficiency in marketing and sales analytics, including technologies like 6Sense, SFDC, Marketo
* Strong project management and time management skills – this is a "doer" role
* Strong partnership, people, and above average communications skills
* A drive to constantly learn, evolve, and share best practices


**What we have for you:**


* Generous paid vacation, sick leave, and holiday benefits, including an end-of-year company shutdown
* Competitive medical, dental and vision plans, as well as an optional Health Savings Account with a company contribution
* Paid parental leave and family caregiver leave
* Enhanced fertility and egg freezing benefits
* 401(k) plan with annual company match
* Monthly stipend for cell phone expenses
* Flexible work schedule
* Seismic Cares employee volunteer program
* #OneSeismic culture that celebrates wins, encourages autonomy, ownership, and transparency


#LI-LG1 #LI-Remote


Headquartered in San Diego and with employees across the globe, Seismic is the global leader in sales **enablement**, backed by firms such as Permira, Ameriprise Financial, EDBI, Lightspeed Venture Partners, and T. Rowe Price. Seismic also recently expanded its team and product portfolio with the acquisition of Percolate, Grapevine6, and Lessonly. Our board of directors is composed of several industry luminaries including John Thompson, former Chairman of the Board for Microsoft.



Seismic is an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to gender, age, race, religion, or any other classification which is protected by applicable law.


**Please note this job description is not designed to cover or contain a comprehensive listing of activities, duties or responsibilities that are required of the employee for this job. Duties, responsibilities and activities may change at any time with or without notice.**

title: Email Marketing Specialist
description:
**Email Marketer**  

An Email Marketer is a professional who oversees and executes email marketing strategies for a company. They are responsible for planning and implementing email campaigns, managing subscriber databases, creating engaging newsletters, and analyzing campaign performance. Their goal is to effectively reach the target audience, promote the brand, and drive customer engagement and sales through email communication.  

  

**What does an Email Marketer do?**  

An Email Marketer plays a crucial role in running successful email marketing campaigns. They identify the target audience, design and execute email campaigns, ensure the content is clear and error-free, and optimize email templates for mobile devices. They manage subscriber databases, analyze campaign metrics, and provide insights for improving campaign effectiveness. Additionally, they collaborate with other teams, such as content and design, to ensure consistent brand messaging and enhance customer communication through email channels.  

  

**Job brief**  

We are seeking a talented and experienced Email Marketer to spearhead our email marketing strategies.  

As the Email Marketer, you will be responsible for planning, executing, and optimizing end-to-end email marketing campaigns. This includes managing email databases, crafting engaging newsletters, and leveraging web technologies to drive sales growth.  

Your innovative ideas and deep understanding of customer engagement will be instrumental in promoting our brand, delivering valuable updates to our customers, and ensuring strong customer relationships.  

If you are passionate about email marketing and have a proven track record of success, we invite you to join our team and contribute to our company’s continued growth and success.  

  

**Responsibilities*** Identify target audience and grow our email list
* Design and implement direct email marketing campaigns
* Proofread emails for clarity, grammar and spelling
* Ensure mobile-friendly email templates
* Write newsletters including all company updates
* Upgrade our email templates using graphics, personalization and advanced features
* Ensure prompt and accurate communication with clients via email to minimize unsubscribes
* Create email databases for lead generation
* Analyze campaign performance and suggest improvements
* Report on sales revenue generated from email marketing efforts
* Ensure emails follow industry policies and best practices

  

**Requirements and skills*** Proven work experience as an Email marketer Digital marketing specialist
* Hands on experience with HTML and content management systems
* Proficiency in marketing automation technology
* Knowledge of SEO/SEM and Google Analytics
* Familiarity with analytical and database tools
* Excellent written communication and copywriting skills
* Strong project management skills
* An ability to work under tight deadlines
* BSc degree in Marketing or relevant field


We do not accept resume submissions from third party recruiters.
