title: Marketing Strategy Director
description:
Want to make a difference? Join an organization that has been transforming lives for over 40 years!


Prison Fellowship® trains and inspires churches and communities—inside and outside of prison—to support the restoration of those affected by incarceration. We equip correctional leaders, volunteers, and incarcerated men and women to make prisons more rehabilitative places; we advocate for a more restorative criminal justice system; and we collaborate with churches and local service providers to support former prisoners, their families, and their communities.


Prison Fellowship® is an organization committed to the highest standards of conduct, ethics and Christian values. Our conduct is guided by and grounded in the Bible, as reflected in our Statement of Faith below.

 **What we are looking for:**


A driven and mission-focused Marketing Strategy Director who is in agreement with Prison Fellowship's Statement of Faith and Code of Conduct to support brand, client, and campaign marketing initiatives through providing strategic guidance on client goals and the development of actionable marketing plans.

**Expectations of this role:**

* Maintain an active relationship with Jesus Christ and support the ministry through prayer and actions
* Serve as a primary point of contact for collaboration between the Marketing department and Internal Client/Programs to evaluate program goals and marketing needs
* Represent the Marketing creative teams during the setup phase of project cycles for mid-to-large complexity projects and own the development of Creative Briefs
* Support the Project Management team in developing Project briefs and setting expectations
* Collaborate with Marketing leadership in ideation for high-level strategic brand marketing and campaign direction
* Track campaign resources
* Manage print production

**Qualifications:**

* 8+ years of experience in marketing with 3+ years of experience in a senior project management or marketing manager role
* Bachelor's degree in marketing/communications or equivalent education and experience
* Demonstrated knowledge in the areas of developing marketing campaign strategies and plans; strong understanding of brand, digital, and content marketing; demonstrated experience working with clients to create campaigns that resonate with target audiences; ability to identify and understand diverse audiences; experience running and analyzing A/B and conversation rate optimization tests; understanding of journey map development and full-funnel planning
* Intermediate to advanced level skills in Microsoft Office and Smartsheet
* Experience working with a robust project management system (Wrike a plus) and experience working with salesforce or similar CRM a plus
* Excellent communication, interpersonal, collaboration and presentation skills
* Nonprofit experience preferred
* *This is a work from home/virtual position located in the US requiring the ability to travel up to 5%*

**What we offer:**


A team oriented, mission driven, supportive environment with cutting edge technology solutions and tremendous opportunity for growth and development. Our outstanding benefits package includes paid leave starting at 39 days (14 holidays, 15 vacation days, 10 sick days), retirement account funding and much more!


Visit the employment page on our website to learn more about Prison Fellowship.


Check out our YouTube channel to see how Prison Fellowship is transforming lives!

**OUR STATEMENT OF FAITH**

**The Foundation of What We Believe**


As a Christian organization, Prison Fellowship believes in the full authority of the Bible as God’s inspired word and the complete tenets of the Apostles’ Creed and the Nicene Creeds.


We believe in one God, Creator and Lord of the Universe, the co-eternal Trinity; Father, Son, and Holy Spirit. We believe that Jesus Christ, God’s Son, was conceived by the Holy Spirit, born of the Virgin Mary, lived a sinless life, died a substitutionary atoning death on the cross, rose bodily from the dead and ascended to heaven where, as truly God and truly man, He is the only mediator between God and man. We believe that the Bible is God’s authoritative and inspired Word, without error in all its teachings.

**How We Are Compelled to Live and to Act**


We believe that Christians, both individually and corporately, must submit to the Bible, as God’s authoritative, divine and inspired Word, in all matters of belief and conduct.

**How Our Mission and Our Approach is Shaped**


Prison Fellowship exists to bring glory to God and share His truth and love with those we serve, our employees, volunteers, and communities, according to scriptural truths.


Our Mission is to help restore those affected by crime and incarceration. This Mission is founded on the biblical conviction that all people are created in God's image and that no life is beyond God's reach.


Therefore, we believe that a restorative approach to prisoners, former prisoners, and all those affected by crime and incarceration reflects the God-given dignity and potential of every person and can help individual lives and communities flourish.

**What the Hope of Jesus Means for Others**


We believe that Jesus—Himself brought to trial, executed, buried, and brought to life again—offers hope, healing, and a new purpose for each life. He can make even the most broken people and situations affected by crime and incarceration whole again.

**What this Means for Communities**


Through an amazing awakening to new hope and life purpose available through Jesus, those who once broke the law are transformed and mobilized to serve their neighbors, replacing the cycle of crime with a cycle of renewal that restores entire communities. Because the Bible calls us to remember and visit those in prison, we believe that every Christian is compelled to contribute to this restorative cycle.

title: Product Marketing Manager - US, Remote
description:
**About Comply365 + Vistair**

  

In January 2024, Comply365 and Vistair announced their merger and strategic growth investment from Insight Partners and Liberty Hall Capital Partners. The combination of Comply365 and Vistair creates a leading global provider of compliance, safety and data intelligence technologies serving the aviation, defense and rail industries with over 120 customers located in more than 30 countries on 6 continents.

  

Comply365 is a leading provider of enterprise SaaS and mobile solutions for content management and document distribution in highly regulated industries, including aviation and rail. Comply365 supports the world's most mobile and remote workforces with targeted and personalized delivery of job-critical data that enables safe, efficient, and compliant operations. Every day, hundreds of thousands of pilots, flight attendants, maintenance technicians, rail conductors and engineers rely on Comply365 for digital delivery of operational (OEM and company) manuals. Having played an instrumental role in the FAA's approval of replacing the traditional, paper-based, pilot flight bags with electronic flight bags (EFBs), Comply365 partners with clients to transform their industries.  



  

Vistair is one of the world's leading providers of Operational Content Management for aviation technical publications, safety and regulatory content. Vistair is focused on driving market-leading innovation that simplifies the complex Flight Operations, Engineering, Safety and Compliance eco-system across the aviation industry and the defense sector. Our technology leads the way in the digital transformation of safety, efficiency, and compliance, driving higher standards across the industry. It is trusted by many of the most progressive aviation and defense organizations worldwide.

  

Our culture truly sets us apart at Comply365 + Vistair. In addition to our unwavering dedication to our customers and products that we offer, we are, first and foremost, a diverse team of driven, energetic, and passionate individuals who work together to make a direct impact on the future of our company. We have built, and continue to build a world-class, dynamic, and people-first culture. We believe in celebrating one another's achievements, open communication, and transparent leadership.

 **About The Position**

  

This is an excellent opportunity to join the newly merged entity of Comply365 and Vistair, an exciting combination of two market leaders in operational content management, safety management and data intelligence technologies serving the global aviation, defense and rail industries with a stellar customer base of 120+ customers in 30+ countries in 6 continents worldwide. The Product Marketing Manager will spearhead product marketing efforts for the combined Comply365 and Vistair product portfolio and will be instrumental in the product positioning for the flagship Comply365 and Vistair operational content management products - ProAuthor and DocuNet - which will be aligned in a unified roadmap to leverage the best of both products to bring additional value and innovation to our combined customer base.


This individual will have a natural interest and curiosity in the latest technology advances as well as in the target markets of Comply365 and Vistair - aviation, defense and rail - and will come to deeply understand the product portfolio and our target audiences' everyday challenges. Reporting to the Marketing Director and through close collaborations with the product team including product management and product owners across both Comply365 and Vistair, as well as with the Sales & Customer Success team, the Product Marketing Manager will create highly impactful product collateral and value propositions that succinctly explain how the products help solve our customer problems and that drives strong engagement at all stages of the sales cycle. The Product Marketing Manager has overall responsibility to ensure we conceive, validate and craft end-to-end value propositions for both existing and prospective customers which drive value for our customers, their users and that support the Comply365/ Vistair growth strategy.


To achieve this, you will research our target markets, our current offerings and the gaps we have in our offering, along with our competitive position. Also, you'll work alongside product management, commercial and marketing teams to build and launch product campaigns with impact and will be measured by the commercial success of Comply365/Vistair in terms of pipeline growth, new business wins and production adoption and cross-sell in existing customers.

 **Essential Duties and Responsibilities:**

  

* Develop and maintain a deep understanding of our customers' pains and gains in relation to the Comply365 and Vistair product portfolio.
* Gain insight into customer use of the current product-set, untapped opportunities and buyer personas, and document same for internal briefings.
* Help define the joint product positioning where the Comply365 and Vistair product sets will come together (mainly in the Operational Content Management domain articulating the roadmap and preparing product collateral that captures the combined Comply365 ProAuthor and Vistair DocuNet product).
* Deeply understand the competitive landscape for the Comply365 and Vistair product-set, maintaining and managing competitive intelligence and comparisons for battlecards for the commercial team by working with cross-functional partners and executing self-led research to determine our relative product positioning.
* Feed into product strategy with insights from market intelligence, research and customer insights to support product management in defining the right functionality and timing of same to factor into product roadmaps.
* Partner with the Product Management team to distil key functionality and benefits into core product marketing messages and develop product messaging, collateral and campaigns that differentiates Comply365's and Vistair's products and services from competitors.
* Create and deliver compelling product content such as product datasheets, product videos, solution overviews, product webinars and ROI material.
* Support the creation of product launch plans that are fully synced with business and revenue goals and ensure effective and ongoing relevancy in the market to drive demand generation and pipeline.
* Create compelling internal and external customer-facing product presentations.
* Support the presentation, positioning, and publication of product roadmaps - both internal and customer / prospect facing
* Partner with the wider marketing team to create innovative marketing campaigns, marketing website copy and support events.
* Sales Enablement - Work alongside Sales Effectiveness to develop effective sales training materials and battlecards, making it easy for sales to understand our product offerings and key positioning.
* Dream up engaging product demonstrations that are used on stage, in videos and are the basis for customer engagements in the sales and decision process.
* Confidently speak and present both internally and externally to promote the story of our product.
* Drive awareness of product performance as it relates to product feature adoption and usage.
* Partner with Sales and Marketing around the globe to facilitate feedback to support product management drive continuous improvement of portfolio.
* Contribute to Comply365 and Vistair content marketing, research initiatives and thought leadership.


**Required Qualifications and Skills:**

  

* Previous working experience as a Product Marketing Manager, including delivering presentations to customers and prospects, conducting competitor analysis and market research.
* Degree in Marketing, Communications, or similar relevant field.
* Outstanding communication, presentation and leadership skills.
* Excellent interpersonal and time management skills.
* Strong planning and organizational skills.
* Sharp analytical and problem-solving skills.
* Creative thinker with a vision and innovative thinking to try new things.
* Courageous and ambitious to challenge what's been done before.


**Why join Comply365 + Vistair?**

  

You're not just accepting a new job when you join our team. You're making a career move. Here's how we'll support you in doing some of the most impactful work of your career:

  

* Remote-first, flexible work environment
* Unlimited PTO
* Paid Holidays
* Comprehensive benefits package (medical, dental, vision, life insurance, disability insurance, HSA, and FSA)
* Paid leave benefits
* 401(k) plan with company match
* Ample learning and development opportunities
* Employee referral bonus
* Semi-annual on-site meetings
* Fun, positive, collaborative environment!


Comply365 + Vistair is a global company, and our success draws upon our employees' diverse viewpoints, skills, and experiences. We are proud to be an equal opportunity employer, and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment regardless of age, race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

title: Marketing Coordinator
description:
Duke's is now looking for a **Marketing Coordinator** to join our team! If you have a passion for B2B marketing and branding in a services-based industry, along with actively managing company social media platforms, this may be for you!


***Experience in the water/wastewater/stormwater, environmental services, construction, and/or utilties required.***


This is a remote US opportunity! The salary range for this position is $55,000 - $65,000 per year, depending on experience.


To learn more about working with Duke's, check out this short video by copying and pasting the following link into your brower - **https://youtu.be/vnXAHJJhTBQ**


**What We Will Do for YOU:**


While you take care of our marketing initiatives, we take care of you by providing:


* Weekly paychecks
* Paid time off (PTO and company holidays)
* Medical, dental, and vision insurance options
* Company-paid life insurance and disability insurance with supplemental options for purchase
* HSA and FSA plans
* A 401K retirement savings plan with company match
* An Employee Assistance Program
* Employee discounts and referral bonus programs


**What You Will Do:**


Reporting directly to our VP of Marketing, you will be responsible for supporting and assisting the marketing department in executing various marketing activities and initiatives, and becoming the primary marketing interface for the sales and management team. Your role will involve coordinating marketing campaigns, managing the corporate website and all social media platforms, coordinating content development to increase market awareness of the company and services to retain and grow revenue. You will utilize your strong organizational skills, attention to detail, and creative mindset to contribute to the overall success of the marketing efforts. You will:


Coordinate Marketing Campaigns:


* Manage the planning, execution, and tracking of marketing campaigns across various channels, including digital, trade show events, and company sponsored webinars using the HubSpot marketing automation platform
* Collaborate with the sales team and external vendors to ensure timely and accurate delivery of campaign materials for the cross selling of services and the generation of new business leads
* Monitor campaign performance metrics and provide regular reports for management to adjust campaign strategies and tactics


Manage Social Media and Online Presence:


* Maintain and update the company website and the social media platforms (such as LinkedIn, YouTube, Facebook, Instagram) with engaging content, including posts, articles, images, and videos
* Monitor social media channels and the website, respond to comments and inquiries, and engage with the audience to build company awareness
* Analyze website and social media metrics and generate reports to evaluate the effectiveness of the website/social media campaigns to increase traffic and generate leads


Assist with Content Creation:


* Collaborate with internal Subject Matter Experts (SMEs) and external 3rd party agencies to develop compelling content for various marketing materials, including brochures, presentations, website content, email campaigns, and webinars
* Proofread and edit marketing materials to ensure accuracy, consistency, and adherence to brand guidelines
* Manage the content calendar and coordinate with the external agency for content distribution across different platforms


Support Cross-Functional Collaboration:


* Work closely with the service delivery team and sales team to align marketing efforts with overall business objectives
* Provide assistance and support for trade shows, events, and other promotional activities, including logistics, coordination, and material preparation
* Assist in maintaining relationships with external partners, agencies, and vendors


**Ready to start your adventure with us?** Apply now if you:


* Hold a Bachelor's degree in marketing, communications, or a related field
* Have experience in the water/wastewater/stormwater, environmental services, construction, utilties, or related fields.
* Have working knowledge of B2B marketing principles, concepts, and tactics
* Have strong written and verbal communication skills
* Are proficient in using social media platforms and digital marketing tools such as HubSpot and Customer Relationship Management (CRM) systems
* Have excellent organizational skills and ability to manage multiple tasks simultaneously
* Are proficient in using Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel, PowerPoint) and marketing software/tools
* Have a basic understanding of SEO, SEM, and web analytics - this is a plus!


The salary range for this position is $55,000 - $65,000 per year, depending on experience.


***We look forward to talking with YOU!***


**Who We Are:**


Duke's is a leading provider of environmental services for maintaining and improving the health of underground infrastructure for wastewater, stormwater, water, and utilities. For over 85 years, Duke’s has been trusted by more than 2,000 municipalities and customers to help provide continuity of service in a cost effective and safe manner. The Duke’s team of professionals apply innovative technology and experience to inspect, monitor, diagnose, and prescribe programs to prolong the life of existing underground infrastructure. Come grow with us!


***Duke's is a Drug Free Workplace.***


#LI - remote

title: Relationship Manager II
description:
What We Need
  
FLEETCOR is currently looking to hire a Relationship Manager l within our Corpay division. This position falls under our Corporate Payments line of business. In this role, you will be responsible for the overall management of a book of assigned accounts based in regional states, focused on FLEETCOR and our Corpay corporate payment products. The Relationship Manager is accountable for the maintenance, growth and increased profitability of existing business, the cross selling of new business, renewals and the strategic direction of assigned accounts. You will report directly to Vice President of Sales and regularly collaborate with Corpay field sales team.
  
  

How We Work
  
As a Relationship Manager, you will be expected to work in a virtual environment. FLEETCOR will set you up for success by providing:
  
* Full, home office set up
* Company-issued equipment + remote access
* Formal, hands-on training
* Monthly home internet stipend


Role Responsibilities
  
  

**The responsibilities of the role will include:**  

* Strategic Consultative Advisor: retain portfolio base at 100% and secure cross sell of FLEETCOR product and service
* Establish and maintain strong relationships with all levels and key personnel within the client’s companies; ensure FLEETCOR has senior management contacts
* Demonstrate marketing and technical expertise through: Client assessment of approach, resources, and contacts as needed to complete RFP's and ensure clients are satisfied with FLEETCOR products and services
* Coordinate and influence superior customer service delivery by developing and maintaining strong intercompany relationships.
* Liaising with internal departments using superior communication skills to ensure the assigned client’s needs are satisfied by raising and resolving areas of concern and ensuring all are aware of changes within clients.
* Develop and monitor client financial performance including renewal planning, negotiation and profitability levels
* Preparation for, and lead Quarterly Business reviews, best practices, industry information and new business at client site visits
* Provide feedback to management on market trends as represented by our clients
* Maintain a high level of FinTech and payment processing knowledge as well as client’s industry
* Grow existing programs by understanding existing procedures and uncover where efficiencies can be made
* Create and maintain a collaborative team of internal & external stakeholders to drive customer spend (Account Management, Sales, Finance, Accounts Payable, implementation, project management and IT teams)


Qualifications & Skills
  
  

* 3-5 years of in FinTech or payment processing.
* Experience dealing with clients directly.
* Confident, self-motivated individual with 1+ client management or sales experience handling complex clients maintaining positive relationships
* Strategic thinker and ability to understand various client’s businesses, technology and financials
* Strong data analytics experience with data analysis; ability to diagnose, strategize growth of existing portfolio
* An excellent communicator with good presentation skills with proven track record of establishing & maintaining relationships at C level
* A team player with superior organization and multi-tasking skills that can define, structure and prioritize work and influence internal stakeholders and most of all, the desire to learn and succeed.
* Enjoys a fast-paced, entrepreneurial environment and processes strong negotiation skills
* Proficient with Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel, PowerPoint) and Salesforce.com


This salary range is provided for locations which require such disclosure. Where a position or applicant may fall in a particular wage range varies depending on a number of factors, including but not limited to skill sets, experience, training, licensure and certifications (if applicable), and other business and organization needs. The disclosed range has not been adjusted for the applicable geographic markets. At FLEETCOR, it is not typical for an individual to be hired at or near the top of the range for their role, and compensation decisions are dependent on the facts and circumstances of each case. An estimate of the minimum and maximum OTE for this role, including commission is $105,000.00 - $125,000.00 (Commission is uncapped).
  
Benefits & Perks
  
•
  
* Medical, Dental & Vision benefits available the 1st month after hire
* Automatic enrollment into our 401k plan (subject to eligibility requirements)
* Virtual fitness classes offered company-wide
* Robust PTO offerings including: major holidays, vacation, sick, personal, &volunteer time
* Employee discounts with major providers (i.e. wireless, gym, car rental, etc.)
* Philanthropic support with both local and national organizations
* Fun culture with company-wide contests and prizes


Our Company & Purpose
  
  

FLEETCOR is a global leader in business payments, laser focused on developing smarter ways for businesses to pay their expenses. Since 2000, FLEETCOR has developed innovative digital solutions that help businesses better track, manage, and pay their expenses. Today, FLEETCOR is an S&P 500 company with hundreds of thousands of customers using our products in over 100 countries. Companies of all sizes, industries and geographies rely on our product portfolio to manage spending more quickly, efficiently and securely than ever before. We embrace a culture grounded in five key values: integrity, collaboration, innovation, execution and people. These values offer you the opportunity to ‘thrive & grow’ through career development, volunteer, community, and wellness initiatives. This allows you to create a balance between professional goals and personal achievement. FLEETCOR is also committed to building and nurturing a culture of diversity, inclusion, equality, and belonging by:
  
  

* Welcoming people of different backgrounds, cultures, ethnicities, genders, and sexual orientations;
* Empowering our people to share their experiences and ideas through open forums and individual conversations; and
* Valuing each person’s unique perspectives and individual contributions.


Embracing diversity enables our people to “make the difference” as FLEETCOR and its more than 8,000 employees continue to shape the future of global payments. Learn more by visiting www.FLEETCOR.com or following FLEETCOR on LinkedIn.
  
  

Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer
  
FLEETCOR is an Equal Opportunity Employer. FLEETCOR provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants without regard to race, color, gender (including pregnancy), religion, national origin, ancestry, disability, age, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, marital status, language, ancestry, genetic information, veteran and/or military status or any other group status protected by federal or local law. If you require reasonable accommodation for the application and/or interview process, please notify a representative of the Human Resources Department. For more information about our commitment to equal employment opportunity and pay transparency, please click the following links:  EEO and Pay Transparency
  
  

#LI-SK1
  
#LICorpay
  
#Indeed
  
  

**About the Company:**  

FLEETCOR Technologies, Inc. (“FLEETCOR”) is a leading global provider of business payment solutions. We help companies of all sizes control, simplify and secure payment of various domestic and cross-border payables using specialized payment products. We serve businesses, partners, merchants, consumers and payment networks in North America, Latin America, Europe, and Asia Pacific.
  
* $2.8B Annual Revenue
* 800,000 Directly Served Business Clients
* 9,700+ Employees


(as of December 31, 2021)
  
  

Our payment solutions provide our customers with a payment method designed to be superior to and more robust and effective than what they use currently, whether they use a competitor’s product or another alternative method such as cash or check. We group our payment solutions into five primary categories: Fuel, Lodging, Tolls, Corporate Payments and Gift. Each category is unique in its focus, customer base and target markets, but they also share a number of characteristics: customers are primarily businesses, have recurring revenue models, have specialized networks which create barriers to entry, have high margins, and have similar selling systems.
  
  

**FLEETCOR enjoys global recognition including:**  

* Forbes Global Growth Champion – FLEETCOR is one of the 250 fastest growing companies in the world as determined by Forbes and Statista
* Forbes World’s Most Innovative Companies – FLEETCOR has made this prestigious list of leading innovative companies 4 years in a row!
* Fortune 1000 Company – FLEETCOR was one of the largest movers in the new rankings of the largest companies in America, ranking #872
* S&P 500 – In 2018, FLEETCOR joined the S&P stock index comprised of the 500 leading US stocks


Our Mission
  
  

Create better ways for businesses and their partners to pay their expenses
  
  

Our Strategy
  
  

FLEETCOR will continue double-digit revenue growth by executing on four growth planks:
  
* Sell More New Clients. FLEETCOR will continue growing sales by investing more in proven sales channels and bringing more prospects into the funnel.
* Increase Revenue per Client. FLEETCOR will continue increasing its share of customer wallets through network expansion and cross-sell of add-on solutions.
* "Beyond" Adjacent Segments. FLEETCOR will continue extending its existing business into adjacent spaces to broaden its market opportunity.
* Launch New Platform Business. FLEETCOR has launched its "new platform business" integration "Expense Management & AP/Vendor Payments" solutions into one bundled software platform.


Our Commitment to Diversity, Equality, Inclusion, Belonging
  
  

Together we can foster true belonging. We know different ideas, perspectives and backgrounds lead to better innovation and results. We are therefore committed to building and nurturing a culture of diversity, inclusion, and belonging by:
  
* Welcoming people of different backgrounds, cultures, ethnicities, genders, and sexual orientations;
* Empowering our people to share their experiences and ideas through open forums and individual conversations; and
* Valuing each person’s unique perspectives and individual contributions.


Embracing diversity enables our people to “make the difference” at FLEETCOR.
  
  

Our Values
  
  

FLEETCOR’s culture reflects our history of fast growth and our continued drive for results. Our entrepreneurial spirit remains strong across our global workforce, and we reinforce these principles in our five core values:
  
* Innovation: Figure out a better way
* Execution: Get it done quickly
* Integrity: Do the right thing
* People: We make the difference
* Collaboration: Accomplish more together


These values guide all of our employees and are infused in all aspects of our Company. We are, as a team, united through these shared values and our mission to provide “a better way to pay.”
  
  

Our values foster an inclusive culture through the expectation that all employees will treat each other with respect and appreciate the diversity of identities, thoughts, backgrounds and styles. Our commitment to fostering an inclusive culture has never been more essential than in this moment of national reflection. We must always celebrate the diversity of our company and our communities.
  
  

We strongly believe that the quality and diversity of our workforce provide FLEETCOR with a competitive advantage, and that our problem-solving and solution-building efforts are greatly enhanced when we harness the collective thinking of a diverse group of people with unique experiences and perspectives.
  
  

**Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer:**  

FLEETCOR is an Equal Opportunity Employer. FLEETCOR provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants without regard to race, color, gender (including pregnancy), religion, national origin, ancestry, disability, age, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, marital status, language, ancestry, genetic information, veteran and/or military status or any other group status protected by federal or local law. If you require reasonable accommodation for the application and/or interview process, please notify a representative of the Human Resources Department.
  
  

For more information about our commitment to equal employment opportunity and pay transparency, please click the following links: EEO and Pay Transparency.

title: Social Media Marketing and Community Manager
description:
**Join Nuvia: A Path to Making a Real Difference**



At Nuvia Dental Implant Center, your role goes beyond marketing; it's about creating connections that change lives. If you're driven by the desire to help others and skilled in using social media as a powerful marketing tool, you're the perfect fit for our team! Here, every post, every campaign, every interaction can be a step towards transforming someone's life for the better.

 **Role Overview:**



As our Social Media Marketing and Community Manager, you'll be at the heart of our digital outreach. Your role is crucial in crafting and executing marketing strategies that not only promote our brand but also genuinely connect with our audience's needs and aspirations. The hours for this position are: Sat-Sun 10:00am-7:00pm MST.

 **Your Impact and Benefits:**


* Be part of a mission that values not just the health, but the overall well-being of our patients.
* Experience personal and professional growth in an environment that supports your journey.


Nuvia is a great place to work! We pride ourselves in the satisfaction of our teams and believe if they are well taken care of, in turn, they will take great care of our patients. Our benefits package includes the following:


* Medical, Dental, Vision, Life, Long/Short Term Disability Insurances
* Paid Training
* Paid Time Off
* Paid Holidays
* Paid Parental/Bereavement Leave
* 401k match
* Employee Assistance

  


**Key Responsibilities:**


* Develop and implement social media marketing strategies that resonate with our audience and reflect our commitment to changing lives.
* Engage with our online community, not just as customers, but as individuals seeking better health and well-being.
* Manage and nurture our social media platforms, ensuring they are a hub of positive, helpful, and life-changing interactions.
* Use your marketing skills to drive business goals, while always prioritizing the human element in every conversation.
* Collaborate with the team to create content and messaging that educates, inspires, and motivates our audience to take steps toward a healthier life.

  


**Who You Are:**


* A compassionate marketer who understands the power of social media in making a positive impact on people's lives.
* Someone with a proven track record of maintaining high engagement rates and using social media to drive business results.
* A creative thinker with excellent communication skills, capable of crafting messages that connect and resonate.
* A self-starter who is passionate about helping others and has a strong sense of empathy and understanding.
* A team player who thrives in collaborative environments and is committed to continuous learning and improvement.

  


**Join Us:**



This isn't just a job; it's an opportunity to be part of something bigger. At Nuvia, you'll use your marketing skills to not only meet business objectives but to make a real, positive difference in people's lives. If this speaks to your heart and your professional aspirations, we would love to hear from you.

title: Program Marketing Manager(Eloqua,Marcom)
description:
**Job Description:**

* The client Global Marketing organization is responsible for repurposing and synthesizing engaging content using the appropriate digital channels such as literature, eBooks, blogs, videos, web, or social media for deployment.
* The objective is to present a compelling and consistent brand to our customers and target markets. The Marcom team works globally to ensure our content and processes align with all regions, such as the Americas, Greater China, Asia Pacific, and EMEAI.

**The Program Marketing Managers are experts in these three key areas:**

* Design campaigns and programs — create strategic and tactical plans based on campaign objectives and goals for industry and solution segments and product portfolio categories.
* Marketing mix of tactics and channels — defining whether reputation, awareness, consideration, demand generation, digital, or other outbound marketing push best fit the program's requirements. Activities include crafting and deploying email journeys, advertising plans, social media content, and other marketing instruments to support campaign goals.
* End-to-end management — Measure the impact and success of the program with the ability to quickly pivot to change the Marcom mix if metrics are not meeting the established objectives.
* The Program Marketing Manager role partners with industry solution managers, product marketing managers, and content experts to create the campaign program while coordinating and aligning with other departments such as field marketing. The Program Marketing Manager will also leverage and repurpose content to create collateral assets such as white papers, web pages, case studies, brochures, blogs, and social posts.

**Responsibilities:**

* Performs end-to-end campaign management by identifying the appropriate mix of marketing tactics to achieve specified campaign goals set by the campaign lead.
* Optimizes campaign performance by conducting actionable reviews with respective stakeholders.
* Creates a strategy plan for various outbound marketing assets to support the marketing tactics identified across various stages of the buying journey using respective digital channels to increase demand, awareness, and thought leadership.
* Develops compelling content by repurposing existing assets — synthesizing and elevating for top and mid-funnel uses while ensuring editorial quality.
* Creates, monitors, and publishes campaign results using visual metrics to measure the effectiveness of the tactics.
* Collaborates with cross-functional teams — from creative design, product marketing, web, and legal to produce effective promotional materials.

**Requirements:**

* Bachelor's degree (business / marketing) or equivalent plus four to five years in a high-tech marketing communications (Marcom) role.
* Experience creating Marcom campaign programs with successful execution using a mix of digital channels.
* Excellent English-speaking / writing, communication, and presentation skills with a proven track record of journalistic and editorial content creation and editing.
* Passion for writing engaging professional technology-based content.
* Experience in leading and managing the execution of processes, projects, and tactics.
* Ability to work independently to prioritize tactics based on importance and urgency to meet deadlines.
* Excellent working knowledge of digital marketing tools, preferably Eloqua, and content management workflow tools.

Job Types: Full-time, Contract

Pay: $55.00 per hour

Expected hours: 40.00 per week

Benefits:

* Dental insurance
* Health insurance
* Paid time off

Schedule:

* 8 hour shift
* Monday to Friday

Work Location: Remote

title: Manager, Brand Research
description:
**About Us:**
-------------



DailyPay, Inc. is transforming the way people get paid. As the industry's leading on-demand pay solution, DailyPay uses an award-winning technology platform to help America's top employers build stronger relationships with their employees. This voluntary employee benefit enables workers everywhere to feel more motivated to work harder and stay longer on the job, while supporting their financial well-being outside of the workplace. DailyPay is headquartered in New York City, with operations in Minneapolis and Belfast. For more information, visit DailyPay's Press Center.

**The Role:**
-------------



As part of the Marketing Team, the Brand Research Manager helps inform business, marketing and communications decisions by uncovering insights about our key audiences. Responsibilities include quantitative and qualitative research, including design, execution, data analysis and reporting. Your findings on audience perceptions, decision-drivers, needs, preferences and characteristics are a driving force behind our marketing initiatives.



If this opportunity excites you, we encourage you to apply even if you do not meet all of the qualifications.


**How You Will Make an Impact:**
--------------------------------


* Design research end-to-end, choose appropriate methodologies based on goals, timelines, budget
* Write questionnaires (surveys, question guides)
* Program, test and run surveys in survey platforms
* Analyze results in survey platforms, cross tabbing tools, data tables with a critical eye towards data quality, methods and intent
* Identify and investigate trends, outliers, narratives and "aha!" moments in data
* Design and manage qualitative research
* Reporting based on key narratives, stakeholders

**What You Bring to The Team:**
-------------------------------


* 5+ years of experience in market research, including survey design, data analysis and reporting
* Understanding of market research methodologies and statistical methods
* Ability to design research methodologies, write questionnaires, execute and report on research (experience managing full span of the research process)
* Have a voice in meetings
* Detail-oriented with ability to communicate big picture
* Understanding of marketing strategies and goals
* Curiosity and proactive drive to question trends, dig deeper into insights and improve processes

**What We Offer:**
------------------


* Exceptional health, vision, and dental care
* Opportunity for equity ownership
* Life and AD&D, short- and long-term disability
* Employee Assistance Program
* Employee Resource Groups
* Fun company outings and events
* Unlimited PTO
* 401K with company match

 **Pay Transparency.** DailyPay takes a market-based approach to compensation and compensation may vary depending on your location. U.S. locations are categorized into two tiers based on a cost of labor index for that geographic area. The salary ranges are listed by geographic tier. Additionally, this role may be eligible for variable incentive compensation in addition to stock options. Where a candidate fits within the compensation range for a role is based on their demonstrated experience, qualifications, skills and internal equity.

**National Compensation Range**


$100,000—$130,000 USD**Premium Compensation Range**


$111,000—$144,000 USD  


DailyPay is committed to fostering an inclusive, equitable culture of belonging, grounded in empathy and respect, which values openness to opinions, awareness of lived experiences, fair treatment and access for all. We strive to build and develop diverse teams to create an organization where innovation thrives, where the full potential of each person is engaged, and their views, beliefs and values are integrated into our ways of working.



We encourage people of all backgrounds to join us on our mission. If you require reasonable accommodation for any aspect of the recruitment process, please send a request to peopleops@dailypay.com. All requests for accommodation will be addressed as confidentially as practicable.



DailyPay is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration without regard to race, color, religion or creed, alienage or citizenship status, political affiliation, marital or partnership status, age, national origin, ancestry, physical or mental disability, medical condition, veteran status, gender, gender identity, pregnancy, childbirth (or related medical conditions), sex, sexual orientation, sexual and other reproductive health decisions, genetic disorder, genetic predisposition, carrier status, military status, familial status, or domestic violence victim status and any other basis protected under federal, state, or local laws.

title: Marketing Consultant (Social Media, Content, Communications)
description:
Journey Clinical is on a mission to transform the growing mental health crisis by accelerating the adoption of frontier treatments that lead to lasting improvements in clinical outcomes. We have built a turnkey healthtech platform to safely and effectively expand access to a powerful modality known as Psychedelic-Assisted Psychotherapy, starting with Ketamine-Assisted Psychotherapy (KAP). In our patient-centered collaborative care model, licensed psychotherapists in the network take on the psychotherapy, while Journey Clinical's in-house medical team takes on patient eligibility, treatment plan and outcome monitoring. Our platform gives psychotherapists passionate about PAP the infrastructure and support required to become empowered KAP providers, while enabling higher standards of patient care and enhanced clinical outcomes.  

We have recently closed a successful Series A round led by Union Square Ventures, and are backed by a number of top-tier investors including AlleyCorp, Fifty Years, Able Partners, Gaingels, Palo Santo, PsyMed Ventures, Coalition Operators, Christina Sass co-founder of Andela, Edvard Engesæth, MD co-founder of Nurx and, Hans Gangeskar co-founder of Nurx.  

We are building an open-minded and inclusive workplace where you will have the opportunity to grow and collaborate with a diverse team of high performing individuals. Our team combines extensive experience in business and healthcare. We are mission driven and strive to make the workplace stimulating, ethical, rewarding, and fun. Together, we will be working at the cutting edge of a groundbreaking field that is reshaping mental health and we will make a direct impact on people’s lives.### **Responsibilities**

* Own our content calendar and social media content across all platforms (LinkedIn, Facebook, Instagram, TikTok, etc)
* Maintain website content & blog
* Support company communications initiatives

### **Requirements**

* 3-5 years of content marketing and social media experience
* Experience building social media content calendars, growing audiences & driving engagement
* Strong written communication skills
* Ability to work 30-40 hours per week
* Proficiency with graphic design & video editing platforms (Canva, Adobe Illustrator, Veed, etc)
* Self starter comfortable with ambiguity
* Healthtech experience and passion for psychedelics is a plus!

### **Benefits**

* $45-$55/hr
* Opportunity to evolve this role into a full-time position later this year for the right candidate


We recognize healthcare is a universal concern and tackling the mental health crisis will require team members with different strengths from all walks of life. We are an Equal Opportunity Employer and consider applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, orientation, national origin, age, disability, genetics or any other basis forbidden under federal, state, or local law.  

If you feel discouraged by the job description because your skills don’t exactly match please apply anyway. We likely missed something and are open to expanding our understanding of the role. We are an Equal Opportunity Employer and consider applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, orientation, national origin, age, disability, genetics or any other basis forbidden under federal, state, or local law.

title: Senior Manager/Associate Director, Marketing
description:

The HCP Marketing Manager will be responsible for the development and management of HCP materials for Jelmyto, the company’s first product. The position requires a motivated, energetic candidate with a collaborative, “can-do” attitude, as well as previous pharmaceutical/biotech experience. The selected candidate will have the opportunity to support the marketing team in a small and nimble organization, gain extensive exposure to all aspects of a US commercial team, and help to shape the vibrant culture and working processes of an emerging biotech company.

* Manage vendor/agency activities/performance.

We offer a competitive salary, employee benefits, and an excellent work environment.

  



EOE.

title: Marketing Designer
description:
Founded in 2013, Nova Labs is a pioneer in decentralized wireless communications and the founding team behind the open-source Helium Network. Helium Mobile, a Nova Labs business, has a mission to place access to connectivity in the hands of the people and enable a service at a reduced cost while maintaining high-quality service.



Join Our Team: Be the Creative Spark We Need! Marketing Designer Wanted



**Who We Are Looking For:**



Are you creative and ready to leave your mark on the digital world? Do you thrive in environments that blend art, design, and marketing into one? If you're nodding yes, then keep reading because we might just be a match made in design heaven.



**Your Role:**



As our Marketing Designer, you'll dive into the heart of our brand, crafting visuals that scream creativity and uniqueness. Your designs won't just be seen; they'll tell our story, spark conversations, and inspire action. From mesmerizing digital ads to trendy social media videos and everything in between, your art will be the face of our campaigns, online presence, and beyond.



**What You'll Do:**



Bring Ideas to Life: Design everything from eye-catching digital ads and social media visuals to sleek email templates and impactful presentations. Collaborate Like a Boss: Team up with our marketing gurus to brainstorm and bring to life design solutions that not just look good but pack a punch strategy-wise. Be Our Brand Guardian: Keep our visuals tight and cohesive, ensuring every pixel aligns with our brand's heart and soul. Juggle Like a Pro: Manage multiple projects, steering them from the land of ideas to the realm of reality. Stay Ahead of the Curve: Keep your finger on the pulse of design trends, injecting innovation and freshness into our brand's visual language. Quality Control Wizardry: Work magic with external partners to ensure our materials aren't just produced but are masterpiece-level every time.



**What Makes You The Perfect Fit:**



A minimum of 2 years experience and a portfolio that doesn't just whisper but shouts your talent and vision in design. Simple ideas powerfully executed for both consumer and enterprise. A wizard in Figma is critical. Nice to haves include Framer, Cinema4D, Spline, After Effects, Premiere and Photoshop, to name a few. An eye for design that looks good and feels right, enhancing user experience at every turn. A problem-solving ninja, creative and effective. Top-notch communication and teamwork skills – because great minds create better together. A master of time and project management, thriving in the fast lane and never missing a beat.


* Collab-oriented with campaigns, performance marketing, social media and branding teams.
* Your design sense drives the success of the project across all marketing platforms.


 **Why You'll Love Working Here:**



Culture: Immerse yourself in a workplace that values creativity, open-mindedness, and your unique perspective. Growth: Be part of a team that's not just about the now but also your future – where you're headed and how we can get there together. Impact: Leave your mark on projects that matter, where your creativity contributes directly to our success and beyond.



Ready to make our brand your canvas? Apply now and show us the world through your design lens!



**The Perks:**


* Remote-First? Work from wherever your heart desires.
* Health is Wealth: 100% covered premiums (medical, dental, vision) for you and yours.
* Vacation Time: Unlimited. Plus, a stipend to make your getaways even sweeter.
* Wellness: A monthly stipend to keep you fit and fabulous.
* Tech Love: Annual stipend for the gadgets and gear you need.
* Future-Proofing: 401K plan to build your nest egg.


 **Compensation:**


* Salary + Equity? Yes, and yes.
* Pay varies depending on your location. U.S. locations are categorized into tiers based on a cost of labor index for that geographic area. For candidates outside of metro market areas, we use the state average.
* The successful candidate's starting pay will be determined based on job-related skills, experience, qualifications, work location, and market conditions.
* Nova Labs targets the 50th percentile of the pay scale for new hires.
* The salary pay scale for the target experience and target skill set US locations:
+ **Tier 1** (San Francisco / New York City): $71k - $89k
+ **Tier 2** (Boston, Seattle, DC, San Diego, Los Angeles, CA State Avg): $63,900k - 80,100k
+ **Tier 3** (Austin, Dallas, Denver, Chicago, Detroit, Houston, Phoenix, Portland, Philadelphia, Sacramento): $60,350 - $75,650
+ **Tier 4:** Other, Miami, Columbus, Raleigh-Durham, SLC, Orlando, Eugene, NH, San Antonio): $56,800 = $71,200

title: Customer References & Advocacy Manager
description:
**About Lyra Health**
Lyra is transforming mental health care through technology with a human touch to help people feel emotionally healthy at work and at home. We work with industry leaders, such as Morgan Stanley, Uber, Amgen, and other Fortune 500 companies, to improve access to effective, high-quality mental health care for their employees and their families. With our innovative digital care platform and global provider network, 10 million people can receive the best care and feel better, faster. Founded by David Ebersman, former CFO of Facebook and Genentech, Lyra has raised more than $900 million. **About the Role**
Lyra Health is seeking an experienced customer reference professional who will contribute to our rapid growth by expanding and deepening our formal reference management program. Lyra’s customers are many of the world’s most recognized brands, who partner with us to bring extraordinary mental healthcare services to their people everywhere. Our customers are our most powerful partners in advocating for and investing in mental health care at their organizations and with their peers across industries.  

  

This team member will build on Lyra’s extraordinary customer relationships to deliver a straightforward, scalable, and consultative reference program that integrates Lyra Health’s world class customer advocates into key stages of every prospective buyer’s decision-making process. In close collaboration with other members of the Customer Advocacy team and go-to-market leaders, this individual will build authentic, trusted relationships with our customers and internal teams to work through efficient and scalable processes that sustain customer loyalty, educate prospective buyers, support our marketing and sales operations, and ultimately increase access to mental health care for people around the world.  

  

As a core member of the Customer Advocacy team, this individual will also contribute to strategic advocacy initiatives including events, content creation, and community-building.
### **Responsibilities:**

* Work with sales and customer success team members every day to complete reference requests, deliver on set SLAs, and expand our pool of customer advocates.
* Own the end-to-end success of the reference program seeing the request from sales all the way through to a completed call with a customer, working to optimize the program over time.
* Build and sustain strong relationships with Customer Success team members to learn about our customers and surface deeper advocacy opportunities including speaking invitations, case studies, media opportunities, and more.
* Track, analyze, and report out the results of the reference program as it relates to Win/Loss of new deals and reference experience.
* Collaborate with cross-functional team members to execute new and innovative forms of customer advocacy activities such as reference roundtables, VIP customer reference programming, etc.
* Develop and activate strategies to continuously evolve and enhance the reference program and drive stronger customer relationships and richer advocacy activities.
* Champion the program internally and share results through monthly email updates, team meetings, and all hands.

### **Qualifications:**

* 5+ years experience in a marketing, sales, customer success or similar function that involves close relationship-building with customers and/or prospects.
* Passion for connecting and collaborating with senior-level customers to understand their needs and build relationships that support ongoing advocacy.
* Proven track record for cross-functional collaboration across internal teams and reporting out results and learning to senior management.
* Ability to work with many stakeholders and handle multiple reference needs at a time to deliver fast turnaround times
* Strong written and verbal communication skills that show confidence and clarity of message.
* Desire to learn about customer advocacy and customer marketing and interest in taking on new assignments as time allows.
* Experience building and/or maintaining a B2B reference management program is a big plus.


As a full-time Customer References and Advocacy Manager, you will be employed by Lyra Health, Inc. The anticipated annual base salary range for this full-time position is $85,000-130,000. The base range is determined by role and level, and placement within the range will depend on a number of job-related factors, including but not limited to your skills, qualifications, experience and location.  

At Lyra, base salary is only one aspect of an employee’s total compensation package, which additionally may include discretionary restricted stock unit awards, comprehensive medical and dental coverage, and retirement benefits. This role may also be eligible for discretionary bonuses.  

We also offer generous benefits that include:* Comprehensive healthcare coverage (including medical, dental, vision, FSA/HSA, life and disability insurances)
* Lyra for Lyrians; coaching and therapy services
* Equity in the company through discretionary restricted stock units
* Competitive time off with pay policies including vacation, sick days, and company holidays
* Paid parental leave
* 401K retirement benefits
* Monthly tech stipend
* We like to spread joy throughout the year with well-being perks and activities, surprise swag, free food and snack deliveries each month, regular community celebration…and more!

  

We can’t wait to meet you.
We are an Equal Opportunity Employer. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, sex (including pregnancy), national origin, age, disability, genetic information or any other category protected by law.  

By applying for this position, your data will be processed as per Lyra Health Workforce Privacy Notice. Through this application, we will collect personal information from you including your name, email address, gender identity, employment information, and phone number for the purposes of recruiting and assessing suitability, aptitude, skills, qualifications, and interests for employment with Lyra. We may also collect information about your race, ethnicity, and sexual orientation, which is considered sensitive personal information under the California Privacy Rights Act (CPRA). Providing this information is optional and completely voluntary. If you are a California resident and would like to limit how we use this information, please use the Limit the Use of My Sensitive Personal Information form. This information will only be retained for as long as needed to fulfill the purposes for which it was collected, as described above. Please note that Lyra does not “sell” or “share” personal information as defined by the CPRA. For more information about how we use and retain your information, please see our Workforce Privacy Notice.

title: Private Marketing Tutor (Texas, Remote)
description:
**Teach what you love with the most flexible online tutoring platform out there and earn thousands of $$$.**

Are you passionate about Marketing? Do you want to share your knowledge of Marketing with others?

Then come join us as an online Marketing tutor and help students who are eager to learn.

Lessonpal was born as a Silicon Valley startup with a mission to democratize education. We believe in delivering high-quality, accessible, and affordable lessons to all our students, and we’d love for you to join us!

**What’s in it for you?**

* You set your own rates. We never tell you what to charge. If your rates are attractive to students, you’ll get lessons. It’s all in your hands.
* All lessons are taught online and are easily accessible to everyone. We’re in the digital age now!
* You have complete control of when and how much you teach. You control your schedule, availability, and how many students you take on.
* You keep the majority of your earnings! Compared to other platforms, Lessonpal tutors keep more of their earnings...90%!

**Job Responsibilities**

* Deliver online Marketing lessons to students of all ages (you choose what age groups you want to work with)
* Submit post-lesson summaries so that students and parents have access to a recap.
* Respond to tutoring inquiries and messages from current and potential students.
* Work with your students to schedule lessons efficiently
* Proactively communicate with Lessonpal support about any questions

**Job Requirements**

* Relevant experience and knowledge of Marketing`
* Strong communication skills
* Patience and empathy for working with students
* Reliability, consistency, and punctuality in lesson delivery
* Stable internet connection
* Proficiency in using online meeting platforms such as Zoom
* Verified Paypal account (to receive payments for lessons)

**Duration:** Permanent, Independent Contractor

**Pay rate:** You set your own rates (average $15 - $30 per hour)

**Hours:** Flexible - you set your own schedule

**Ready to get started? Apply at www.lessonpal.com/teach-lessons**

**EEO:** All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, veteran status, and any other protected class under state or federal law.

Job Type: Part-time

Pay: $10.00 - $50.00 per hour

Schedule:

* Choose your own hours

Work Location: Remote

title: Social Media Marketing Manager
description:
**SOCIAL MEDIA MARKETING MANAGER - YOUR VIRTUAL UPLINE**

**Position Overview**

Do you love creating content and marketing? Are compelling Instagram captions and social strategy your love languages? Are you a dynamic individual with a flair for social media, and a heart for impactful communication? If so, you’re in the right place!

We're looking for a Social Media Marketing Manager who resonates with our core values of love, service, and growth. Love, Serve, Grow™ is not only the name of our signature program, but the guiding philosophy of everything we do as a company.

In our business, love is more than an emotion; it's a guiding principle in how we engage with our community, and each other. Service is at the core of our mission, driving us to create content that genuinely impacts people, and transforms their lives.

We're committed to growth, not just in our business metrics, but in the personal and professional development of our community, paid clients, and our team. If you are someone that values these things, is looking to make a real difference in the world of social media marketing, and grow with a team that cares, we would love to meet you!

We’re looking for a Social Media Marketing Manager who understands that social media isn’t all about likes and comments, it’s about moving the needle, making an impact, creating brand awareness, and most importantly — finding ways to attract and engage our ideal audience so that they become raving fans and customers.

This position’s primary focus will be to expand the reach of our business, brand, podcast, and online training programs by strategizing, creating, distributing, and curating engaging content for our audience through various social media channels.

This is a full-time position — please don’t apply if you have other clients or manage a virtual assistant or marketing agency. You’ll report directly to our Founder Bob Heilig, while also working closely with other key members of the team.

The Social Media Marketing Manager position will be mostly a work from home, virtual position. However in-person collaboration will be required a few times per year. We meet in person to develop our marketing strategy, and flesh out our execution plans.

**Duties and Responsibilities**

Our Social Media Marketing Manager will primarily be responsible for:

STRATEGY

* **Social Media Growth**: Developing strategies to grow our social media platforms both in customer engagement and numeric value
* **Email List Growth**: Developing social strategies that make growing our email list a priority and that promote our list in ongoing social media campaigns.
* **Setting Channel-Specific Goals and Guidelines**: What works on Instagram might not work on Pinterest. Create a channel-specific strategy and best practices guidelines for Facebook, Instagram, Twitter, Pinterest, and LinkedIn.
* **Research**: Researching and staying up to speed on new social media marketing strategies and how we can use them to add value to our audience.
* **Determine Important KPIs**: Determine what measurements will be tracked to help us see what works and what doesn’t work, and how our social efforts are leading to more leads and sales.

EXECUTION

* **Campaign Creation**: Partner with our content and marketing team to help support our product launches on the social front. You’ll do this by designing and executing results-driven, lead-generating, and high-converting social media campaigns.
* **Social Media Brand Management**: Act as the brand voice for Your Virtual Upline across all social media platforms by developing and executing a regular posting strategy, including creating and/or repurposing engaging content that establishes our presence as an authority
* **Create Content Calendars**: Create a strategic and organized content calendar that ties into our paid promotions, free community, podcast episodes, etc.
* **Copywriting**: Follow the guidelines of our in-depth brand voice guide and write social copy that matches our voice and feels relatable and informal.

COMMUNITY

* **Community Management**: Owning community engagement and responding to customers who voice their feedback, questions, or complaints on social media channels. You’ll do this *(with the help from our internal team)* by posting engaging content, soliciting relationships, initiating discussion, monitoring comments, answering questions, being highly responsive, and elevating any concerns or arising themes to our customer experience team.

ANALYSIS

* **Weekly Reporting**: creating streamlined, easy to digest, high-level reports detailing top posts, follower growth, campaign success and any other important metrics the marketing team should know about.
* **Tracking and Reporting Analytics**: Constantly tracking and reporting on social analytics and metrics, making suggestions for improvement based on your findings in these reports.
* **Monitoring Community**: Gathering important feedback and insights from our communities on social and sharing with the team in addition to tweaking content strategy to match what our community is asking for and/or in need of.

**Skills, Abilities and Experience**

You are a strong fit for this position if the statements below are true for you:

* Social media is your passion. You can easily spot an effective social media channel and identify the qualities that make it successful.
* You are constantly paying attention to what is working for leading brands and can visualize how it can apply to our brand.
* You embrace a get it done mindset, and bring a positive attitude to all situations
* You are a thinker and a doer. This position is a mix of both. You can come up with strong, smart strategies and you also don’t hesitate to jump in and implement them.
* You understand the power of a good story and you are a master at asking the right questions of the right people to bring that story to life.
* You're an effective communicator, especially in writing. Your grammar and writing skills are top-notch.
* You are committed to continuous learning and growth. Refining your skills and becoming a better version of yourself is part of who you are
* You are a rockstar at communicating with a team, and organizing a team around specific tasks
* You love measuring and tracking the success of your campaigns and growth endeavors. You rely on analytics to give you insight into what’s working and what’s not.

**Salary**: $70,000 – $75,000 based on experience

**Extra perks + details**:

* **Competitive Pay and Bonus Potential** - You will have the ability to earn bonuses tied to the overall performance of the business, and your contribution to those results.
* **Flexible Work Schedule** – This is a work from home / anywhere position. As long as you have a working internet, you can take this job anywhere!
* **Flexible Time Off and Sick Leave** – We believe that working hard and taking full ownership of your role shouldn’t come at the expense of lifestyle freedom.
* **Paid Holidays** – including a Thanksgiving Break and Holiday Break!
* **Birthday Leave** – Never working on your birthday again. Hit the beach or the spa, we don’t care what you do, just don’t come to work!
* **Bonus Potential** – Hard work and smashing goals don’t go unnoticed or unrewarded here at our company. We can share the details when we speak.
* **Learning Opportunities** – A mastermind, summit, or learning experience that will enrich your knowledge in your particular role? It’s on us!

**Application Instructions**

If you believe you are a qualified candidate, submit your application, and someone from our team will be in touch if we think you might be fit!

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $70,000.00 - $75,000.00 per year

Benefits:

* Flexible schedule
* Health insurance
* Paid time off
* Parental leave
* Professional development assistance

Schedule:

* Monday to Friday

Work Location: Remote

title: International Marketing Manager
description:
We are looking for an International Marketing Manager who will be responsible for managing our company’s operations in the global markets. The ideal candidate will have experience in user growth from 0 to 1, familiarity with overseas social media platforms, experience in AI open-source communities, and experience in online and offline activities.

Responsibilities:
