title: Sr. Lifecycle Marketing Manager
description:
**About Lyra Health**
Lyra is transforming mental health care through technology with a human touch to help people feel emotionally healthy at work and at home. We work with industry leaders, such as Morgan Stanley, Uber, Amgen, and other Fortune 500 companies, to improve access to effective, high-quality mental health care for their employees and their families. With our innovative digital care platform and global provider network, 10 million people can receive the best care and feel better, faster. Founded by David Ebersman, former CFO of Facebook and Genentech, Lyra has raised more than $900 million. **About The Role**
Lyra Health is seeking an experienced and dynamic Senior Lifecycle Marketing Manager to join our growing team. The ideal candidate will have a proven track record in developing and executing comprehensive lifecycle marketing strategies to drive consumer engagement, retention, and revenue growth.  

This is a hands-on role that requires a strong understanding of marketing automation tools and systems that support lifecycle marketing success. This role will be a great fit for you if you’re mission-driven, collaborative, and data-oriented and like to roll up your sleeves to design and build best-in-class programming that impacts millions of lives.
### **Responsibilities:**

* Design a lifecycle marketing strategy and member journey that enhances the member experience and increases engagement and revenue growth.
* Create a segmentation strategy to personalize messaging and positioning for diverse consumer audiences.
* Craft welcome and onboarding, nurture, and retention email program to include automated and monthly campaigns.
* Develop new, innovative ways to improve conversion rates and efficiency through data-driven insights, experimentation, and automation.
* Monitor and analyze campaign performance metrics, providing regular reports and insights to key stakeholders.
* Lead the content briefing process to create compelling and engaging campaigns.
* Work closely with product and customer success teams to ensure cohesive alignment with overall business objectives.
* Stay updated on industry best practices and explore opportunities to optimize campaigns through other CRM and ESPs as needed.

### **Qualifications:**

* 10+ years marketing experience, and at least 3+ years in lifecycle marketing, including campaign strategy/development, messaging, segmentation, experimentation, and optimization
* Knowledge of a modern CRM platform such as Salesforce Marketing Cloud and a track record leveraging tools to create successful, multi-channel, and multi touch campaigns.
* Ability to balance short-term gains with long-term impact and experience manipulating and analyzing data in Google Analytics and Mixpanel to draw insights and learnings and craft recommendations.
* Data-driven and analytical skills and ability to easily work with data engineering, data science, and analytics teams to execute opportunities that streamline and scale your programs
* Creative self-starter that imagines and executes successful marketing programs through effective project management
* Strong verbal and written communication skills, with the ability to influence and collaborate effectively.
* Previous experience working in a heavily regulated environment (telehealth, fintech) a plus


As a full-time Sr. Lifecycle Marketing Manager, you will be employed by Lyra Health, Inc. The anticipated annual base salary range for this full-time position is $119,000-183,000. The base range is determined by role and level, and placement within the range will depend on a number of job-related factors, including but not limited to your skills, qualifications, experience and location.  

At Lyra, base salary is only one aspect of an employee’s total compensation package, which additionally may include discretionary restricted stock unit awards, comprehensive medical and dental coverage, and retirement benefits. This role may also be eligible for discretionary bonuses.  

We also offer generous benefits that include:* Comprehensive healthcare coverage (including medical, dental, vision, FSA/HSA, life and disability insurances)
* Lyra for Lyrians; coaching and therapy services
* Equity in the company through discretionary restricted stock units
* Competitive time off with pay policies including vacation, sick days, and company holidays
* Paid parental leave
* 401K retirement benefits
* Monthly tech stipend
* We like to spread joy throughout the year with well-being perks and activities, surprise swag, free food and snack deliveries each month, regular community celebration…and more!

  

We can’t wait to meet you.
We are an Equal Opportunity Employer. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, sex (including pregnancy), national origin, age, disability, genetic information or any other category protected by law.  

By applying for this position, your data will be processed as per Lyra Health Workforce Privacy Notice. Through this application, we will collect personal information from you including your name, email address, gender identity, employment information, and phone number for the purposes of recruiting and assessing suitability, aptitude, skills, qualifications, and interests for employment with Lyra. We may also collect information about your race, ethnicity, and sexual orientation, which is considered sensitive personal information under the California Privacy Rights Act (CPRA). Providing this information is optional and completely voluntary. If you are a California resident and would like to limit how we use this information, please use the Limit the Use of My Sensitive Personal Information form. This information will only be retained for as long as needed to fulfill the purposes for which it was collected, as described above. Please note that Lyra does not “sell” or “share” personal information as defined by the CPRA. For more information about how we use and retain your information, please see our Workforce Privacy Notice.

title: Marketing Assistant
description:
**Who are we and what do we stand for?**
========================================


**1. Our story**
----------------


Launched in 2013 by Moulaye and Kadry as a side project to help a friend's mother, they understood quickly that there was room for opportunity for distribution through the web for African culture.


With an outsourced MVP, they saw the first orders coming and they decided to dedicate themselves full time to this growing project. With the coming of Luc, in 2016 they focused on Tech and Product and then launched Afrikrea, the marketplace, and Boom… a growth of 8% per week doubling our revenue every quarter and multiplying our revenue 10 times every year!


After several fundraisings, a move to Abidjan, the coming of the first team members, and a strong partnership with DHL, Afrikrea became their number one African eCommerce exporter.


Since starting, we enabled over 50m$ of transactions in175 countries !


**2. The current situation: the transition to Anka**
----------------------------------------------------


In 2020, rich in these years of experience in direct contact with sellers and as entrepreneurs serving entrepreneurs, we understood that the challenges of the sellers were deeper than those solved by the marketplace, Afrikrea. The sellers faced specific African issues such as the lack of visibility globally, the difficulty of shipping products worldwide from Africa, and the complexity of payments between international and local ways. To resolve these needs that exceed the perimeter of a simple marketplace, they decided to create Anka.


Anka, powered by Afrikrea, is the all-in-one solution for sellers of products « Made of Africa » (fashion, art, food, or beauty…) to sell from anywhere, ship worldwide, get paid faster on international or local African payment methods, and easily manage their businesses. Our new vision is clear: Export Africa by building the future of selling globally!


In January 2022, we raised 5,4 million euros from top-tier investors (including the co-founder of Alibaba) and it's the reason why we are looking for the right people to help us achieve this vision.

  

  

**Few KPIs about Anka**
-----------------------


### **1. General KPIs**


* 20 000+ sellers in 46 African countries and 100 in total


* 50+ million dollars of transactions in 175 countries


* Each month 1 200 000+ visits;


* Each week 7 000+ new products;


* Each day 1 200+ messages exchanged ;


* A team of 45 team members in 13 countries, passionate about this vision, diverse, experienced, working in full remote (since day 1), and very cool!

  

  

### **2. Specific KPI for the Marketing Assistant**


* 440K followers on Instagram


* 100K on TikTok


* 100K subscribers to our newsletters


**What are we looking for?**
============================


### **1. Context of the team and vision of the job**


We're looking for a self-driven Marketing Assistant to join our Marketing team of 5 people The tasks are entry-level and cover a 360° scope of content and data marketing for a booming e-commerce platform. We're looking for rigorous, reliable and curious minds who wish to learn the ropes and express their creativity in a flexible marketing team.


Under the responsibility of Milca you'll assist in several and recurring marketing tasks including:


**Newsletter management**


* Curation, creation and scheduling of newsletters.


* Assist for drafting copy, designing templates, personalization, and A/B testing for optimal results.


* Monitor email performance and optimize for engagement and conversion.


**Moderation**


* Review flagged products on the marketplace


* Assist for copycats moderation and tracking


**Curation and Social media management**


* Assist in the development and execution of social media strategies on FB,IG, TikTok, Pinterest


* Curate and schedule engaging content for FB,IG,TikTok


* Monitor social media channels, respond to comments, and engage with the audience


* Assist in product selection and curation for collections


**Reporting**


* Reporting of social media and newsletter performance metrics


* Learn to analyze data and identify trends.


* Contribute to the preparation of reports and presentations.


What will you need to succeed?


### **2. Skills & qualifications**


* Proven experience in a marketing or related role.(at least 1 year)


* Creative thinker and social media savvy


* Strong interest in marketing and willingness to learn


* Strong interest in African fashion, crafts and culture


* Excellent written and verbal communication skills


* Detail-oriented with excellent organizational skills


* Ability to multitask and prioritize tasks effectively

  

  

**Our hiring process**
----------------------


* Send your resume with a quick intro mail alongside your portfolio ( if applies)


* Screening call: 30-minute interview on Zoom with Marina, our Head of People & Culture, to discuss your motivation & fit for the role


* A Technical test


* An interview with Ilan and Milca


### **Key information**


* Start date: as soon as we find our rocket talent


* Contract: Ivorian Long term contract or consultancy contract


**What do we have to offer?**
=============================


1. A competitive salary


2. Our culture “Teamwork, Determination, Accountability, Exploration”


* Teamwork - Alone you go fast, together we go far, empathy is key.


* Determination - Keep trying until you deliver.


* Accountability - Say it, own it, do it!


* Exploration - Create the future you imagine.


3. Our work-from-home Policy (100% remote since Day 1)


Freedom and flexibility to work from everywhere which implies asynchronous and structured communication (thanks to Basecamp) but also flexibility, autonomy, and discipline.


4. The possibility of growing quickly within the organization


As a small startup, there are rooms for opportunities at Anka! Thanks to our quarterly evaluation and monthly feedback, you'll know easily what areas you'll have to improve and what you succeed in.


If you meet or exceed our expectations, there'll be the possibility in 1 year to evolve horizontally or vertically with a salary increase.


**Our perks**
=============


* Health Coverage for you and your family


* Paid Holidays: 30 days per year


* Company Goodies

  

  

**Our rituals**
===============


**General**


* The AHOM: Our weekly company meeting


* 1-week meet-up once a year in an African city all together


**Specific for the role**


* Weekly 1:1 with the manager


* Team weekly meeting


**Our Diversity and Inclusion Policy**
======================================


We're Anka. We truly embrace diversity and inclusion. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to color, religion, sex, national origin, sexuality, disability, or any other characteristic.


If you want to be truly yourself, work from where you want but also work in an organization with an international impact, Anka is the right place for you!

title: Marketing Specialist (Remote)
description:
Authority Brands Inc. headquartered in Columbia, MD is a leading provider of home services, building brands that support the success of our franchisees, as well as bettering the lives of the homeowners we serve and the people we employ.
  
  

The Marketing Specialist will assist in overall marketing efforts within the Sure Start Marketing program for the Trade Brands. This role is an integral part of the planning and execution of business pre-open and post-open marketing strategies aimed at viable leads to our newest franchise partners.
  
  

**Responsibilities:**  

* Work with Sure Start Marketing Manager, Trade Brands Marketing Managers, operations teams, and greater Authority Brands team to outline, plan and execute strategic marketing plan and initiatives for the Trade Brands.
* Help franchise partners develop and manage local marketing budgets.
* Move projects from ideation through to completion, and track status of projects.
* Be knowledgeable about trends in brands’ data including lead flow, booking rate, close rate, and other KPIs. Understand marketing’s contribution to these KPIs and actively contribute to their improvement with the marketing team.
* Complete research and present recommendations for marketing naming conventions, based on franchise-partner local market needs and trends.
* Help manage brands’ websites, including working with website partners, vendors, and internal teams to ensure accuracy of brand information, approval of franchisee submitted content, implement franchisees’ requested changes, and new location website launches, digital footprint pieces and creative graphic requests.
* Complete online presence audits to ensure consistency across online presence for franchise locations.
* Support marketing team in the analysis of marketing performance and results and help communicate these to franchise partners and other teams.
* Assist in onboarding new franchise partners and introduce them to the marketing system and available assets and strategies and provide ad hoc strategic support.
* Develop and manage franchisee-facing content such as weekly meeting agendas, task checklists, training and other educational items.
* Interact with franchise partners, vendors and internal teams, serving as a guide and project manager during their onboarding process. Develop best practices for cross-brand collaboration and sharing.


**Qualifications:**  

* Self-motivated, results-oriented, confident, and passionate.
* Comfortable with creating new processes, establishing organization and structure in environments without much existing process and structure.
* Knowledge/understanding of digital marketing, including ability to interpret digital campaign results (SEO, PPC, remarketing, display).
* Excellent problem-solving skills.
* Energetic, open to collaborative and dynamic environment, business minded, strategic and creative.
* Public presentation skills, targeted at influencing audiences to achieve company goals.
* Open to both receiving and giving constructive feedback in a professional manner and context.
* Remaining open-minded to ongoing and dynamic change, as market trends, company shifts, and resource alternations occur.
* Keeping our franchise partners’ business success at the forefront of our why and our how.


We believe our greatest assets are our employees, we offer competitive salaries and a full benefits package to include, PTO, paid holidays, 401(k) and more.
  
  

Authority Brands Inc. conducts drug screens and background checks on applicants who accept employment offers. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions however we do not sponsor Visa’s at this time.
  
  

Authority Brands Inc. is an Equal Opportunity Employer

title: Frontline Marketing & Sales Enablement Manager
description:
**About the team**
------------------


Zillow is on a mission to rewire the real estate transaction! To enable that reality, we power an active network of partners across the country. Our Sales organization helps our partners grow the reach and impact of their businesses by connecting them to customers who seek to rent, buy or sell their homes. Sales plays a vital role, driving the acquisition, growth, and retention of partners but also influences the evolution of these partnerships as Zillow moves toward the next generation of our offerings. Sales’ success is our success, and we are committed to making their lives easier, better empowered, and more productive. The cross-functional Frontline Marketing team is chartered to deliver outstanding enablement through more relevant content, training, and tools to support product and program readiness of our frontline teams.**About the role**
------------------


We are seeking an experienced Marketing and Sales Enablement manager to support the step-level change in Sales Success efforts across our frontline teams! As a member of our team, you will play a pivotal role in optimizing the performance of Sales through the strategy, design, and successful execution of strong enablement programs that increase sales efficiency and drive revenue. This role brings new sales enablement ideas and strategies to up-level the Sales game we play today. You work directly with Sales and Operations to define, prioritize and drive sales effectiveness strategies aligned to business objectives. You are a “go-to” source for understanding the competition and market dynamics to strengthen our pitch of “why Zillow”, constantly targeting greater differentiation with our value proposition. You integrate Sales into the way the Business and Marketing think about frontline activation, delivering both To- and Through-Sales strategy and tactics. You thrive working cross-functionally—interfacing and collaborating with a wide variety of leaders across Marketing, Communications, Operations, Product, Training, and Sales and Service Teams. You are part of a Marketing team passionate about product and program enablement and readiness of our frontline teams.

**Core Responsibilities**
-------------------------

* You will be responsible for driving the end to end strategy of best-in-class enablement content and communications. This role will define program-level content and communications for the many operators across the customer and partner experience with Zillow. This role will help determine the best methods to deliver this “right message, right time” strategy.
* You build unique Sales activations as a part of our broader Marketing and brand efforts, driving relevant brand and marketing activations through frontline as a channel and translating campaigns into frontline tactics, content and collateral.
* Identify and support sales and revenue objectives through new Sales opportunities and effective enablement strategy.
* You support product launches in partnership with Product and Product Marketing by preparing and enabling the sales team to understand, pitch and sell through products and services.
* You work collaboratively across Sales, Operations, Training, Product, and Marketing to drive strategic alignment, effectiveness strategies, and new efficiencies across the organization.
* You are passionate about measurement and help to build foundational metrics for sales enablement to drive action plans for increased sales efficiency, adoption of enablement programs, and return on investment.
* You have a passion for insights, translating internal and market data into consumable assets for Sales.
* You influence the pursuit of and the continued investment in our Sales Enablement infrastructure to unlock scale, efficiency, and effectiveness. Your proactive knowledge of CRM and sales tools, technology, and industry standards will enable new unlocks for key sales capabilities.


This role has been categorized as a Remote position. “Remote” employees do not have a permanent corporate office workplace and, instead, work from a physical location of their choice which must be identified to the Company. Employees may live in any of the 50 US States, with limited exceptions. In certain cases, an employee in a remote-designated job may need to live in a specific region or time zone to support customers or clients as part of their role.
In California, Colorado, Connecticut, Hawaii, Nevada, New York and Washington the standard base pay range for this role is $103,200.00 - $164,800.00 Annually. This base pay range is specific to California, Colorado, Connecticut, Hawaii, Nevada, New York and Washington and may not be applicable to other locations.
In addition to a competitive base salary this position is also eligible for equity awards based on factors such as experience, performance and location. Actual amounts will vary depending on experience, performance and location.**Who you are**
---------------

* 6+ years mix of Consumer and Enterprise Marketing, Product Marketing, Sales and Service enablement experience or highly related revenue-driving experience
* A self starter with excellent problem solving and analytical skills
* Shown proficiency in collaboration, communication, and driving behavior change with Sales teams
* Experience crafting content from scratch, analyzing performance and actioning on next steps
* Proven project management skills and experience coordinating robust cross-functional teams to deliver phenomenal outcomes
* Experience in reporting, compiling requirements and use cases for business briefs
* Hands-on knowledge and expertise in extracting the most value from a Sales and Service tech stack: Salesforce, Highspot, Gong, Outreach, Salesloft, and related key enablement tools of the frontline.

**Get to know us**
------------------


Zillow is reimagining real estate to make home a reality for more and more people.


As the most-visited real estate website in the United States, Zillow® and its affiliates help movers find and win their home through digital solutions, first class partners, and easier buying, selling, financing and renting experiences. Millions of people visit Zillow Group sites every month to start their home search, and now they can rely on Zillow to help make it easier to move. The work we do helps people get home and no matter what job you're in, you will play a critical role in making home a reality for more and more people.


Our efforts to streamline the real estate transaction are supported by a deep-rooted culture of innovation, our passion to redefine the employee experience, a fundamental commitment to Equity and Belonging, and world-class benefits. These benefits include comprehensive medical, dental, vision, life, and disability coverages as well as parental leave, family benefits, retirement contributions, and paid time off. We’re also setting the standard for work experiences of the future, where our employees are supported in doing their best work and living a flexible, well-balanced life. But don’t just take our word for it. Read recent reviews on Glassdoor and recent recognition from multiple organizations, including: the 100 Best Companies to Work For, Glassdoor Employees’ Choice Award, Bloomberg Gender-Equality Index, Human Rights Campaign (HRC) Corporate Equity Index, and TIME 100 Most Influential Companies list.

*Zillow Group is an equal opportunity employer committed to fostering an inclusive, innovative environment with the best employees. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please contact us at RecruitingAccessibility@zillowgroup.com.*

*Applicants who receive job offers from Zillow Group will be asked to sign a Proprietary Rights Agreement which includes confidentiality, intellectual property assignment, customer and employee non-solicitation, and non-competition provisions. If you are contacted for a role at Zillow Group and wish to review a copy of the Proprietary Rights Agreement prior to receiving an offer, you may request a copy from your Recruiter.*

title: Marketing Manager
description:
**Slyman Bros Career Opportunity: Marketing Manager**


**Elevate Your Career at Slyman Bros - The Market Leader in Appliance Retail in St. Louis, MO**


**Position:** Marketing Manager


**Location:** Remote, Hybrid or On-site in St. Louis, MO


**Start Date:** Flexible


**About Slyman Bros:** As the market leader in the retail appliance sector in St. Louis, MO, Slyman Bros is at the forefront of innovation and customer service. We are on the lookout for an experienced Marketing Manager to spearhead our marketing strategies. This position offers the flexibility of a hybrid or on-site work arrangement, providing a unique opportunity for you to contribute significantly to our growth while shaping our marketing direction.


**Role Overview:** The Marketing Manager will be entrusted with leading our overall marketing strategy, working in tandem with a dedicated team of in-house professionals, external contractors, agencies, and web service providers. This role involves orchestrating all marketing facets, from promotional activities and sales campaigns to enhancing our online presence. Your mission will be to build a high-performing team, spearhead strategic initiatives, and meticulously track their success, ensuring Slyman Bros maintains its leadership in the appliance retail market.


**Key Responsibilities:**


* Craft and implement a strategic marketing plan that drives growth and aligns with our corporate objectives.
* Lead and mentor a versatile team, operating in either a remote, hybrid or on-site capacity, to execute impactful marketing campaigns.
* Collaborate with external partners to deliver cohesive and successful marketing initiatives across multiple channels.
* Utilize data-driven insights to refine marketing strategies and measure effectiveness, ensuring optimal ROI.
* Keep abreast of industry trends and leverage innovative marketing techniques to maintain Slyman Bros' position as a market leader.


**Compensation:**


* **Starting Salary:** $100,000 annually, complemented by performance bonuses and opportunities for growth commission incentives as we grow.
* **Benefits:** Enjoy unlimited PTO, fostering a supportive environment that encourages work-life balance.


**Ideal Candidate:**


* A seasoned marketer with a proven track record of developing and leading successful marketing strategies.
* Strong leadership capabilities, able to inspire and manage a team in a hybrid or on-site setting.
* Excellent communicator, proficient in collaborating with various stakeholders to achieve common goals.
* Strategic and analytical thinker, adept at utilizing market insights to drive decision-making and innovation.
* Creative and forward-thinking, with a keen understanding of the latest marketing trends and digital tools.


**How to Apply:** We invite passionate marketing professionals eager to contribute to the continued success of Slyman Bros. Please submit your application and resume via our online portal: https://slyman-bros-appliances.breezy.hr/.


**Why Slyman Bros?** Joining Slyman Bros as a Marketing Manager means becoming part of a team that values innovation, leadership, and strategic growth. With the option for hybrid or on-site work in St. Louis, MO, you'll have the flexibility to excel in your role while enjoying the dynamic culture of a market leader. Benefit from a competitive salary, performance incentives, and the opportunity to make a significant impact in the retail appliance industry. Apply now to start your journey with Slyman Bros.

title: Account Executive, Digital Marketing
description:
**Position Summary**


MyAdvice is hiring true hunters/closers ready to break into the lucrative digital marketing sales industry by consulting with medical practitioners on our cutting edge, proprietary SaaS marketing platform. Account Executives are responsible for elevating MyAdvice by ultimately helping our clients grow through a robust online presence. This is an experienced sales position meaning you must be familiar with digital marketing and have robust closing and hunting experience. This is a high volume, outbound, hunter sales role where you’ll be expected to source new business from scratch while owning the full sales cycle.


MyAdvice's Account Executives (AEs) will identify ideal client profiles, assess the practice’s unique online marketing needs then cater outreach to capitalize on selling a feature suite that maximizes value. AEs will accomplish this by exercising proven sales acumen to act as the authority on medical marketing concepts by utilizing their extensive MyAdvice product knowledge, excellent technical skills and strong understanding of industry trends. Successful AEs are skilled communicators and presenters who find the best fit between client and platform features.


Our ideal candidate is one who works well under pressure, is highly self-motivated and easily initiates relaxed, yet informative, two-way conversations with prospects. They are coachable, adaptable, tenacious, excellent multitaskers and organized. The right candidate is able to convey potentially unfamiliar technical concepts to prospective clients in an easy-to-understand manner. They’re focused on enhancing the buyer experience and comfortable challenging prospects to ensure results. Ultimately, our best fit for Account Executive is one that’s passionate about not only their own personal excellence, but also their client’s success.


MyAdvice is proud to offer its sales team robust support. Your sales manager isn’t afraid to “get their hands dirty” by working 1:1 on skills development, offering custom coaching and actually demonstrating what it takes to close a deal. You’ll enjoy further mentorship by seasoned MyAdvice sales professionals that’ve been with our company over a decade. We also have a tuition reimbursement program and a well-defined career path from AE to Senior Account Executive. Product knowledge training and sales skills coaching is backed by a solid tech stack to prioritize your time on outreach and closing. While you’re expected to hunt your own leads, you'll also be supported by an in-house marketing team and dedicated lead generation specialist.

* **This position can be remote, hybrid or in-office depending on candidate preference and location.** MyAdvice has offices in Melville, New York and Lehi, Utah.

**Essential Duties**

* Passionately present MyAdvice platform features to new prospects to generate new sales
* Educate prospects through a consultative sales approach paired with a transactional close process
* Grow business by calling on marketing leads and self-generating new prospects
* Demonstrate comprehensive product and industry knowledge to articulate value to prospects
* Hold yourself accountable to and carry a quota of net-new closed revenue
* Maintain pipeline management through sales software
* Collaborate with others on the sales and marketing teams to ensure goal attainment
* Relentlessly drive to achieve personal and company goals
* Maintain a positive and resilient attitude
* Perform other duties as assigned

**Tech Stack + Resources**

* MacBook, monitor and headset provided
* Apollo (lead database)
* Zoom (video conferencing)
* TalkDesk (softphones system)
* Pipedrive (Sales-specific CRM)
* PandaDoc (contract processing software)
* Dedicated in-house marketing team providing inbound marketing leads
* In-house lead generation specialist providing high quality, curated lead lists that meet company ICP
* Sales skill development, custom coaching plan and training on industry best practices

**Required Skills**

* Strong interpersonal skills; must be able to negotiate, problem-solve, make decisions and act as the authority on MyAdvice’s platform of marketing features and services
* Exceptional oral and written communication skills
* Demonstrated business acumen and a deep understanding of sales processes
* Well versed in CRM, presentation, video conferencing and other business software
* Medical, dental or marketing sales experience (preferred)

**Required Qualifications**

* Minimum of 3-5 years of account executive, B2B sales, outside sales or territory sales experience
* Must have a working knowledge of digital marketing concepts; minimum 2 years experience
* Bachelor’s degree in Sales, Marketing, Communications or related field *preferred*
* Must have reliable internet, phone and a professional, quiet/private workplace
* Legally authorized to hold employment within the United States

**Position Details**

* Schedule: Monday-Friday, typical business hours (early-out Fridays!)
	+ For example: 8am-5pm or 9am-6pm with an hour lunch break
	+ Flexible scheduling available per manager’s approval
	+ Occasional after-hours work may be required depending on prospect’s availability
* Travel: May require occasional local or national travel (less than 5% of the time, if at all).
* Physical Requirements: Prolonged periods sitting at a desk and working on a computer (90% at desk, 10% of time walking); Ability to lift up to 30 lbs and use typical office equipment (computers, keyboards, printer, etc.)

**Benefits Package**

* Employer Contributed Plans: Medical, Vision, Life and AD+D Insurances
* Voluntary Plans: Dental, Critical Illness, Accident and Pet Insurances
* Unlimited Paid Time Off + 12 Paid Holidays
* Remote-first Company, Flexible Schedules + Early Out Fridays!
* 401(k) Plan with 50% Company Match (up to 6%)
* Employee Assistance Program (free mental health services, financial/legal consultations and more!)
* Tuition Reimbursement Program (up to $1,800 annually) and Executive Mentorship Program
* Leadership Training Program: Learn the basics of how to lead a team! Available to all employees.
* Ongoing Personalized Coaching and Career Development
* Casual Dress and Fun Work Environment (games, coffee, snacks, etc.)
* Perks at Work Employee Discount Program
* Core Value "Pay It Forward" Initiative, Project Fantastic (client collab) and more!

**MyAdvice**
MyAdvice empowers business owners and professionals to increase their revenue by attracting and retaining more clients through digital marketing. The SaaS-based platform enables hands-on control and visibility into performance of online marketing activities, backed by 20+ years of best practices and expertise on how to maximize those efforts. MyAdvice’s six-stage Pyramid of Success™ provides a proven step-by-step plan for how and when to implement growth-oriented marketing tactics for greatest impact, including website design and maintenance, local directories, client reviews, social media, search engine optimization (SEO) and paid advertising. Learn more at myadvice.com.


We are committed to diversity and inclusion as we understand and value its importance to our success. Our team thrives upon our employee's unique experiences to propel creative solutions, so we aspire to continue building upon our diverse team to include groups that are traditionally underrepresented. Additionally, studies have shown that minorities are less likely to apply for a position if they don't meet every qualification. MyAdvice prioritizes a strong company culture fit and believes in providing opportunities to individuals with exceptional work ethic. Skills can be taught. With that in mind, if you believe yourself to be a good fit, we strongly encourage people of all backgrounds to apply.


MyAdvice is a performance based and data driven company that has experienced tremendous growth within the last year, so we're excited for the opportunity to introduce new talent. MyAdvice’s progressive values include transparency, teamwork, relentless effort and intellectual honesty in order to bring about the success of our clients. We encourage continuous education, career development and work/life balance while thriving in a casual and collaborative work environment. With MyAdvice you will be a valued and integral member whom we will continually invest.

title: Affiliate Marketing Manager
description:
**About Tierra:**

Tierra is a performance marketing agency focused on driving profitable customer acquisition for DTC ecommerce and lead generation businesses. Headquartered in Carlsbad, California we are a fast-paced, fun, and ever-evolving creative team that helps online entrepreneurs scale beyond their wildest dreams.

At Tierra, our values define us and push us to be our best. We’re always leveling up ourselves and each other because we never settle for less. We're passionate about our process because we know it works. Where others only see problems, we imagine solutions. We always do the right thing, and most importantly, we enjoy the ride. After all, if we’re not having fun, what’s the point?

**Job Summary:**

Join our team as an Affiliate Marketing Manager, where you'll play a pivotal role in driving the success of affiliate marketing campaigns for ecommerce and lead gen clients. You'll oversee and optimize affiliate marketing initiatives across leading networks, working closely with clients and internal teams to develop and execute strategies that deliver tangible results. You'll leverage your expertise in affiliate program management and industry best practices to drive revenue, enhance client relationships, and exceed performance targets.

With a focus on data-driven decision-making and a commitment to excellence, you'll continuously evaluate campaign performance, analyze key metrics, and provide actionable insights to optimize outcomes. Your strong communication skills and collaborative approach will foster meaningful partnerships with affiliates, clients, and colleagues, driving success in a fast-paced, dynamic environment.

If you're passionate about affiliate marketing, thrive on delivering results, and embrace a culture that values integrity and innovation, we invite you to join our team at Tierra and make a meaningful impact in the world of digital marketing.

As an Affiliate Marketing Manager, you will:

* Oversee clients' affiliate marketing campaigns across leading networks such as Squaredance, MaxBounty, Impact Radius, ShareASale, Verve Direct, GiddyUp, and others.
* Manage the onboarding process and announcement of offers.
* Develop and execute ecommerce and lead generation campaigns on various affiliate networks, including recruiting, onboarding, and nurturing relationships with affiliate partners.
* Continuously assess affiliate applications, optimize the network by identifying top-performing affiliates, and removing underperforming ones.
* Drive affiliate traffic growth by actively seeking new partnership opportunities.
* Collaborate with clients and internal teams to align on business goals and devise effective affiliate marketing strategies.
* Strategize and implement affiliate marketing campaigns to boost client traffic, leads, and conversions.
* Monitor and fine-tune campaign performance by analyzing key metrics and making data-driven decisions to optimize results.
* Present ongoing affiliate campaign results to clients bi-weekly.
* Cultivate strong relationships with affiliates through regular communication, performance feedback, and incentives to enhance engagement and productivity.
* Conduct periodic performance evaluations of affiliate partners, offering constructive feedback and identifying areas for improvement.
* Track, analyze, and report on key performance metrics, offering insights and recommendations to enhance affiliate marketing campaigns.
* Collaborate closely with the analytics team to ensure accurate reporting for clients, aligning with platform results.

Qualifications:

* Bachelor's degree in marketing, business, or a related field (or equivalent work experience)
* 3+ years of experience in managing affiliate programs
* Proven track record of success in managing affiliate marketing programs, preferably within an affiliate network or digital agency
* Comprehensive understanding of affiliate marketing principles, industry trends, and best practices
* Strong analytical skills, capable of interpreting data, deriving insights, and making data-driven decisions
* Exceptional communication and interpersonal abilities, enabling effective collaboration with internal and external stakeholders
* Results-driven mindset, focused on revenue generation and achievement of key performance indicators (KPIs)
* Familiarity with affiliate tracking platforms, analytics tools, and performance marketing technologies
* Ability to effectively prioritize tasks and meet deadlines in a dynamic work environment
* Demonstrated personal and professional integrity

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $65,000.00 - $80,000.00 per year

Benefits:

* Dental insurance
* Flexible schedule
* Health insurance
* Paid time off
* Vision insurance

Schedule:

* Monday to Friday

Supplemental pay types:

* Bonus opportunities

Work Location: Remote

title: Performance Marketing Manager
description:
As a **Performance Marketing Manager**, you will be pivotal in strategizing, managing, and optimizing our digital marketing campaigns across multiple channels, including Facebook Ads, Google Ads, Pinterest, Display networks, and more. You will lead the creation, planning, and testing of campaigns, aiming to maximize our return on ad spend (ROAS) and increase our website's conversion rate.

**Key Responsibilities:**

* Collaborate with our CEO to define our paid performance strategy, including budget allocation, campaign planning, and setting KPIs and targets for each marketing channel.
* Take the reins of our digital media buying and optimization, primarily focusing on Facebook, Google, Pinterest, YouTube, and TikTok. Your goal? Driving strong growth while ensuring customer acquisition at target costs.
* Work closely with our in-house creative teams to hypothesize, analyze, and improve our ad creatives, unlocking higher ROAS and optimizing campaign performance.
* Champion experimentation, always looking for opportunities to test and learn, and fine-tuning our strategies for maximum impact.
* Identify new digital media opportunities to expand our reach and achieve our ambitious targets.
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including technology, product, customer care, and operations, to align marketing initiatives with our broader strategies.
* Conduct conversion optimization experiments to improve website performance and increase conversion rates.
* Utilize SEO techniques to improve organic search rankings.
* Monitor and manage social media channels to enhance brand visibility.

**Requirements:**

* Must have a minimum of 6+ years of experience in digital performance marketing, with a strong focus on Facebook and Google platforms.
* Proven track record of managing significant digital marketing budgets across multiple channels, the optimizing allocation for maximum impact throughout the marketing funnel.
* Experience driving aggressive growth metrics and achieving exceptional results.
* Deep expertise in managing ads across Facebook and Google, leveraging these platforms to fuel exponential growth.
* Analytical mindset with exceptional data manipulation and analytics skills.
* Strong decision-making abilities, both strategically and tactically, backed by quantitative insights.
* Experience collaborating with creative teams to test and iterate new ad concepts is highly desired.
* Familiarity with other digital and traditional media planning and buying is a plus.
* Excellent communication skills and ability to deliver high-quality work with speed.

If you are a results-oriented individual with a passion for driving performance through digital marketing strategies, we would love to hear from you. Join our team as a Performance Manager and help us take our online presence to new heights!

Job Type: Full-time

Salary: $83,890.00 - $92,324.00 per year

Benefits:

* Flexible schedule
* Health insurance
* Paid time off

Schedule:

* 8 hour shift
* Monday to Friday

Work Location: Remote

title: Marketing and Social Media Manager
description:
* Do you thrive in innovative, fast-paced start-up environments?
* Are you a data and process driven strategic thinker?
* Does your background include experience in both media and SaaS organizations?


If so, we’d love to connect!
  
  

BLOX Digital is revolutionizing the way more than 2,000 media organizations across North America operate with our suite of integrated, proprietary SaaS solutions. From cutting-edge CMS and VMS platforms to innovative apps, smart paywalls, and game-changing digital advertising tools, we're leading the industry forward.
  
  

We're on the hunt for a Marketing and Social Media Coordinator who is motivated, smart, adaptable, and emotionally intelligent. Join us as we shape the future of digital media.
  
  

**Overview:**  

As BLOX Digital continues to pioneer the SaaS landscape, serving the media industry with innovative solutions for over three decades, we are seeking a dynamic Marketing and Social Media Coordinator. This role is crafted for a driven individual with a knack for creating compelling content and strategies that not only resonate with our audience but also propel our brand's presence and engagement to new heights. Your mission will be to synergize with our overarching marketing goals, enhancing online engagement and driving customer acquisition through strategic and creative initiatives.
  
  

**Key Responsibilities:**  

* Strategically expand our social media footprint, focusing on core markets to significantly boost BLOX Digital's online presence.
* Craft and distribute high-impact social content across platforms like LinkedIn, emphasizing our B2B solutions and contributing to top-of-funnel growth.
* Design on-brand visual content for various channels including social media, our website, sales presentations, and marketing materials.
* Conduct detailed analytics on social campaign performance, monitor key metrics, and leverage this data to steer future strategies and optimize results.
* Play a pivotal role in social media video production from concept to execution, coordinating effectively with video production units.
* Innovate and manage the creation and distribution of engaging marketing swag and collateral, ensuring efficient handling of inventory, budget, and procurement.
* Lead the coordination of trade show activities from A to Z, encompassing logistics, on-site lead generation tactics, and preparatory sales/marketing strategies.
* Collaborate in crafting compelling sales enablement resources, including presentations, email campaigns, datasheets, case studies, and demos to bolster the sales team's product promotion efforts.
* Oversee paid social advertising initiatives, fine-tuning targeting and budget allocations to maximize investment returns.


**Qualifications:**  

* Proficient with Salesforce and Pardot, leveraging these platforms to drive marketing success.
* Hands-on experience in social media marketing, particularly within the B2B, technology, and software product sectors.
* Deep understanding of social media dynamics, especially on LinkedIn, with a proven track record of creating engaging content.
* Skilled in graphic design with proficiency in tools like Adobe Creative Suite, Canva, or equivalent.
* Competent with website content management systems and a foundational knowledge of HTML/CSS.
* Exceptional project management abilities, adept at juggling multiple tasks with a keen eye for detail.
* Stellar communication and interpersonal skills, fostering seamless collaboration and meticulous attention to detail.
* Self-motivated, results-driven, and eager for personal and professional growth.


What does BLOX Digital brings to the table?
  
* A vibrant, collaborative work environment where your ideas and contributions are valued.
* Opportunities for professional growth and development.
* Competitive salary and benefits package.
* A culture that embraces change, innovation, and the pursuit of excellence.


**More about BLOX Digital:**  

* Stable 35-year-old company that supports the digital transformation of over 2,000 media organizations.
* Offer a truly end-to-end set of solutions for those in the publishing and broadcast media space.
* Mature company that thinks and acts like a start-up.
* 30% market share in the media CMS space generating 6.8BB annual page views.
* A laser focus on new market entry and overseas expansion.
* We recognize, celebrate and evangelize the success of our teams.
* A purpose driven and employee-first work culture.
* We make a difference every single day in the support and growth of local journalism.


**Pay:** $80,000 - $85,000
  
Why Join Us?
  
BLOX Digital offers competitive wages in a dynamic, interesting work environment with career growth opportunities. We offer an extensive benefit program that can be personalized to your needs. Our benefit program includes medical, dental, vision, short and long-term disability, company provided life insurance and supplemental life insurance. In addition, we offer a 401K retirement plan with company match. We also offer generous paid time off to allow the flexibility to balance personal life and work. This includes paid parental leave for new parents.
  
BLOX Digital is a leading digital solutions provider for media organizations across the United States and beyond. Our comprehensive suite of solutions encompasses everything from content management systems to managed digital advertising services, ensuring that you have access to the latest technology and strategies to succeed in today's ever-changing media landscape. BLOX Digital is majority owned by Lee Enterprises.
  
Lee Enterprises a leading provider of high-quality local news, with 75 markets in 26 states that have print, digital and e-replica versions. Our digital sites attract more than 34 million unique visits monthly. We also have a rapidly growing roster of digital products for consumers, and are committed to aggressive digital growth.
  
Lee Enterprises is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We respect and celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees. For more information about Lee, check us out at www.lee.net.
  
We are focused on building a diverse and inclusive workforce. If you are excited about this role but do not meet 100% of the qualifications above, we encourage you to apply.

title: Senior Product Manager (Remote or Seattle)
description:
**WHO ARE WE**



Parse Biosciences is a global life sciences company whose mission is to accelerate progress in human health and scientific research. Empowering researchers to perform single cell sequencing with unprecedented scale and ease, our pioneering approach has enabled groundbreaking discoveries in cancer treatment, tissue repair, stem cell therapy, kidney and liver disease, brain development, and the immune system.



With technology developed at The University of Washington, Parse has raised over $100 million in capital and is now used by over 1,500 customers across the world. Our growing portfolio of products includes Evercode Whole Transcriptome, Evercode TCR, Gene Capture, and a data analysis solution.



Parse Biosciences is based in Seattle, Washington's vibrant South Lake Union district, where we recently opened a 34,000 square foot headquarters and state-of-the-art laboratory.


**THE POSITION**



As a Senior Product Manager, you will own current and future products within the Evercode™ product lines and be responsible for their commercial success. You will be the central advocate for the customer internally while proactively building a community externally. To be successful, this person must be effective collaborating across product development, sales, support, and marketing teams to effectively communicate and champion product initiatives.


**IN THIS POSITION, YOU WILL**


* Manage the market development and on-market support for current and future products in Evercode™ single cell product lines
* Define the market need and requirements for new product concepts and development initiatives
* Advocate for the customer experience by engaging with customers and assess product strengths and areas for improvement
* Evaluate market opportunities within customer segments to drive strategic initiatives
* Understand and communicate the competitive landscape, updates, and opportunities to executive management and product teams
* Develop technical collateral and presentation decks to support sales efforts
* Establish and manage relationships with other commercial partners to drive product adoption
* Define and refine market positioning for current products
* Coordinate preparation and launch for new product introductions within product line


**FOR THIS POSITION, WE LOOK FOR**


* Bachelor's degree in genomics or related field; Master's degree or PhD preferred
* 5+ years of experience in genomics, preferably in single-cell or related field with a Bachelor's degree, *or* 3+ years experience with a Master's degree or PhD
* Experience working collaboratively with cross-functional teams
* Demonstrated experience bringing a new product to market
* If remote, ~25% travel will be required, primarily to our Seattle HQ. If Seattle-based, minimal travel for conferences and other commercial team meetings will be required


*Parse Biosciences is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender perception or identity, national origin, age, marital status, protected veteran status, disability status, or any other status protected by federal, state, or local law.*


*COVID-19 Vaccination Requirement: Parse Biosciences has a COVID-19 vaccination policy that applies to all employees regardless of work location, except as prohibited by applicable law. As such, newly hired employees are required to be fully vaccinated prior to commencing employment, subject to reasonable accommodation and other requirements of applicable federal, state, and local law. Being fully vaccinated means that an individual is at least two weeks past their final (or only) dose of an authorized COVID-19 vaccine regimen. Exemptions will be considered for medical conditions/disabilities and sincerely held religious beliefs, observations, or practices.*


*#LI-REMOTE*

  


*Key words: account manager, sales representative, account executive, sales executive, territory manager, territory sales manager, sales specialist, inside sales*


To meet the health and wellness needs of our team, Parse offers a comprehensive benefits package for all full time employees, including:
* Medical, dental, vision, and Rx (prescription) coverage beginning on the 1st day of the month following your start date. Parse covers 90% of the monthly premiums for employees, and 60% for dependents.
* A 401(k) program with no waiting period to participate
* Basic life insurance and short and long-term disability coverage. Monthly premiums for both are covered at 100% by Parse.
* Flexible spending account (FSA) options for medical, dependent care, and commuter expenses
* A transportation program (Seattle only)
* New hire equity grants
* 12 paid holidays annually
* A generous time off policy
**Market Pay Range - Exact compensation will be dependent on skills, education and experience relevant to the position**


$135,000—$195,000 USD

title: Marketing Program Manager
description:
FocusKPI is looking for a Marketing **Program Manager/ Marketing Project Manager** to join our client, a high-tech SaaS company.  

  

As a program manager on the client's marketing team, you'll work to boost the cohesion, focus, speed, and general effectiveness of the marketing team. You will play an integral part in how we bring their products to market, engage our users, and build our brand.  

You will sit at the intersection of design, development, content, and campaigns. You'll be charged with aligning the  

efforts of a diverse cast, connecting the dots across teams and adapting to changing circumstances as you anticipate what's next. You will be an excellent partner in understanding your team's challenges, strengths, and  

motivations, and you'll help channel that at both the strategic and tactical level.  

  

**Work Location:**Remote: anywhere in the US  

**Duration:** 6 months contract  

**Pay Range:**$55/hr to $65/hr  

  

**Responsibilities:**

* Facilitate project kickoffs, retros, and planning sessions
* Knowing when to actively lead, when to create space for others to step up, and when to draw out energy and insight from the team
* Support strategy leads to assemble teams, define scope, kick-off and smoothly run successful programs
* Facilitate prioritization, risk identification and mitigation, resource allocation, roles and responsibilities across programs
* Support senior program managers to implement common processes across marketing, eliminating constraints to speed, flexibility, and creativity

**Qualifications:*** 3-4 years experience required (At least 3 years program management or similar role)
* Experience with **Program** and **Project management**
* Experience with **Campaign management** and **marketing operations**
* Strong ability to work independently and manage one's time
* Experience working alongside specialists across teams such as engineering, design, content, pr, operations and product marketers
* Experience with **Jira** and **Slack** is great to have
* Tech marketing experience is preferable to have and good to have agency background
* **B2B** & **SaaS tech** is nice to have
* This role is more of coordinating & orchestration, managing different program teams
* Experience running cross-functional programs and projects
* Experience in constantly evolving environments, and the ability to respond to change
* Core strengths around written and verbal communication, high adaptability, and a sense of urgency with strategy and a clear vision
* Self-started and has ability to maintain calm under pressure

  

Thank you!


FocusKPI Hiring Team


Founded in 2010, FocusKPI, Inc. (FocusKPI) is a data science and technology firm specializing in predictive analytics practice and methodologies. FocusKPI is a US company headquartered in Silicon Valley, California, with an East Coast office in Boston, Massachusetts.

**NOTICE:** Please be aware of fraudulent emails regarding job postings, job offers and fake checks. FocusKPI's recruiting team will strictly reach out via @focuskpi.com email domain. If you have received fraudulent emails now or in the past, please report it to https://reportfraud.ftc.gov/ .  

The domain @focuskpijobs.com is fraudulent and not related to FocusKPI. Please do not not reply or communicate to anyone with @focuskpijobs.com.

title: Social Media Marketing Manager
description:
**Job Summary:**
================

  

The Social Media Marketing Specialist will develop and implement the company's web-based marketing strategy to promote the company's brand, attract visitors and potential leads, and generate internet sales.  



  

***Supervisory Responsibilities:***
===================================

* None.

**Duties/Responsibilities:**
----------------------------

* Plans and implements web-based marketing strategies and campaigns via the company's website(s).
* Collaborates with web development and design teams; provides guidance on marketing-related aspects of the company's web presence.
* Develops and expands company's web presence through social media, email, web advertising, and other online sources; promotes company brand through these channels.
* Drafts, implements, maintains, and revises online marketing campaigns to drive sales and revenue to the company.
* Manage day-to-day running of all social platforms (primarily, Solex website, Instagram, IG Stories, Facebook, Tik Tok, X, LinkedIn, Pinterest, YouTube, and Mail Chimp Newsletter)
* Stay Up-to-date knowledge of all current social media platforms and trends.
* Capture, create and manage all published content (images, video and captions) across all social media accounts.
* Create visually stunning and compelling content that resonates with our audience.
* Respond to customer reviews and comments across all social media channels.
* Collaborate with internal teams for content creation, including dynamic video content for advertising campaigns
* Proficient in key areas of social media marketing including content creation, community management, and strategic campaigns.
* Craft and implement social media strategies that defy convention and capture attention.
* Event Documentation: Document key moments at significant events and manage the acquisition of content across all events. Stay up-to-date with social media trends and industry developments.
* Coordinates with other marketing team members to ensure active promotions and campaigns are represented on the website(s).
* Strategize and implement lead generation campaigns to further grow the business.
* Collaborates with web design, development, and content staff to monitor and improve search engine optimization (SEO) results for the company's site(s).
* Maintains current knowledge of trends and developments in online marketing.
* Assists with budget preparation for marketing department.
* Performs other related duties as assigned.

**Education and Experience:**
-----------------------------

* Bachelor's degree in marketing, Business, Communications, or related field required.
* BSc degree in Marketing, Digital Media, Business, Communications, or a relevant field
* 3-4 of related experience preferred.
* Excellent time management skills and ability to meet deadlines.
* Proficient with HTML and web design.
* Proficient with Microsoft Office Suite or similar software
  

Qualifications


Required Skills/Abilities:


* Extensive knowledge of marketing principles and strategies.
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
* Proven ability to plan and implement marketing campaigns.
* 3-4 years social media marketing experience for companies/brands.
* Insightful and highly creative with the ability to guide and create compelling content.
* Strong blog photography skills.
* Creative and strong presentation skills with attention to detail.
* Ability to work independently and with cross-functional departments.
* Solid understanding of social media /pop culture community trends.
* Remain on top of the social trends and platform changes.
* Some graphic design experience preferred, including Canvas (?)
* Excellent organizational skills and attention to detail.
 **Physical Requirements:**

* Prolonged periods sitting at a desk and working on a computer.
* Must be able to lift up to 15 pounds at times.

 **Equal Employment Opportunity**

Solex HCM (& Affiliates) provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws.


This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation and training.

title: SEO Specialist
description:
**Company Overview:**  
Copeck Digital Media Group is a leading digital marketing agency dedicated to helping businesses enhance their online presence and drive organic traffic through strategic SEO initiatives. We specialize in developing customized SEO strategies that align with our clients' goals and deliver measurable results. As we continue to expand our team, we are seeking a talented and analytical SEO Specialist to join us in optimizing our clients' websites for improved search engine visibility and performance.

**Position Overview:**  
We are looking for a detail-oriented and results-driven SEO Specialist who is passionate about optimizing websites for search engines. The ideal candidate will have a solid understanding of SEO best practices, algorithms, and tools, along with a proven track record of implementing successful SEO strategies. From conducting keyword research to monitoring performance metrics, the SEO Specialist will play a key role in improving our clients' search rankings and driving organic traffic to their websites.

**Key Responsibilities:**

* Conduct comprehensive SEO audits of clients' websites to identify strengths, weaknesses, and opportunities for optimization.
* Perform keyword research to identify relevant and high-performing keywords for content optimization and targeting.
* Optimize website content, including meta tags, headers, URLs, and internal linking structure, to improve search engine visibility and relevance.
* Develop and implement on-page and off-page SEO strategies to improve website rankings and drive organic traffic.
* Monitor and analyze website performance metrics, including organic traffic, keyword rankings, and conversion rates, using tools such as Google Analytics, Google Search Console, and SEMrush.
* Identify technical SEO issues and work with developers to implement solutions, such as site speed optimization, mobile responsiveness, and structured data markup.
* Stay up-to-date on industry trends, algorithm updates, and best practices in SEO to continuously improve our strategies and methodologies.
* Collaborate with content creators, web developers, and other cross-functional teams to ensure SEO best practices are integrated into website design and content creation processes.
* Provide regular reporting and insights to clients on SEO performance, including recommendations for improvement and optimization opportunities.
* Stay abreast of competitors' SEO strategies and industry benchmarks to identify areas for differentiation and competitive advantage.

**Qualifications:**

* Bachelor's degree in Marketing, Computer Science, Business, or related field.
* Proven experience as an SEO Specialist or in a similar role, with a strong track record of improving search engine rankings and driving organic traffic.
* In-depth knowledge of SEO principles, algorithms, and best practices, including on-page and off-page optimization techniques.
* Proficiency in SEO tools and analytics platforms, such as Google Analytics, Google Search Console, SEMrush, Moz, and Ahrefs.
* Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to interpret data, draw insights, and make data-driven recommendations.
* Excellent communication and collaboration skills, with the ability to work effectively with cross-functional teams and communicate complex SEO concepts to non-technical stakeholders.
* Detail-oriented mindset and ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously in a fast-paced environment.
* Continuous learner with a passion for staying updated on the latest SEO trends, techniques, and industry developments.

**Benefits:**

* Competitive salary and benefits package.
* Flexible work schedule and remote work options.
* Opportunities for professional development and training.
* Collaborative and supportive work environment.
* Opportunity to work with a diverse portfolio of clients across various industries.

If you are a proactive and results-oriented SEO Specialist looking to make a significant impact in the digital marketing space, we encourage you to apply today! Please submit your resume, cover letter, and any relevant portfolio or examples of past SEO projects and successes.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $24.65 - $29.69 per hour

Benefits:

* Flexible schedule
* Health insurance
* Paid time off

Schedule:

* 8 hour shift
* Monday to Friday

Work Location: Remote

title: Associate Brand Manager
description:

* A “Source of Truth” that includes Vision, Editorial Guide, Brand Guide, Description of Core Service,
* A company Canva account

We hire for our values


Learn more about what it’s like to work at Fertility Bridge here


Why you should join the team
