 ***Thank you for your interest in serving the infertility community through a creative, business-centered approach!***

title: Paid Search Manager
description:
Motive Interactive, a leading Performed Based Marketing firm is seeking a **P****aid Search Manager****.** **This role will report directly to the GM and is****100% Remote.** This role will be responsible for developing acquisition strategies across multiple levels of campaigns which include: planning, creative development, buying, analytics and optimizing. **Salary depends on experience.**

* **Candidate must be c****omfortable being responsible for all daily campaign management and strategy of search campaigns and have e****xperience with arbitrage or aggressive CPL/CPA goals**

**Responsibilities**

* Architect effective Search Engine Marketing (SEM) / Pay-Per-Click (PPC)
* Manage paid search bid management using best-in-class match type strategies, campaign settings, demographic targeting, remarking, custom audience lists, and custom-built automation
* Recommend landing page strategies and consult on landing page planning and optimizations and provide analytics to measure ROAS.
* Develop buying and monetization strategies across a variety of performance campaigns and verticals.
* A/B testing a multitude of campaign variables to increase the efficiency of campaign budgets to drive leads/conversion improvements, expand search impression share and drive higher ROI
* Implement and test strategies designed to increase conversion rates and lower cost-per-lead across multiple clients in multiple verticals

Demonstrates value against all initiatives by providing monthly/quarterly metrics reports  
* 

  

**Job Requirements**

* Minimum 2 years of managing paid search campaigns
* Extensive analytical capabilities in quantifying reporting and documenting performance metrics
* Strong organization and attention to detail and accuracy
* Ability to communicate well within team and across division
* Ability to manage and prioritize multiple projects simultaneously
* Must be able to make decisions in a fast-paced environment

  

This is a remote position.

title: Manager, Sourcing Operations
description:
**About the team**
------------------


The Strategic Sourcing Team enables Zillow Group,(ZG), business and technology teams to run efficiently and scale. We are embedded within the Procurement and Financial Services team and act as an interface to other ZG shared services teams including Procurement, FP&A (financial planning & analysis), Accounts Payable, and Legal. We support the entire enterprise as our core customer base and work in a consultative approach to ensure their supplier stack is delivering. Lastly, we strive to facilitate our customers’ contracting needs to ensure we Deliver Quality on Time, Every Time!**About the role**
------------------


Zillow’s Strategic Sourcing team is looking for an expert, partner - focused Manager of Strategic Sourcing Operations! In this role, you will serve as a trusted advisor to the business, driving critical elements of the supplier relationship lifecycle, including planning, sourcing and negotiations support for sophisticated deals and owning supplier relationship management. You will manage current spend, financial commitments, and partner with various teams to forecast upcoming spend to support business needs. You will support your internal partners in analyzing and rationalizing technology and professional services deals. You will help build new sourcing and procurement processes and optimize our existing procedures. You will be a subject matter authority on our budgets, project spend, purchasing, and planning processes.

* Lead sophisticated sourcing events/RFx’s, facilitate contracting, and lead supplier relationships across your book of business
* Research and identify savings and supplier optimization opportunities within Zillow’s current and future services needs
* Support technology and services engagements with cross-functional leadership and business teams to facilitate solution selection, supplier standards and strategies, business requirements, and priorities with minimal mentorship
* Excel in peer-to-peer and executive level, fact-based and data-driven communications and recommendations, both internally and with suppliers
* Cultivate positive relationships across the business and all levels to find solutions and have courage to put forth new insights and challenge biases
* Analyze value proposition and total cost of ownership, understanding delineation of operating and capital expenditures, working with Finance partners
* Develop and implement standard supplier agreements and relevant amendments, supplier management standard methodologies, and sourcing practices
* Supervise and support ownership budget and associated actuals, supervising spend by supplier, team, project, and business unit
* Lead sophisticated and cross-functional projects and process improvements across multiple partner teams and internally within Procurement and Financial Services
* Act as a strategic advisor by being a knowledgeable and reliable resource to provide information and guidance to our partners
* Mentor and/or lead early career team members with difficult deals and standard methodologies
* Build and own detailed reporting for internal customers regarding supplier relationships using metrics on savings, supplier diversity, sustainability, preferred supplier usage and supplier rationalization
* Make recommendations for a supplier vision and strategy for a specified business unit or internal partner team
* Find opportunities to rationalize suppliers and program strategies that deliver effective supplier use while considering risk, overall supplier mix and opportunities to invest in innovative or diverse supplier capabilities
* Ensure adherence to policy, educate partners and suppliers on policy compliance
* Support business adoption of supplier performance management standard methodologies


This role has been categorized as a Remote position. “Remote” employees do not have a permanent corporate office workplace and, instead, work from a physical location of their choice which must be identified to the Company. Employees may live in any of the 50 US States, with limited exceptions. In certain cases, an employee in a remote-designated job may need to live in a specific region or time zone to support customers or clients as part of their role.
In California, Colorado, Connecticut, Hawaii, Nevada, New York and Washington the standard base pay range for this role is $108,600.00 - $173,400.00 Annually. This base pay range is specific to California, Colorado, Connecticut, Hawaii, Nevada, New York and Washington and may not be applicable to other locations.
In addition to a competitive base salary this position is also eligible for equity awards based on factors such as experience, performance and location. Actual amounts will vary depending on experience, performance and location.**Who you are**
---------------

* The ideal candidate is a detail oriented, creative individual with a consistent record of ownership of technology suppliers and financial portfolios with the following skills:
* 7+ years consistent record supporting complex deals with technology and services suppliers, sourcing events, handling vendors and budgets, and leading projects, preferably within large tech organizations; technology and sophisticated services category management experience is a plus
* Strong negotiation and negotiation planning skills
* Category knowledge across multiple categories which may include some of the following; Technology Software and Hardware, Marketing, Finance, HR, G+A, Facilities etc.
* Leads with the stakeholder to develop outstanding trusted relationships with a strong sense of accountability and ownership
* Experience leading a team and/or program managing across functional teams
* Expertise with the Strategic Sourcing Process and Sourcing Category Strategies
* Ability to lead a project from start to finish and aim to completion while navigating an array of diverse collaborators spanning functions from technology to shared services
* Highly proficient with data, systems, and tools i.e. Tableau, Scout RFP, Workday P2P, or similar
* Superb communication and writing skills - able to adapt style to best suit the audience
* Ability to identify risks, (Financial, Contractual, Security, Legal, Reputational, etc.), and work cross functionally to mitigate risk levels.
* Connects the dots across multiple functions including finance, legal, contracts management and a wide variety of technology teams
* Ability to understand both technical and business requirements from internal stakeholders
* Consistent record to influence and build alignment with a diverse group of partners
* Ability to prioritize multiple projects in a fast-paced environment without losing focus on the details
* A bias for action and courage when solving problems

**Get to know us**
------------------


Zillow is reimagining real estate to make home a reality for more and more people.


As the most-visited real estate website in the United States, Zillow® and its affiliates help movers find and win their home through digital solutions, first class partners, and easier buying, selling, financing and renting experiences. Millions of people visit Zillow Group sites every month to start their home search, and now they can rely on Zillow to help make it easier to move. The work we do helps people get home and no matter what job you're in, you will play a critical role in making home a reality for more and more people.


Our efforts to streamline the real estate transaction are supported by a deep-rooted culture of innovation, our passion to redefine the employee experience, a fundamental commitment to Equity and Belonging, and world-class benefits. These benefits include comprehensive medical, dental, vision, life, and disability coverages as well as parental leave, family benefits, retirement contributions, and paid time off. We’re also setting the standard for work experiences of the future, where our employees are supported in doing their best work and living a flexible, well-balanced life. But don’t just take our word for it. Read recent reviews on Glassdoor and recent recognition from multiple organizations, including: the 100 Best Companies to Work For, Glassdoor Employees’ Choice Award, Bloomberg Gender-Equality Index, Human Rights Campaign (HRC) Corporate Equity Index, and TIME 100 Most Influential Companies list.

*Zillow Group is an equal opportunity employer committed to fostering an inclusive, innovative environment with the best employees. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please contact us at RecruitingAccessibility@zillowgroup.com.*

*Applicants who receive job offers from Zillow Group will be asked to sign a Proprietary Rights Agreement which includes confidentiality, intellectual property assignment, customer and employee non-solicitation, and non-competition provisions. If you are contacted for a role at Zillow Group and wish to review a copy of the Proprietary Rights Agreement prior to receiving an offer, you may request a copy from your Recruiter.*

title: Strategic Marketing Manager
description:
The Strategic Marketing Manager drives the market mapping, planning, strategy, branding, and communications within their market segment. The Strategic Marketing Manager is responsible for identifying effective marketing solutions to sell products, enhance and maintain the organization's brand image, retain existing customers, attract new customers, and drive revenue creation. The Strategic Marketing Manager drives value to the organization by ensuring these strategic activities and processes are properly communicated and followed throughout the organization. This role will be focused on the Building and Infrastructure market.  

  

**Primary Responsibilities:**
* Lead the commercial team in the creation of a strategic business plan to target sales growth for their segment.
* Own the 6-15 month forecast for the segment.
* Directionally drive goals for their segment to align with broader organizational goals.
* Maintain a rolling five-year plan that addresses all capability and capacity needs to support the strategic plan.
* Provide review segment’s strategic markets, trends, drivers, outlook, market position, and competitive landscape.
* Participate in and facilitate Blueprinting and other customer and potential customer discovery work.
* Provide input to the marketing communications team for the preparation of marketing collateral, website management, social media, trade show, and other demand generation campaigns.
* Collaborate with the Strategic Planning & Marketing Director to understand future marketplace trends, market needs, competitor data, regulatory environment, company product share and product performance in support of strategic planning and GROW (Innovation) processes.


  

**Experience & Education**
* Minimum of 3 Years of experience successfully leading effective marketing strategy in a fast-paced business environment.
* Prior experience in the polymers industry with a focus on the Building and Infrastructure market preferred.
* Successful completion of a bachelor's degree program with a focus on Marketing, Sales, or Business Administration is preferred.
* Experience exhibiting, influencing, and giving talks in the plastics industry space (Plastics Engineers, Vinyl Institute, etc.) is preferred.

title: Internal Communications Manager
description:
Expect more. Connect more. Be more at Diebold Nixdorf. Our teams automate, digitize, and transform the way more than 75 million people around the globe bank and shop in this hyper-connected, consumer-centric world. Join us in connecting people to commerce in this vital, rewarding role.


Activates Diebold Nixdorf’s corporate priorities and culture as trusted counsel and expert writer for executives and other partners by developing and implementing effective internal communications strategies, plans and programs. Leverages accepted standards, best practices and various media – email, intranet, video, presentations, town halls, social media, etc. – to inform, influence and inspire employees about DN’s strategic direction, business plans, change management initiatives, brand and people. Writes and distributes content required for successful internal communications plans, and edits messages before dissemination for accuracy, clarity and appropriateness. Ensures a consistent corporate voice permeates messaging to all audiences. Measures and evaluates the effectiveness of messaging through surveys and other tools and adjusts plans for continuous improvement. Coordinates efforts by collaborating with internal communications peers and external communications (e.g., public relations, marketing, investor relations). Keeps abreast of company developments and industry trends. May assist peers with developing and implementing new and existing communication vehicles, processes or programs.

title: Lifecycle Marketing Manager
description:
**Job Title: Lifecycle Marketing Leader (Email/SMS/Push)**

**Company: Quick Quack Car Wash**

**Location: Remote**

About Quick Quack Car Wash: Quick Quack Car Wash is a rapidly growing chain of exterior-only, express car washes headquartered in Sacramento, CA. Our mission is to provide a fast, convenient, and eco-friendly car wash experience while delivering outstanding customer service. With our commitment to innovation and customer satisfaction, we are looking for a dynamic Lifecycle Marketing Leader to join our marketing team.

**Position Overview:** Quick Quack Car Wash is seeking a skilled and strategic Lifecycle Marketing Leader to oversee the planning, execution, and optimization of email, push notification, and SMS campaigns. The ideal candidate will have a proven track record of driving customer engagement, retention, and revenue through targeted lifecycle marketing initiatives.

**Key Responsibilities:**

* Develop and execute comprehensive lifecycle marketing strategies across email, push, and SMS channels to drive customer acquisition, retention, and loyalty.
* Segment customers based on behavior, preferences, and lifecycle stage to deliver personalized and relevant messaging.
* Design and implement automated campaigns, including welcome series, abandoned cart reminders, re-engagement campaigns, and loyalty rewards programs.
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including marketing, design, product, and analytics, to ensure seamless campaign execution and optimization.
* Monitor campaign performance, analyze key metrics, and provide actionable insights to improve targeting, engagement, and conversion rates.
* Stay up-to-date with industry trends, best practices, and emerging technologies in lifecycle marketing and customer communication channels.
* Manage relationships with email service providers, push notification platforms, and SMS aggregators to optimize deliverability and performance.
* Ensure compliance with relevant regulations, including CAN-SPAM, GDPR, and TCPA, and maintain accurate subscriber lists and consent records.

**Qualifications:**

* Bachelor's degree in Marketing, Communications, or a related field (Master's degree preferred).
* 6+ years of experience in lifecycle marketing, email marketing, or CRM, preferably in the retail or gaming industry.
* Proven track record of designing and executing successful email, push, and SMS campaigns that drive measurable results.
* Strong analytical skills with the ability to interpret data, draw actionable insights, and optimize campaign performance.
* Proficiency in email marketing automation platforms (e.g., Salesforce Marketing Cloud, Iterable, Klaviyo, Active Campaign), push notification tools, and SMS marketing platforms.
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills, with a keen eye for detail and creativity in messaging and content development.
* Ability to thrive in a fast-paced, dynamic environment and manage multiple projects simultaneously.
* Experience with A/B testing, segmentation, and personalization techniques.
* Understanding of HTML/CSS and email design best practices is a plus.
* Familiarity with CRM systems and customer data platforms (CDPs) is a plus.

Joining Quick Quack Car Wash offers a unique opportunity to be part of a high-growth company that is revolutionizing the car wash industry. If you are passionate about leveraging data-driven strategies to drive customer engagement and loyalty, we'd love to hear from you!

Job Type: Full-time

* Dental insurance
* Employee assistance program
* Employee discount
* Health insurance
* Life insurance

* Vision insurance

* Monday to Friday

Work Location: Remote

title: Manager, Marketing Strategy & Planning - Web & Digital
description:
**Get to know Okta**

  

Okta is The World's Identity Company. We free everyone to safely use any technology—anywhere, on any device or app. Our Workforce and Customer Identity Clouds enable secure yet flexible access, authentication, and automation that transforms how people move through the digital world, putting Identity at the heart of business security and growth.  

  

At Okta, we celebrate a variety of perspectives and experiences. We are not looking for someone who checks every single box - we're looking for lifelong learners and people who can make us better with their unique experiences.  

  

Join our team! We're building a world where Identity belongs to you.

**The Marketing Strategy & Planning Team**



Okta's Marketing Strategy & Planning function drives the Marketing strategy formation and planning motion to optimize marketing performance, deliver a strong return on investment, and achieve our company objectives.


**Manager,** **Marketing Strategy & Planning** **- Web & Digital Opportunity**



Reporting to the Senior Director of Marketing Strategy & Operations, this role will act as a strategic partner to our Web & Digital leadership team to drive strategy formulation and planning motion. We are looking for a seasoned Marketing Strategy & Planning leader to partner closely with Web & Digital leaders, as well as partner across Marketing and GTM to develop a shared set of priorities, growth strategy, and operational plan. You will ensure the Digital & Web strategy is coordinated and cohesive and supports our company objectives. As a key partner to the SVP of Digital & Web, you will act as a liaison between Marketing and the wider GTM teams, including Sales, GTM Strategy & Planning, and Financial Planning teams.


**What you'll be doing**


* Support Digital & Web SVP to spearhead the development of the annual and quarterly planning process, ensuring alignment with Marketing leadership and wider GTM teams. Apply functional expertise and insights to support the strategy formation and validate alignment to the company objectives with optimal return on investment
* Partner with Digital & Web leadership to drive the prioritization of marketing investments and align budget owners on trade-off decisions. Support the creation of an investment framework to quantify business outcomes, resource allocations and prioritization
* Support Digital & Web SVP with quarterly business review (QBR) process and deliver insights on Digital & Web performance in partnership with the Analytics function
* Build and own budget management for Web & Digital, including annual and quarterly planning. Ensure accuracy in forecasting, correct utilization of funds and day-to-day management
* Regularly inform stakeholders across Marketing, Sales, GTM Strategy & Planning of deeply analytical insights on Digital & Web performance to ensure cross-functional alignment and drive a data-driven decision strategy. Analyze and interrogate insights to proactively identify opportunities and prioritize initiatives to drive the business forward.
* Partner with data scientists, data engineers and Marketing practitioners to identify new variables to improve the depth and accuracy
* Serve as a trusted advisor to Digital & Web leaders. Provide recommendations on operational improvements and ways to drive effectiveness and efficiency across teams
* Play a key role in driving complex, cross-functional, global initiatives and the success of our Digital Transformation initiative


**What you'll bring to the role**


* 8+ years of relevant professional experience in Marketing Strategy & Planning, Analytics or a similar role at a B2B, SaaS company
* 8+ years in managing Marketing budgets and resource allocation
* Deep understanding of key drivers of business and marketing strategy (pipeline and revenue analytics, investment ratios, funnel metrics, martech foundation)
* Exceptional analytical skills, experience defining metrics, performance data analysis, identifying trends and measure impact
* Proven experience in building a holistic Marketing strategy and supporting execution within a high growth, global company
* Exceptional structured thinking and problem-solving skills
* Proven ability to collaborate effectively across functionally and geographically distributed teams
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills. Ability to convey complex ideas in a clear and concise manner
* BS/BA or equivalent required


#LI-Remote  

#LI-RA1

**The annual base salary range for this position for candidates located in the San Francisco Bay area is between:**

$138,000—$206,000 USD
Below is the annual base salary range for candidates located in California, Colorado, New York and Washington. Your actual base salary will depend on factors such as your skills, qualifications, experience, and work location. In addition, Okta offers equity (where applicable), bonus, and benefits, including health, dental and vision insurance, 401(k), flexible spending account, and paid leave (including PTO and parental leave) in accordance with our applicable plans and policies. To learn more about our Total Rewards program please visit: https://rewards.okta.com/us.

 **The annual base salary range for this position for candidates located in California (excluding San Francisco Bay Area), Colorado, New York, and Washington is between:**


$123,000—$185,000 USD**What you can look forward to as an Okta employee!**


* Amazing Benefits
* Making Social Impact
* Fostering Diversity, Equity, Inclusion and Belonging at Okta


Okta cultivates a dynamic work environment, providing the best tools, technology and benefits to empower our employees to work productively in a setting that best and uniquely suits their needs. Each organization is unique in the degree of flexibility and mobility in which they work so that all employees are enabled to be their most creative and successful versions of themselves, regardless of where they live. Find your place at Okta today! https://www.okta.com/company/careers/.



Okta is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, ancestry, marital status, age, physical or mental disability, or status as a protected veteran. We also consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and convictions records, consistent with applicable laws. If reasonable accommodation is needed to participate in the job application or interview process, please use this Form to request an accommodation.



Okta is committed to complying with applicable data privacy and security laws and regulations. For more information, please see our Privacy Policy at https://www.okta.com/privacy-policy/.

title: Content Moderator for Ed Tech Company
description:
**About Us**

At Miaplaza, our vision is to elevate online learning and make it more effective than ever before. We apply the most successful approaches in virtual education to create a homeschool curriculum platform where students from different backgrounds can be successful, including kids with learning disabilities. Our platform allows users to personalize each student’s learning path in a way that exceeds the possibilities of the traditional classroom setting. Every lesson we develop goes through a collaborative creation process and multiple review phases from experts in different fields/disciplines. Our main K-8 curriculum platform is Miacademy, and our high school platform is MiaPrep.

We are growing! Our student base is growing rapidly and we are currently hiring for multiple positions across several departments! Our expansion stems from two key factors: our commitment to providing exceptional educational content to our students by scaling our team with passionate individuals, and our pursuit of new opportunities to enhance our students' learning experiences by broadening our capabilities and expertise as an organization.

**About the Role**

We are seeking a highly motivated and enthusiastic part-time Virtual Content Moderator to join our team! This position is focused on moderating texts, artwork, and videos posted by children in our educational website community. As a moderator, you will work 4-hour shifts, with the option to work two back-to-back shifts in a day. Additionally, staying up to date with the latest trends is crucial to better understand and relate to our young audience. There also many opportunities for growth in other areas of the company.

To get a feel for what it's like to work as a moderator at Miaplaza, please check out this TikTok: https://www.tiktok.com/@miaplazalearning/video/7190520345714085166

You can also hear our CEO, Johannes Ziegler, discuss our company in this podcast: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=7mabdbqbSco&t=23s&ab\\_channel=Universit%C3%A4tStuttgart.

**Required Skills:**

* **Tech-savvy:** Ability to quickly learn and adapt to various computer applications.
* **Trend-awareness:** Staying up to date with the latest trends to better understand and relate to the young audience.
* **Independent and self-motivated:** Being remote, you need to hold yourself accountable for tasks and ongoing responsibilities with little supervision.
* **Quick learner:** Demonstrated ability to absorb and utilize new information efficiently.
* **Detail-oriented:** Strong attention to detail to ensure content moderation accuracy.
* **Problem-solving and critical thinking:** Proven experience in independently solving technical problems and providing solutions or workarounds.
* **Excellent interpersonal and communication skills:** Exemplary written and spoken English language skills and fast typing abilities.
* **Trust & integrity:** Commitment to doing what is right and maintaining ethical standards.
* **Empathy and patience:** Ability to interact with child members and their parents compassionately and patiently.
* **Resilient and adaptable:** Capacity to take critical feedback and handle difficult customer situations effectively.
* **Team player:** Excellent communication and collaboration with internal teams and external customers.
* **Reliable high-speed internet and computer:** Access to a laptop or desktop with a high-speed internet connection that supports multitasking, including video.

**Pay:** $19.00 - $23.00 per hour

**Benefits:** We offer health, dental, and vision insurance for all full-time employees! Our health insurance will also include specialty care like fertility benefits and chiropractic care. We want our employees to have the care and support they need.

**Location:** Fully remote, but applicants must live in the U.S.

Job Type: Part-time

Pay: $19.00 - $23.00 per hour

Expected hours: 20 – 30 per week

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* 401(k) matching
* Employee assistance program
* Employee discount
* Flexible schedule
* Paid time off
* Parental leave
* Tuition reimbursement

Schedule:

* Monday to Friday
* Weekends as needed

Work Location: Remote

title: Junior Marketing Associate
description:
*Reports to the Associate Operations Officer*

Winston Preparatory School is seeking excellent candidates for a full-time Junior Marketing Associate to join our Central Team, which interacts with and helps support all of our campuses. The position is an immediate opening. Below is a bit of background information regarding our school network and the position:

Winston Prep is a national network of campuses offering students with learning disabilities, including dyslexia, executive functioning difficulties (ADHD) and nonverbal learning disorders (NVLD), a highly individualized, holistic, and responsive education. Our nationally-recognized model serves students through grade 12, along with offering a multi-faceted gap year(s) program for students who are not yet ready for college or the workplace. At Winston Prep, expert faculty carry out ongoing, in-depth assessments to cultivate a deep understanding of students, helping them to advance at a meaningful pace and giving them the tools to independently learn and grow. All of our campuses and Winston Online Program, provide intense skill remediation while fostering independence, resilience, responsibility, and self-awareness. Our campus locations include: New York City Connecticut, New Jersey, Long Island, and California. Our *Transitions* program has two locations: New York City and San Francisco.

The Junior Marketing Associate assists Winston Prep’s marketing and communication efforts and priorities throughout the network, with a particular emphasis on supporting with coordination and development of social media posts; some website maintenance, revisions and search engine optimization; advertising tracking and management; and support with creation of public-facing communications to promote open house attendance, fundraising initiatives, and other marketing priorities. The Junior Marketing Associate will work closely with the Associate Operations Officer and Senior Marketing Associate.

\\*\\*Any necessary training will be provided and encouraged.

**Responsibilities**

* Prepare weekly agendas outlining current progress of marketing efforts ahead of team meetings
* Efficiently file photo assets for social media, development, and other marketing usage
* Manage and maintain the advertising budget tracking spreadsheet
* Assist with submitting contracts for signatures and invoices for payment
* Monitor website/advertising campaign performance analytics and metrics
* Assist with implementation of social media strategies that will support continued growth and awareness of our school network (Facebook, Instagram, LinkedIn, and YouTube)
* Assist with preparing a monthly social media content calendar on Later.com platform (social media postings will focus on supporting admissions, program awareness, development, student life, and engagement) utilizing assets and language aligned with the Winston Prep mission
* Assist with posting content developed in calendar (posts, stories, reels, etc.) to corresponding social media channels on a consistent basis
* Drive brand awareness, engagement and audience growth across social media platforms
* Respond to inquiries and comments on Winston’s Facebook, Twitter, LinkedIn, Instagram, and YouTube accounts using approved language
* Research and stay informed of digital trends and tools for social media platforms and marketing
* Assist with some website maintenance including text and photo updates and implementation of search engine optimization (SEO) recommendations (using Blackbaud platform)
* Assist with producing public-facing communications to promote open house attendance, fundraising initiatives, and other marketing priorities.
* Help ensure the adherence to Winston Prep’s brand, style, and voice in all marketing materials
* Support the Associate Operations Officer and Senior Marketing Associate in preparation and delivery of any campaign and website performance tracking reports
* Special projects and other duties as assigned

**Minimum Requirements**

* Bachelor’s degree and 1-2 years relevant work experience, including demonstrated experience within communications and marketing fields
* Proactive and exceptionally organized, able to meet deadlines
* Knowledge of main social media platforms including analytics
* Excellent written communication skills, including writing and editing
* Ability to prioritize across many simultaneous projects and timelines; Self-driven
* Expertise with G Suite applications
* Web edit experience and familiarity with BlackBaud preferred

This position is full-time with in-person meetings and campus visits, primarily within the tri-state area, required at the discretion of the COO and AOO.

**Salary Range**: $40,000-50,000; commensurate with education and experience

Interested candidates should submit a resume and cover letter to: kpindych@winstonprep.edu.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $40,000.00 - $50,000.00 per year

Benefits:

* Flexible spending account
* Health insurance
* Health savings account
* Paid time off
* Retirement plan

Schedule:

* 8 hour shift
* Monday to Friday

Application Question(s):

* Please describe your web edit experience and whether you have experience with Blackbaud.
* Please describe your experience using social media platforms, including analytics.

Education:

* Bachelor's (Required)

Experience:

* communications and marketing work: 1 year (Required)
* G Suite: 1 year (Required)

Work Location: Remote

title: Strategic Customer Success Manager
description:
Remote
Customer Success /
Full-Time /
Remote
People.ai is an AI-powered foundational data platform that helps customers unlock go-to-market success & growth by providing teams with solutions built specifically for their needs. Providing enhanced pipeline visibility, more actionable insights, and a single source of truth for all sales activities. People.ai’s unique dataset, consisting of trillions of sales activities, millions of deals, 160 million business contacts, and 69 approved patents related to AI-based business insights, sets the company apart. Companies such as Verizon, IBM Red Hat, Snowflake, Zoom, and Palo Alto Networks rely on their enterprise-ready, patented AI technology.  

At People.ai, we believe that people enrich the world around them in countless ways. We believe that the more time they spend applying their creativity, resourcefulness, and critical thinking to activities that matter most in their professional life, the more effective a professional they become. Our team is a diverse, outspoken group of creatives and critical thinkers, hyper-focused on driving change and growth. We embrace different. We applaud non-traditional career paths. We're inspired by people who have made processes their own.  

As a Strategic Customer Success Manager (CSM) you will work with our customers to ensure they significantly improve their business using our software. You are a dynamic, thoughtful professional who builds strong relationships with ease and is looking for a career-defining new challenge. If that describes you and you meet the requirements outlined below, we'd love to hear from you!
### **Responsibilities**

+ Build and maintain customer relationships, emphasizing defining business outcomes and gaining senior-level/executive buy-in.
+ Champion customer relationships across the GTM (Go-to-Market) organization.
+ Collaborate with the Account Team to identify, scope, and plan initiatives for AI and Data-driven sales productivity.
+ Work with customers, including upper-level executive stakeholders, to understand GTM goals and priorities.
+ Position People.ai to support customer goals through insights, metrics, and value stories.
+ Develop a deep understanding of customer GTM goals and priorities.
+ Drive insights and metrics to support customer priorities and business outcomes.
+ Build and deliver compelling value stories aligning with customer goals.
+ Extract insights and trends from customer data for quantitative and qualitative ROI discussions.
+ Build competency in People.ai’s data pipeline and AI capabilities for effective customer enablement.
+ Act as a trusted advisor to key stakeholders and executives for GTM strategies using People.ai products.
+ Conduct customer-facing business reviews and manage stakeholder expectations for continued success.
+ Serve as the point person for project management, customer support escalation, and strategic GTM technology advisory.

### **Requirements**

+ 10+ years of customer success experience at a software company (preferably SaaS), agency or management consultancy (e.g. Deloitte, Accenture, KPMG).
+ Significant experience working with Fortune 500 companies navigating organizations with multiple stakeholders in multiple departments.
+ Strong technical aptitude, communication skills, a curious mindset, and attention to detail.
+ Excellent interpersonal skills. Ability to build relationships and become a trusted advisor
+ Experience in Sales or Marketing operations is preferred
+ Experience with Sales and Marketing tech stack is preferred
+ Comfortable working in a high-velocity and sometimes ambiguous environment (yes, we're a startup!).
+ Prefer candidates based in California.
+ Expect to travel 15% of the time for business reviews, kick-offs, and key success milestones.

$150,000 - $200,000 a year  



Headquartered in San Francisco, CA, People.ai is backed by Y Combinator and Silicon Valley’s top investors, including ICONIQ Capital, Andreessen Horowitz, Lightspeed Venture Partners, Akkadian Ventures, and Mubadala Capital. People.ai has received recognition in the Gartner Market Guide for Revenue Intelligence Platforms, Inc. 5000 fastest-growing companies list, The Deloitte Technology Fast 500 list, the Y Combinator Top Companies List, and the Forbes AI 50 list in 2022.  

-  

A reasonable estimate of on-target earnings (OTE) is $150,000 to $200,000. Additionally, regular employees may be eligible for commissions or bonus programs (target included in OTE), equity, and benefits. The range is subject to change. People.ai takes into wide range of factors when determining an individual’s pay. These factors can include, skill set, training and experience, licensure and certifications, and location and metropolitan area.

title: Marketing Manager (contract)
description:
**Marketing Manager (Contract)**

 *Please note that this is a contract role providing services to Microsoft through external staffing partners of Allegis Global Solutions. If you are selected for this role, you will be employed by AGS and will not be an employee of Microsoft.*

 **Summary:**


We're seeking a Contract Recruitment Marketing Manager focused primarily on the tactical aspects of recruitment marketing campaigns - from development and deployment to management and measurement. This role demands a clear focus on execution, an analytical approach to decision-making, and a strong ability to work within existing frameworks to optimize recruitment efforts.

 **Job Responsibilities:**

* Execute and manage recruitment marketing campaigns (organic and paid), ensuring they are delivered on time and meet predefined objectives.
* Develop project briefs to inform agency and creative executions.
* Utilize existing employer branding assets and resources efficiently, integrating creative solutions to enhance campaign effectiveness.
* Assist in localization of hiring campaigns and EVP work, ensuring relevance in various geographical and niche markets across the Americas.
* Process incoming requests from Microsoft stakeholders, leverage their inputs to create a project plan and strategic approach to marketing requests.

 **Requirements:**

* Extraordinary attention to detail.
* Experience storytelling with brand narratives & working on multiple campaigns at once.
* Ability to manage projects and prioritize next steps. Understands timelines and can weigh in to inform schedule.
* Creative problem-solving skills, with an aptitude for optimizing existing resources and tools.
* Problem solving skills with ability to adapt to shifting priorities.
* Experience in cross-functional collaboration, able to work effectively with teams from various departments including brand, communications, recruiting, finance, operations, and procurement.
* Must be able to work independently on tasks and provide strategic leadership in execution.
* Prior experience in localizing content and employer branding messages for recruitment campaigns preferred.

 **Additional Details:**

* Location: Remote
* Duration: 3 months
* Pay Range: $32 - 36 per hour

  



  

*AGS is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer (M/F/Disability/Veterans). We will consider all applications without regard to race, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, color, religion, national origin, veteran status, disability, genetic information or any other status protected by applicable law.*

title: Marketing Manager
description:
**As the Digital Marketing Manager at Speed & Function (speedandfunction.com), you will play a pivotal role in revolutionizing our marketing strategy and leading the marketing department towards achieving our business objectives. You will be responsible for overseeing all digital marketing initiatives, including managing the company website, advertising campaigns, social media channels, content creation, events, and promotional materials. The primary goal of this position is to take charge of our marketing efforts, drive brand awareness, generate leads, and contribute to the overall growth and success of the company.**  


**Requirements**
----------------

* Bachelor's degree in Marketing, Business Administration, or a related field. Master's degree preferred.
* Proven experience (X years) in digital marketing roles, with a focus on strategy development and team leadership.
* In-depth knowledge of digital marketing channels, tools, and techniques, including SEO, PPC, social media, content marketing, and email marketing.
* Strong analytical skills and the ability to interpret data to make informed decisions and optimize campaign performance.
* Excellent communication, interpersonal, and leadership skills.
* Creative thinking and problem-solving abilities.
* Ability to work effectively in a fast-paced, dynamic environment and manage multiple projects simultaneously.
**Responsibilities**
--------------------

* Marketing Strategy Development: Take ownership of developing and implementing comprehensive digital marketing strategies aligned with the company's goals and objectives.
* Team Leadership: Lead and mentor the marketing team, providing guidance, direction, and support to ensure the successful execution of marketing campaigns and initiatives.
* Website Management: Oversee the company website, ensuring it is optimized for user experience, search engines, and conversion rates. Collaborate with the web development team to implement necessary updates and improvements.
* Advertising Campaigns: Manage digital advertising campaigns across various platforms such as Google Ads and Meta (formerly Facebook), ensuring maximum reach, engagement, and ROI.
* Social Media Management: Develop and execute social media strategies across platforms including LinkedIn, Instagram, and TikTok. Create compelling content, engage with the audience, and grow our social media presence.
* Content Creation: Oversee the creation and publication of high-quality content including blog posts, articles, case studies, and other marketing collateral to attract and retain customers.
* Events Coordination: Plan, organize, and execute marketing events such as webinars, conferences, and workshops to showcase our products/services and build relationships with clients and prospects.
* Promotional Materials: Develop and manage the production of promotional materials such as brochures, presentations, videos, and other marketing assets to support sales and marketing efforts.
* Performance Tracking and Reporting: Monitor the performance of marketing campaigns, analyze key metrics, and prepare regular reports to evaluate effectiveness and identify areas for improvement.
**About Speed & Function**
--------------------------


At Speed & Function, we build exceptional custom software applications using today’s most advanced technology. But so do a lot of software engineering firms, so what makes working for us different? Firstly, we operate out of two continents. Most of our engineers are based in Eastern Europe, and our US Head Office is in Philadelphia.  

Second, everyone who works here is passionate about digital transformation, innovation and collaborative software development. However, don’t confuse us with contractors, because we’re not. We are true collaborators. We work so closely with clients that their products are virtually built in-house. This gives our people the opportunity to work with clients in a unique way. Think Collaboration 2.0.  

Third, we are striving to build a developmental culture where learning, feedback and transparency are given equal weight to productivity, efficiency and results. At Speed & Function, you’re given the chance to grow, not just technically but as a person. We aim to become better people who produce brilliant work and offer our clients a fulfilling and enjoyable experience along the way.

title: Email Marketing Manager
description:
What’s the Role?
  
  

We are looking for a talented Email Marketing Manager to join our digital marketing team. The Email Marketing Manager will be responsible for developing and executing effective email marketing campaigns that generate leads, drive revenue, and spread brand awareness for Guaranteed Rate. The ideal candidate will have a proven track record of success in email marketing, excellent analytical skills, and strong project management abilities.
  
  

**Pay Range:** 80k to 100k annual pay
  
  

**Responsibilities:**  

Develop and execute email marketing campaigns to generate leads and drive revenue for various mortgage products/ services
  
  

Design engaging and effective content that resonates with our target audience
  
Develop and maintain an email marketing calendar that aligns with our business objectives and marketing goals
  
Implement A/B testing to optimize email campaigns for maximum engagement and conversion rates
  
Utilize marketing automation tools to segment and target our email lists based on subscriber behavior and preferences
  
Monitor and analyze email campaign metrics, including open rates, click-through rates, and conversion rates, to identify opportunities for improvement
  
  

Stay up-to-date with the latest email marketing trends, best practices, and industry developments, and implement new strategies as needed
  
Maintain strong deliverability standards and keep IP and domain reputation in good standing
  
  

**Requirements :**  

Bachelor's degree in marketing, communications, or a related field
  
Minimum of 3 years of experience in email marketing, preferably in the financial services industry
  
  

Impressive graphic design skills ( Photoshop /Illustrator)
  
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
  
Strong analytical skills, with the ability to analyze data and develop actionable insights
  
Proficiency in email marketing automation platforms such as Salesforce Marketing Cloud (Braze, Iterable , are a plus).
  
Experience with A/B testing, segmentation, and targeting strategies
  
  

Strong project management skills, with the ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously
  
Knowledge of HTML, CSS, and responsive design principles is a plus
  
  

If you are a creative and results-driven email marketing professional with a passion for the mortgage industry, we encourage you to apply for this exciting opportunity.
  
  

Guaranteed Rate is an Equal Opportunity Employer that welcomes and encourages all applicants to apply regardless of age, race, sex, religion, color, national origin, disability, veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, marital or parental status, ancestry, citizenship status, pregnancy or other reason protected by law.

title: Junior Copywriter
description:
Position Title: Junior Copywriter

  


Position Level: Entry Level



Report to: Communications Specialist



Location: Remote Position (preference given to those located in Seattle, Bellingham or Portland)



About Us:



The Cloud Security Alliance (CSA) is the world’s leading organization dedicated to defining and raising awareness of best practices to help ensure a secure cloud computing environment. CSA harnesses the subject matter expertise of industry practitioners, associations, governments, and its corporate members and volunteers to offer cloud security-specific research, education, training, certification, events, and products. CSA’s activities, knowledge, and extensive network benefit the entire community impacted by the cloud — from providers and customers to governments, entrepreneurs, and the assurance industry — and provide a forum through which different parties can work together to create and maintain a trusted cloud ecosystem.



Job Description



The Junior Copywriter is an entry-level position responsible for writing and editing compelling promotional content that supports CSA’s strategic initiatives, campaigns, and events. This role requires a creative, out-of-the-box writer who can translate complex technical content into innovative, effective promotional messaging that resonates with an audience of cloud and cybersecurity professionals and drives the reader to take a desired action. The Junior Copywriter will primarily focus on content development for promotional emails and social media marketing. This position reports directly to the Communications Specialist and sits on CSA’s marketing team. To be considered for this role, candidates are required to provide writing samples.

  

Responsibilities


* Copy Creation: Develop clear, concise, and persuasive copy primarily for email and social media communications with additional copywriting and editing support for website content, collateral, script writing, and blogs. Tailor messaging to resonate with a diverse audience interested in cloud computing and cybersecurity.


* Campaign Collaboration: Work closely with comms leadership to support the ideation and development of integrated promotional campaigns.


* Editing and Proofreading: Ensure all copy is error-free, adheres to grammar and style guidelines, and effectively represents the brand. Revise copy based on feedback and edits provided by comms and marketing leadership.


* Utilize Tools and Processes: Build and schedule email and social media promotional content in Pardot. Support Communications leadership to manage promotional calendar and respond to inbound comms request tickets. Assist Communication Specialist with writing projects as needed. Coordinate with the Design team to facilitate visual needs of the Communications team.


* Brand Consistency: Maintain and reinforce brand voice and messaging consistency across all promotional content.

  

Skills & Qualifications


* Exceptional writing, editing, and proofreading skills with a diligent eye for detail, language, flow, and grammar. Must have a true passion for writing promotional communications.


* Talent for writing promotional content that upholds thought leadership standards and is value-based, not pitch-centric


* Preference is given to candidates experienced in Pardot or a similar marketing automation tool


* Working knowledge of content creation for businesses on social media platforms, specifically LinkedIn


* Possess a positive attitude with the ability to coordinate and prioritize multiple tasks and responsibilities, and thrive in a fast-paced environment


* Highly motivated, independent worker able to meet tight deadlines


* A genuine interest in cloud technology and an eagerness to learn


* Strong project management and organizational skills


* Excellent interpersonal and communication skills


* Creative, out-of-the-box thinker ready to bring fresh ideas


* Highly skilled in collaboration, problem-solving, time management, quality control and attention to detail


* Ability to work remotely


* Bachelor’s degree in Marketing, Communications, English, Journalism or related field

  

Benefits


* Competitive Base Salary and Work-life Balance


* Medical, Dental, Vision Insurance


* 401k with Matching Contributions


* Paid Time Off


* Parental Leave


* Growth and Development Opportunities


* Expense Support for business travel, training activities, and industry conference participation


* Expense Support for home office and equipment

  

Equal Opportunity Employer



CSA provides equal employment opportunities and does not discriminate against an employee or applicant because of age, race, color, religion, gender, national origin, veteran status, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, or another legally protected class status.



CSA is committed to building and maintaining a diverse staff and recognizes that its continued success depends on hiring and retaining high-quality professionals with various backgrounds and experiences. Opportunities for advancement exist, and we are committed to helping all staff develop and grow. Women, people of color, and people with disabilities are strongly encouraged to apply.

title: Marketing Projects Manager
description:
Celebrate Life, *the Southworth Way*  
**The Company:**Welcome to Southworth. We own and operate a growing portfolio of premier private communities, each offering *inspired environments* and locations. Our dedication to hospitality and endless activities for the entire family ensures our members experience a *world at play* like never before.  
With a solid reputation for stability, integrity, and innovation, Southworth's clubs and communities provide exceptional locations where our members can truly live *life at ease*. Our dedicated team members play a crucial role in elevating the experience for our members, residents, guests, and fellow team members. We encourage all our team members to *be and belong* by providing a wide array of benefits, engagement programs, unique perks, discounts, and, of course, a lot of fun!  
**The Benefits**: We are proud of our family company roots and understand everyone has a unique set of needs: we want to support you as best we can so you can live your best life with us. We offer a comprehensive benefits package that includes competitive options for medical, physical, and mental health and wellness, life insurance, 401k matching, paid time off, and more.  
**Grow with us!**The sky is the limit for talented, driven individuals. With our ever-expanding portfolio, we offer opportunities to learn, grow, and thrive. We look forward to growing together.  
**Be YOU with us!**At Southworth, we are working to redefine the country club. We seek talent from a diverse range of backgrounds, experiences, and cultures to ensure an innovative edge. Here, diversity is a*driver*of our success.  
**The Opportunity**: The Marketing Projects Manager is a key member of the marketing team and manages and supports traditional, digital, social marketing and production initiatives for Southworth and our collection of brands and private clubs.  
This role oversees internal task management production, supports external agency relationships, and assists with implementing new marketing technology. They enhance marketing efficiency, align strategies with overall business goals, brand and creative strategies, and collaborate with corporate departments and key stakeholders.  
The ideal candidate will possess a unique blend of brand management experience, marketing acumen, project management skills, and expertise in digital marketing to drive the success of our marketing initiatives that promote our distinctive private clubs.

**Duties and Functions:**

* **Strategic Marketing & Brand Management:**
* Work closely with the CMO and Creative Director to develop and implement a comprehensive brand strategy for assigned clubs and brands that resonates with the exclusivity and sophistication of private golf clubs and luxury real estate.
* Work closely with sales, marketing, and club leadership to plan and execute tailored marketing campaigns to showcase the unique features and lifestyle associated with our private golf clubs and luxury real estate to drive interest and lead conversion to real estate and membership sales.
* Collaborate with assigned club operations teams to cultivate and enhance the brand identity, ensuring alignment with the values and aspirations of our discerning clientele. Lead cross-functional teams to integrate marketing and brand strategies into the overall operation of the clubs.
* Assist in the development of tracking reports and analytics for core competitive set and target market customer insights and incorporate them into club and brand marketing plans.
* **Project Management Excellence:**
* Leverage strong project management skills to oversee marketing projects across the entire portfolio of clubs, ensuring seamless execution from concept to completion, on time and on budget, and providing communication to key stakeholders along the way.
* Work with club marketing managers and operation teams to establish and manage project timelines, budgets, and resources effectively.
* Collaborate with the Creative Director and Director of Digital Strategy to develop workflows and processes that manage production with internal resources and agency partners and effectively communicate to internal clients the status of their club-specific projects.
* Develop, manage, and maintain optimal marketing production and campaign approval systems and quality control and tracking programs that promote accountability and effectiveness and ensure excellent execution.
* **Communications:**
* Point person on the marketing team to manage the editorial calendar and assist in developing content for the blog and social media.
* Collaborate with club management teams to support member communications.
* **Digital Marketing Expertise:**
* Work closely with the Director of Digital Strategy to help drive digital marketing strategies and initiatives, including SEO, SEM, social media, email marketing, and content marketing, tailored to the unique characteristics of the luxury real estate and private golf club sectors.
* Stay abreast of industry trends in digital marketing and integrate cutting-edge techniques to enhance online visibility and engagement.
* **Industry Experience:**
* Demonstrate an in-depth understanding of the private golf club and luxury real estate sectors, staying abreast of industry trends, market dynamics, and competitor landscapes.
* **Collaboration and Leadership:**
* Foster collaboration and open communication across teams, including creative, digital marketing, and sales and operations.
* Cultivate a culture of innovation and excellence.

**Qualifications Standards:**

* Proven experience as a Brand and/or Marketing Manager in luxury hospitality, real estate, and/or private golf clubs: Demonstrated success in developing and implementing marketing strategies that drive interest and conversion to sales in a lifestyle industry.
* Project Management Expertise: Track record of successfully managing marketing projects for high-end real estate, ensuring excellence in deliverables within deadlines and budgets.
* Digital Marketing Proficiency: Expertise in digital marketing channels, tools, and analytics with the ability to develop and execute effective digital marketing strategies.
* Strategic thinking: Ability to think strategically, identifying opportunities to elevate the brand presence and market positioning of clubs and brands.
* Excellent Communication Skills: Strong verbal and written communication skills.
* Collaborative Team Player: Proven ability to collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams and inspire excellence.
* Analytical Skills: Proficient in analyzing market data and performance metrics to drive data-driven decision-making.
* Bachelor's degree in Marketing, Advertising, Communications, Business, or related field: Advanced degrees or relevant certifications are a plus.
* Experience or working knowledge with the following systems a plus HubSpot, MailChimp, Monday, Jonas, Adobe Creative Cloud.

Join our dedicated team and be a part of a thriving community that values excellence and superior service. As our Marketing Projects Manager, you will have the opportunity to make a significant impact on our success, shaping its image and growth. If you are a passionate marketer with a flair for creativity and a love for the luxury hospitality industry, we encourage you to apply. Together, we will continue to elevate the experience for our valued members and guests.

Apply today to start your new career, *the Southworth Way*

**Note:** This job description is intended to convey information essential to understanding the scope of this position. It is not an exhaustive list of responsibilities, and additional tasks may be assigned based on operational needs

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $75,000.00 - $90,000.00 per year

Work Location: Remote

title: Senior Manager, Growth Marketing
description:
**The Company:**



GitKraken makes a suite of legendary Git tools and services that help developers be more productive – and teams collaborate more closely – wherever they are and wherever they code. We are on a mission to make Git easier, safer, and more powerful across multiple surfaces and environments. Our Git tools are designed to enable developers to streamline workflows and maximize collaboration. We are a profitable, sustainably growing tech company that values talent, drive, and the ability to make an impact. Join us in powering 25M+ global developers from 100K+ organizations!

 **The Role:**



As a **Senior Manager of Growth Marketing,** you will play a pivotal role in ideating, creating and optimizing demand generation campaigns to increase GitKraken’s new business growth. You will be responsible for going end-to-end in identifying and executing opportunities to continuously improve performance at various stages of our product funnels. You’ll need to develop successful, scalable digital marketing campaigns that drive user and customer acquisition at scale, ideally for PLG (product-led growth) businesses like GitKraken.

  



This role requires a balance of analytical prowess, creative thinking, and a deep understanding of paid, owned, earned, and organic media channels. We’re looking for someone who is constantly innovating and never afraid to challenge the current results & reality, in pursuit of growth. You’ll be an expert in testing campaigns (ad creative, landing pages, CTAs, end-to-end user journeys) and thrive in a performance-oriented environment where success is measured in tangible metrics. You’ll also be additive to a high-energy team dynamic, bringing an attitude that’s equal parts “can do” and “what if we tried”. The successful candidate will be eager to excel as an individual contributor but even more concerned about winning as a team.

  

We are committed to having an inclusive and authentic work environment where unique perspectives, skills, and backgrounds are celebrated. We work hard to foster diversity in our workplace and encourage people from all backgrounds to apply. Even if you don't meet 100% of the requirements, don't let self-filtering and imposter syndrome get in the way of a great fit. We would love to hear from you!

 **What you'll do:**


* Implement new marketing strategies to drive awareness, engagement, acquisition, and revenue growth.
* Go end-to-end ideating, developing, managing and reporting on marketing campaigns across various digital channels.
* Embody GitKraken’s values: we’re developer first; strive to delight; in it together; we look inward, enjoy the journey; have a bias to action; we say do.
* Analyze and leverage data to identify trends, optimize campaigns, and increase marketing efficiency and ROI.
* Lead A/B and multivariate testing strategies and conversion rate optimization (CRO) initiatives to drive continuous improvement.
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including Content/Product Marketing, Product, Partnerships, and Sales to align marketing strategies with company goals.
* Deeply understand GitKraken’s new user experience and identify opportunities to improve email trial workflows in HubSpot and other communication touchpoints that lead to trial conversions.
* Stay ahead of industry trends and advancements in digital marketing technologies and platforms.
* Report on performance metrics, providing insights and recommendations to leadership for informed decision-making.
* Develop and implement frameworks and processes to ensure team success, including tracking and measurement of marketing programs and spend to align with the demand gen budget and achieve positive ROI.
* Establish and analyze KPIs that support key growth metrics and effectively deploy marketing resources to drive results.

  


**What you’ll bring:**


* Bachelor's degree in Marketing, Business, or a related field.
* 3+ years of experience in performance or growth marketing, with expertise in digital marketing channels including paid search, SEM/SEO, paid social, etc.
* Strong analytical skills and experience with Google Analytics (GA4) to create website and campaign performance reports that can be used to make data-driven decisions.
* Ability to continually be conceiving, designing and running A/B tests, as well as analyzing and reporting on performance.
* Experience with marketing automation and CRM tools, ideally HubSpot.
* Creating HubSpot campaign reports to show performance of various assets.
* Basic web development experience with WordPress or other CMSs to create and update landing pages.
* Ability to create wireframes and landing page mockups in tools like Figma or Canva.
* Proven track record of developing and executing successful digital marketing campaigns.
* Excellent leadership and team management skills.
* Strong project management abilities, capable of prioritizing and handling multiple projects simultaneously under tight time constraints.
* Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to work effectively in a hybrid or remote environment.
* Passionate about technology and staying at the forefront of digital marketing trends.
* Ability to collect and synthesize quantitative and qualitative data, while highlighting trends, measuring performance, and influencing leaders based on data analysis.
* Outstanding problem solver who can work through highly ambiguous challenges.
* Excellent communication and presentation skills that can be adapted for audiences at all levels across the organization.

  


**Bonus points:**


* Experience leading performance marketing in the developer tooling space (GitHub, GitLab, Docker, etc.)
* Familiarity with Git, software development, and/or targeting developers as a primary audience.
* Understanding of developer workflows, tooling, and industry trends.

  


**How you’ll be rewarded:**



**Excellence** — Competitive compensation with annual performance-based pay increases



**Trust** — Flexible Paid-Time-Off Policy (behaves like Unlimited PTO)



**Travel** — Company paid domestic trip after your 1-year anniversary & an international trip every 5 years



**Balance** — Paid company holidays with flexibility for additional holidays



**Equipment** — Top-of-line technology to maximize your productivity


**Parent life** — Generous paid parental leave



**Health** — Health, dental, and vision insurance with competitive employer cost-sharing



**Culture** — Great Place to Work Certified



**Headquarters** — Modern, high-tech offices designed to maximize productivity in a hybrid environment



**Growth** — Paid career and personal development, audiobooks, and mentorship



**Future** —IRA retirement plan plus company matching

 **Location:**



Our VP and Director of Marketing are local to our Scottsdale, Arizona HQ, so we would love to fill this role locally to enable face-to-face collaboration a few days per week at the Scottsdale office. However, we know that talent, drive and attitude always outweigh location, so we will consider strong candidates from anywhere in the US who apply for this role.

 *Equal Employment Opportunity Statement:*


*At GitKraken, we believe that diversity among our teammates is critical to our success as a company. GitKraken evaluates all employees and job applicants without regard to race, color, religion, gender (including pregnancy, gender expression, or gender identity), national origin, age, disability status, or any other legally protected class. We recruit, hire, and retain top talent from a diverse candidate pool.*

title: Designer for Marketing Agency
description:
As the **Graphic Designer** for Swimm Social, you will work collaboratively as part of the team to create concepts for print and digital marketing collateral across multiple platforms including recruitment publications, program books, signage, email marketing, branding campaigns, social media and web graphics and digital displays. Reporting directly to the Founder, you will collaborate with a team of photographers, social and digital marketing strategists to conceptualize and deliver a collection of print and digital designs, in support of marketing campaigns.

Top candidates for this position will exhibit outstanding creativity and expert design skills with the ability to schedule and manage multiple projects effectively.

The Graphic Designer duties and responsibilities include, but are not limited, to:

* Create visually stunning print and digital designs, incorporating typography, photography, illustrations, and design theory best practices with a keen eye for aesthetics and attention to detail to enhance the overall impact and engagement of marketing materials.
* Develop advanced creative designs based on concepts and the target audience that meet client requirements and university brand guidelines.
* Conceptualize and implement multi-platform campaigns that support overall company marketing and strategic goals
* Manage multiple projects within tight deadlines
* Incorporate revisions to achieve the desired creative vision based on feedback
* Stay updated with industry trends and best practices, continuously refining skills, and exploring new techniques to push the boundaries of print and digital design

Job Type: Contract

Pay: $1,500.00 per month

Schedule:

* Choose your own hours

Ability to Relocate:

* Remote: Relocate before starting work (Required)

Work Location: Remote
