title: Customer Success Manager
description:
**Who We Are**

Hi, we're Banzai

Today, marketers have access to more resources and tools than ever before, so why is most marketing so cringe-worthy? Marketing has lost touch with the humans behind the clicks, opens, and form submits, but Banzai wants to change that. That's why our mission is to make marketing more human.

At Banzai, we think the secret to better marketing is educating, learning from, and building relationships with buyers. This new approach is called Engagement Marketing.

Banzai is leading the Engagement Marketing movement. Our products reach millions of users every year and help our customers drive more revenue through better events, webinars, content, and data. Best of all, Banzai makes marketing a little more human for all of us.

Join Banzai to help build a future that puts people at the center of marketing.

**Summary:**

Banzai is looking for a Customer Success Manager to join our Customer Experience team! As a Customer Success Manager, your main duty will be to focus on the success and growth of our existing customers by building relationships, monitoring usage and adoption, and providing training and consulting. Your ultimate goal will be to encourage expansion and renewals.

We’re looking for a self-motivated and customer-centric individual that has experience and energy around customer satisfaction *and* growing revenue.

**Expectations of Role:**

The primary focus of this role is to impact NRR (Net Retention Rate). Each quarter you will have objectives with revenue targets for renewals and expansions within your assigned customer segment. With that end goal in mind, you will work backwards in determining your actionable key results to help you hit that target. You will also work closely with Customer Marketing to determine campaigns and webinars to help drive customer success.

**What an average day/week looks like:**

* Proactive Customer Communication: you will never run out of reasons and opportunities to proactively reach out to your customers!
* Reactive Customer Communication: timely responses to customer emails are key, so you won’t end your work day without replying to all customer emails that came in throughout the day.
* Customer Meetings: your day will most likely have a variety of new customer onboardings and existing customer check-ins.
* Objectives: staying on top of your objectives and making sure you’re on pace is essential. As a CSM your main objectives will be for renewal and expansion revenue, so you’ll want to make sure you are both keeping your eye on upcoming renewals and looking for expansion opportunities.
* Internal Communication and Meetings: our main internal communication tool is Slack. This is where you’ll be able to get (and give) quick answers to questions, read updates, and build community! You’ll definitely have weekly 1:1s with your manager and a weekly all staff meeting we call “Weekly Wins”, along with other one off meetings here and there.

**Desired Qualifications, Skills, & Experience**

* 2+ years of experience in a Customer Success or Account Management role, preferably in SaaS
* A strong track record of hitting renewal and expansion targets, ultimately improving NRR
* Experience managing accounts across multiple market segments and building strong partnerships with varied levels of stakeholders
* Webinar experience strongly preferred; marketing experience a bonus
* Detailed Salesforce hygiene; keep account notes updated
* Motivated self-starter with a growth mindset
* Passionate about providing excellent customer experiences
* Ability to learn multiple products quickly
* Proactive, with exceptional follow through
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills
* People oriented; quickly builds positive rapport
* Embodiment of our company values (Learning, Serving Others, and 10,000 Years), both internally and externally.

**Benefits**

* 401(k) plan (US based)
* Health, Dental, Vision, Life, and Long-Term Disability insurance (US based)
* Unlimited PTO policy (salaried) or hourly PTO policy
* Remote first company
* 12 weeks fully paid parental leave
* Working with a truly mission-driven team motivated by excellence
* Real room for growth in professional and personal development
* 2 paid mental health days every quarter, plus one full week of paid mental health rest every year
* Clear objectives, direction and empowerment from executive leadership

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $80,000.00 - $120,000.00 per year

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* Health insurance
* Paid time off
* Parental leave

Experience:

* Customer retention: 2 years (Preferred)

Work Location: Remote

title: Email Marketing Manager
description:
Apollo.io is the leading go-to-market solution for revenue teams, trusted by over 500,000 companies and millions of users globally, from rapidly growing startups to some of the world's largest enterprises. Apollo.io provides sales and marketing teams with easy access to verified contact data for over 270 million B2B contacts, along with tools to engage and convert these contacts in one unified platform. By helping revenue professionals find the most accurate contact information and automating the outreach process, Apollo.io turns prospects into customers. Apollo raised a series D in 2023 and is backed by top-tier investors, including Sequoia Capital, Bain Capital Ventures, and more, and counts the former President and COO of Hubspot, JD Sherman, among its board members. Apollo.io is growing rapidly, with 900% revenue growth since 2021, and is looking for world-class talent to keep building with us.


At Apollo.io, our mission is to elevate user experiences through meticulous and strategic engagement. In the pivotal role of Email Marketing Manager, you will be instrumental in crafting and executing email campaigns that not only drive engagement and registrations but also illuminate the value of our offerings.



Your efforts will directly contribute to enhancing product awareness, increasing feature adoption, and positioning Apollo.io as a thought leader in the industry. Your responsibilities will include the rigorous management of our email domain and IP infrastructure, the upkeep of a pristine user database, and a steadfast focus on optimizing key performance metrics essential for our expansion. Collaboration is at the heart of this role; you will work in tandem with the Growth, Product, and Content teams, providing insights that shape our strategies. Reporting directly to the Head of Lifecycle and Marketing Automation, your insights and achievements in email marketing will play a critical role in our overall strategy.  

  

**Responsibilities**


* Strategic Email Campaign Development: Create and execute email campaigns for webinars, events, product updates, and thought leadership, ensuring each is tailored to drive specific goals such as engagement or registrations.
* Lead Nurture Programs: Develop targeted email nurture streams for non-users and prospects, focusing on driving new user sign-ups and demo requests.
* Content Collaboration: Craft compelling email content that accurately communicates product value and industry insights.
* Email Optimization and Testing: Utilize A/B testing and analytics to optimize email performance, focusing on improving open rates, click-through rates, and conversions.
* Database Management: Oversee the health of the email database, implementing strategies to clean and update contact lists regularly.


**About You**

  

* 5+ years in demand generation ideally in a PLG B2B SaaS company
* Content Creation & Storytelling: Exceptional ability in crafting engaging email content that captures the audience's attention and encourages action.
* Data-Driven Decision Making: Strong analytical skills to interpret email campaign data and adjust strategies accordingly to improve performance.
* Technical Proficiency in Email Marketing Tools: Skilled in using email marketing platforms (e.g., HubSpot) to segment audiences, automate campaigns, and track performance.
* Cross-Functional Collaboration: Ability to work effectively with various teams to gather input and align email marketing strategies with broader business objectives.
* Adaptability to Market Trends: Staying informed of the latest trends in email marketing and adapting strategies to maintain the effectiveness of email campaigns.


**What You’ll Love About Apollo**



Besides the great compensation package and culture that thrives in openness and excellence, we invest tremendous effort into developing our remote employees’ careers. The team embraces that we have a sole purpose: to help customers maximize their full revenue potential on the Apollo platform. This mindset opens us up to a lot of creative approaches to making customers successful at scale. You’ll be a significant part of a lean, remote team, empowered to really own your role as a proactive educator. We’re very collaborative at Apollo, so you’ll be able to lean on your teammates, even in adjacent departments, to help you achieve lofty goals. You’ll be supported and encouraged to experiment and take educated risks that lead to big wins. And, you’ll have a whole team remotely by your side to help you do it!

title: Digital Marketing Manager
description:
Our dynamic marketing team is seeking a Digital Marketing Manager, who will play a pivotal role in amplifying our digital footprint through expert management of paid search and social media advertising strategies. Situated at the heart of our marketing operations, this position offers a direct line to the Manager of Events and Demand Generation, setting the stage for impactful contributions to a fast-scaling start-up; Hyperproof.



LOCATION: 100% remote, US-based  

COMPENSATION: $110,000 - 120,000 base



WHO YOU ARE


* You're a highly analytical marketer with a bias for action.
* You will work day to day running campaigns in Google Ads, LinkedIn Ads Manager, and 6Sense, digging into the data to understand the "why" behind performance, and launching tests to improve upon it.
* You'll also get to flex your creative muscles by owning landing page testing and working closely with our internal creative team to design and test new ad formats.
* This role is a unique opportunity for a digital marketer to scale their impact or for an agency media manager to gain experience on the client side.


WHAT WE ARE LOOKING FOR YOU TO DO


* Lead a data centric paid digital marketing program that scales
+ This role will analyze and manage campaigns across Google Search Ads, LinkedIn Ads, Display Ads, and test new digital channels, leveraging data-driven insights to drive new leads for the business

* Own and deliver on critical marketing metrics, demonstrating your ability to strategically guide and directly manage campaigns
* Develop and execute a comprehensive paid marketing strategy, focusing on long-term success and analysis
* Collaborate with senior leaders across multiple functions to identify and lead essential marketing work streams
* Lead projects, setting clear objectives and milestones, and maintain effective communication throughout the project lifecycle
* Clearly and continuously communicate paid performance, challenges, and opportunities to the wider organization
* Effectively manage relationships with external agencies and freelancers


HOW YOU'LL KNOW YOU ARE SUCCESSFUL (Key KPI's)


* Reduced cost per MQL and SQL in LinkedIn, Google Paid Search, Bing Paid Search. Improved engagement and click through rate in 6Sense. Early improvements as soon as 90 days.


WHAT YOU'LL BRING


* A minimum of 2 years of experience within Marketing at a B2B SaaS organization
* Experience with Digital Marketing Tools: LinkedIn Advertising, Google AdWords, HubSpot, Salesforce, and 6Sense required
* Be able to provide examples of running ongoing campaigns, particularly in user acquisition and lead generation
* You are skilled in developing strategies across various functions and leading projects
* You are a data-driven decision maker with experience owning and meeting significant marketing targets
* You have hands-on experience in campaign management and are adept at coordinating with agencies and freelancers
* You're used to owning a number and have a track record of meeting ambitious marketing goals


OUR TECH


* LinkedIn Advertising
* Google AdWords
* Hubspot
* Salesforce
* 6Sense

  



LOCATION



We are a fully remote company! Rather than restrict ourselves to only finding talent in one city, we'd rather find the absolute best people regardless of where they live within the US.

  



CANDIDATE EXPERIENCE


* We value your time and want you to know what to expect from us. For this interview, we expect to ask you to participate in 4 interviews and expect this to be completed in 4 hours total.

  

  

WHERE YOU'LL GO


* Hyperproof also loves to see an internal transfer. If a linear career path is not what you're looking for, you can work with your manager and our people team to explore lateral moves to other parts of the organization as you continue to grow with us.


WHERE YOU'LL GO


* Hyperproof also loves to see an internal transfer. If a linear career path is not what you're looking for, you can work with your manager and our people team to explore lateral moves to other parts of the organization as you continue to grow with us.

  



WHAT WE OFFER


* Annual compensation reviews + equity
* Unlimited PTO: strongly encouraged to unplug and recharge
* Health: coverage for medical, dental, and vision - employee and dependents
* 401K which vests immediately, complete with a 4% company match
* 12 weeks of Parental leave and 1 year free diapers and wipes with Honest
* Annual company in-person events and quarterly in-person connects
* $1000 home office stipend - at the time of hire. Any additional home office needs are requested as needed.
* $100 quarterly paid wellness stipend
* Pet insurance
* Slack channel notifications turn off after 5 pm based on your time zone
* Two Hypercharge weeks of rest where we close company wide (July & Dec)


It's an exciting time to be at Hyperproof — we recently raised $40 million in our Series B financing, further cementing Hyperproof as the emerging leader in the risk and compliance management space.



At Hyperproof's core are our passionate team members who focus on user experience, beautiful design, and evangelize a positive social impact of our cloud based platform. We help organizations streamline their risk and compliance workflows so our customers can spend more time strategically managing programs and less time wrangling spreadsheets.



We are disrupting the governance, risk, and compliance software space with our innovative platform by helping traditionally unsung heroes (compliance professionals) **do the right things so the wrong things don't happen.**

  



Learn more about the @hyperproof culture and how it all started.

  


**EQUAL OPPORTUNITY EMPLOYER**



Hyperproof is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace — it's one of our core values! Hyperproof is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, disability, age, or other legally protected status.



Our company is dedicated to building a diverse, inclusive, and authentic workplace. If you're excited about this role, but your experience doesn't perfectly fit every qualification, we encourage you to apply anyway. You may be just the right person for this role or others.

title: Associate Brand Manager, Agency (sister brand to Curology)
description:
Curology is creating the next generation of skincare through customized treatment plans and formulas with powerful prescription ingredients for acne and anti-aging. We believe great skin shouldn’t be a luxury, but a fact of life.  

  

Most brand management roles at traditional brands are slow and stagnant. You inherit a great history, but end up focused on protecting past success rather than blazing paths for future growth. And most startup brand management roles, well, they don’t exist. The C-suite runs the business, and brand management becomes brand marketing, without a strong connection to business results.  

At Curology, we’re changing that. We are looking to hire an Associate Brand Manager to help propel Agency to our next level of growth. Your job will be to support the Brand Lead of Agency to launch 360 marketing campaigns, bring Agency’s brand marketing to the next level and supercharge our evergreen marketing across organic social, influencer, PR and more.
### **What you'll do:**

+ Analyze the business and develop an in-depth understanding of key drivers
+ Own performance tracking for new initiatives, deriving insights from the data which will enable brand leaders as they set the direction for brand growth
+ Size and scope innovation (product + marketing) opportunities through the development of robust forecasts and business models to prove out ROI and size of prize
+ Partner with the Brand Lead of Agency, to identify net new future growth levers to inflect the business [ex. New audience segments]
+ Get hands on with execution, partnering with integrated marketing, creative, product/packaging, engineering, consumer insights, medical, legal - to bring plans to life
+ Lead go-to-market launches of new products, developing and closely monitoring detailed timelines and managing cross functional stakeholders, looking for opportunities to optimize the tools and processes to brief in teamsLead development of world-class briefs that effectively communicated the “what”, “how” and “why” for brand campaigns and product launches
+ Lead our brand’s expansion into new distribution channels, developing competitive pricing strategies, best in class content to support the launch and managing marketing budget

### **About you:**

+ **You are analytical but able to go beyond the data:** you are able to derive key insights from a variety of data points and sources and put them into context to get to the “so what”
+ **You love a challenge and are self-driven:** you thrive under pressure and can very quickly become a subject matter expert on any subject through self-drive; you can take on projects and manage them end-to-end, seeking help and guidance as needed
+ **Exceptional communicator:** you can clearly communicate complex ideas through different mediums; you are able to build relationships quickly
+ **Humble and a great team player:** you are constantly trying to learn from others and you have a flexible approach that enables strong collaboration with cross-functional partners; you have a can-do attitude and will roll up your sleeves to do what is needed for the team
+ **2-4 Years in CPG Brand Management:** You have worked in Brand Management at a traditional CPG company, with experience in DTC
+ **Motivated by curiosity,** whether solving a problem, pursuing a new experience, or seeking creative inspiration
+ **Results-driven, solution-oriented, flexible,** self-driving, and must have the ability to change course quickly

### **You'll love working at Curology because:**

+ Competitive salary and equity packages
+ Comprehensive benefits: medical, dental, and vision insurance for employees; flexible spending account; 401k; mental health & wellness programs
+ $75 WFH stipend (remote employees)
+ Home office setup stipend (remote employees)
+ Minimum Time Off policy (unlimited PTO, with at least 3 weeks off) for exempt employees
+ 11 company observed holidays
+ Additional holidays: Curology days off (1 per quarter), 1 annual floating holiday (employee’s choice), and Gratitude Week (employees take the full week of Thanksgiving off; business critical teams observe different days)
+ Paid parental leave
+ Employee donation matching program
+ Company-sponsored events
+ Free subscription to Curology or Agency

$81,000 - $120,000 a year
Our mission is simple: to make personalized skincare accessible and convenient for all. Awarded #3 for 2021 Best Workplaces in the Bay Area and 2021 Forbes #4 Best Startup Employers, Curology is a leader in direct-to-consumer eCommerce and has been featured in Vogue, Allure, Harper’s Bazaar, and Business Insider. We collaborate to achieve our goals and strive to embody our core values: Accountability, Team First & Inclusivity.

title: Email & Lifecycle Marketing Manager
description:
**The Role**  

Wpromote is looking for a sharp Manager, Email & Lifecycle Marketing to join our Email & Lifecycle Marketing team. We're looking for someone who's whip-smart and knows how to get results while having fun along the way. You’ll need to be strong in Email & SMS marketing strategy, as well as client management. If we could describe the perfect candidate for this role, words like analytical, strategic, proactive, conversion-focused, and communicative come to mind.  

At Wpromote, we believe that great work is only possible with great people. Our goal is to build a better, more inclusive work environment and support our people at every stage of their careers by prioritizing a strong work-life balance through our policies and benefits listed below. As a Best Place to Work according to both Ad Age and Glassdoor and Adweek’s Fastest Growing Digital Agency, we are moving fast to expand our teams and bring new experts into the fold to keep pushing the boundaries of what’s possible in marketing.  

We offer:* Remote-first culture
* Unlimited PTO
* Extended Holiday break (Winter)
* Flexible schedules
* Work from anywhere options\\*
* 100% paid parental leave
* 401(k) matching
* Medical, Dental, Vision, Life, Pet Insurance
* Sponsored life insurance
* Short Term Disability insurance and additional voluntary insurance
* Annual Class Pass credits and more!

  

The anticipated annual salary for this role will range from $65,000 - $85,000, based on consideration of a wide array of factors unique to each candidate, including but not limited to skill set, years and depth of experience, education and certifications, competitive benchmarks, scope of responsibility, market dynamics, geographic location, and respective state’s salary threshold for exempt employees. The total compensation package for this role will include benefits (listed above).* This position may be performed remotely in most states within the US, with some exclusions


\\*\\*This position is not eligible for immigration sponsorship  

#LI-JJ
#LI-Remote
### **You Will Be**

* Managing Email & SMS marketing programs and automated campaigns leveraging your knowledge to drive the best results for your clients.
* Providing strategic guidance and tactical support to drive client success.
* Monitoring deliverability and account reputation in line with CAN-SPAM & GDPR regulations.
* Partnering with our clients through clear, thoughtful communication and mutually supportive relationships.
* Leveraging your experience to enable the best communication at the right time to your clients’ customers through automated emails, push messaging, and email campaigns.
* Developing optimizations that drive learnings and increase KPIs through A/B testing, platform updates, and best practices.
* Pulling reporting, analyzing, and providing insightful program recommendations.
* Conducting client presentations through in-person QBRs, monthly exec summaries and more.

### **You Must Have**

* At least 3+ years working in CRM / Email marketing with experience in ESPs such as SFMC, Pardot, Marketo, Klaviyo, Braze, etc.
* Experience leading on SMS programs.
* Experience leading on Mobile App Push Notifications a plus.
* Experience strategizing and executing comprehensive list segmentation, life cycle/drip automations and triggered events within an ESP.
* Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
* The desire to solve problems and create solutions.
* Ability to hit the ground running and pick up new skills.
* Client-centric mindset constantly seeking ways to drive client success.
* Strong project management skills maintaining client communications across several clients.
* Experience with web analytics (GA or Omniture, etc) and setting up UTM tracking.
* The drive to thrive in a fast paced, team-oriented environment as well as work independently.
* Experience using Asana, Basecamp, or a similar tool is preferred.


Wpromote is committed to bringing together individuals from different backgrounds and perspectives, providing employees with a safe and welcoming environment free of discrimination and harassment. We strive to create a diverse & inclusive environment where everyone can thrive, feel a sense of belonging, and do impactful work together. This employer participates in E-Verify and will provide the federal government with your Form I-9 information to confirm that you are authorized to work in the U.S. If E-Verify cannot confirm that you are authorized to work, this employer is required to give you written instructions and an opportunity to contact Department of Homeland Security (DHS) or Social Security Administration (SSA) so you can begin to resolve the issue before the employer can take any action against you, including terminating your employment. title: Manager, Lifecycle Marketing (Remote)
description:
***Job Title:***
Manager, Lifecycle Marketing (Remote)***Role Overview:***
As a critical member of the McAfee retention team, the digital marketing manager will be responsible for driving key business metrics through data-driven experimentation, and optimization. This person will report to the Senior Director of Retention and be responsible for identifying, planning, executing and monitoring performance of marketing campaigns and other strategic initiatives intended to optimize and personalize the customer journey from initial purchase and activation through retention. This person will work closely with partner sales, other marketing specialists and cross-functional stakeholders through day-to-day execution of testing, analytics, creative, campaign launches for key customer segments.
  

  

This person will oversee retention of customers acquired through our Retail partner channels and lead a team of marketers dedicated to optimizing individual customer journeys from purchase & activation through retention.
  

  

This is a remote job based in the United States or Canada. We will only consider candidates based in United States or Canada and are not offering relocation at this time.**About the Role**

* Lead the strategy, creation, and execution of comprehensive integrated marketing campaigns aimed at increasing awareness, fostering understanding, and driving growth through retention
* Advocate for the consumer and partners, ensuring consistency in visuals and messaging across programs, audiences, and regions within the business
* Lead creative optimization for the customer journey to improve the customer relationship and drive engagement, while focusing on key monetization opportunities
* Develop and execute testing strategies to optimize retention and monetization through personalized offers, promotions and messaging
* Perform end-to-end monitoring of campaign execution and performance
* Work both independently and collaboratively with cross-functional teams to manage stakeholders and drive initiatives
* Monitor, evaluate and report on key metrics relating to bookings, retention rates, customer journey and campaign performance for the portion of the retention business within your scope
* Manage a dedicated team of marketers within your organization

**About you**

* 7+ years of experience leading consumer-facing marketing and integrated campaigns, including influencer and event marketing campaigns
* Background in high-growth or transformation-focused businesses
* Extensive expertise in brand strategy, architecture, messaging
* Experience managing agency & outside partners (media, creative, and research)
* Comprehensive understanding of the a/b testing process and data-driven experimentation; knowledge of Adobe Analytics, Adobe Target, or other analytics & testing platforms
* Passion for and demonstrated track record of driving initiatives that improve customer experience and monetization; experience with consumer-facing SaaS business models
* Strong execution skills including proven ability to drive multiple initiatives in a fast-paced, innovative environment
* Exhibit excellent analytical and critical thinking skills, along with persuasive verbal and written communication abilities
* Team player that develops strong relationships, is able to influence stakeholders and drive cross-functional alignment to accomplish strategic objective
* Past experience managing people
* Familiarity with global businesses, tech industries, software-as-a-service business models, B2C & B2B2C distribution channels are desirable


#LI-Remote

 ***Company Overview***
McAfee is a leader in personal security for consumers. Focused on protecting people, not just devices, McAfee consumer solutions adapt to users’ needs in an always online world, empowering them to live securely through integrated, intuitive solutions that protects their families and communities with the right security at the right moment.

***Company Benefits and Perks:***


We work hard to embrace diversity and inclusion and encourage everyone at McAfee to bring their authentic selves to work every day. We offer a variety of social programs, flexible work hours and family-friendly benefits to all of our employees.

* Bonus Program
* 401k Retirement Plan
* Medical, Dental, Vision, Basic Life, Short Term Disability and Long-Term Disability Coverage
* Paid Parental Leave
* Support for Community Involvement
* 14 Paid Company Holidays
* Unlimited Paid Time Off for Exempt Employees
* 96 Hours of Sick Time and 120 Hours of Vacation for Non-Exempt Employees Accrued Each Year


We're serious about our commitment to diversity which is why McAfee prohibits discrimination based on race, color, religion, gender, national origin, age, disability, veteran status, marital status, pregnancy, gender expression or identity, sexual orientation or any other legally protected status.


The starting pay range for this position is $109,240.00-$179,462.50. McAfee takes into consideration an individual’s skillset, experience and location in making final salary determinations. For further details, please discuss with the Talent Acquisition Partner.

title: Marketing Analytics Manager (Remote)
description:
**Summary**
-----------


Yelp’s purpose is simple: to connect people with great local businesses. Whether you’re looking for a great pizza spot, or the best mechanic in your neighborhood, we know just the place.  

Yelp is seeking a Marketing Analytics Manager to lead and grow our marketing analytics capability. Marketing Analytics helps drive data-driven marketing decisions and supports continued revenue growth. In this role, you’ll be leading a small, but mighty team within the growing marketing org at Yelp. Marketing Analytics is a cross-channel support team that supports both consumer and business growth marketing channels. Your day-to-day responsibilities will range from working with stakeholders to prioritize requests, mentoring team members to increase throughput and efficiency, reporting out on team progress, collaborating with cross functional teams in data engineering and infrastructure, and digging into complex analytics requests yourself from time-to-time. Expect to collaborate with stakeholders including senior leaders, across a variety of channels in order to provide a data-driven lens on marketing decisions. Data is at the core of everything we do and this role plays a critical role in equipping the team to scale strategic decision making across the marketing org.  

We’d love to have you apply, even if you don’t feel you meet every single requirement in this posting. At Yelp, we’re looking for great people, not just those who simply check off all the boxes. This is a full-time remote role based in the United States.**What you'll do:**
-------------------

* Lead and mentor a marketing analytics team to improve efficiency and throughput.
* Partner with stakeholders to understand core needs and leverage your experience to develop scalable solutions that anticipate future needs and ease of use.
* Report out to executive leadership on team throughput and progress.
* Become a subject matter expert on Yelp’s marketing metrics and relevant data sources.
* Collaborate with marketing stakeholders to prioritize new requests and report on the progress of existing requests.
* Work cross-functionally with key teams across data infrastructure, engineering, and operations to ensure availability and accuracy of required data.
* Identify opportunities to improve or add to existing views of data, resulting in better resources for extracting learnings more efficiently.
* Exercise sound business judgment and influence the direction of Yelp’s business by effectively working with and communicating results to cross-functional groups.

**What it takes to succeed:**
-----------------------------

* 6+ years of relevant business experience solving analytical problems and deriving insights using quantitative approaches.
* 2+ years of leading an analytics team and mentoring analysts.
* Superior hands-on analytic skills, including SQL, advanced Excel modeling and Tableau dashboard building.
* Experience with ecommerce, or an analytical role at a fast-paced B2C or marketplace tech company.
* Business acumen, and an enthusiasm for marketing strategy, customer segmentation, and user growth.
* Understanding of stat stig and experience with A/B testing and experimentation for web or software.
* Exceptional problem solver with the ability to transition between detailed data and high-level insights to drive decisions.
* Ability to build cross-functional relationships through proactive communication and collaboration initiatives.

**What you'll get:**
--------------------

* Effective your first day: Full medical, vision, and dental
* 15 days PTO (accrual begins on date of hire and increases with 2+ years of tenure thereafter), 12 paid holidays, plus one floating holiday
* Up to 14 weeks of parental leave
* Monthly wellness subsidy
* Work from home reimbursement
* Flexible spending account
* 401(k) retirement savings plan
* Employee stock purchase plan
* Compensation range for this position is $128,000 - $238,000 annually. You may also be offered a bonus and benefits.

**Closing**
-----------

*At Yelp, we believe that diversity is an expression of all the unique characteristics that make us human: race, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, religion, disability, and education — and those are just a few. We recognize that diverse backgrounds and perspectives strengthen our teams and our product. The foundation of our diversity efforts are closely tied to our core values, which include “Playing Well With Others” and “Authenticity.”*
*We’re proud to be an equal opportunity employer and consider qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, ancestry, age, genetic information, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital or family status, veteran status, medical condition or disability.*
*Actual salary offered may vary based on multiple factors, including but not limited to, an individual's location and experience.*
*We will consider for employment qualified candidates with arrest and conviction records, consistent with applicable law (including, for example, the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance for roles based in San Francisco).*
*We are committed to providing reasonable accommodations for individuals with disabilities in our job application process. If you need assistance or an accommodation due to a disability, you may contact us at accommodations-recruiting@yelp.com or 415-969-8488.*
*Note: Yelp does not accept agency resumes. Please do not forward resumes to any recruiting alias or employee. Yelp is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes.*

US Recruiting and Applicant Privacy Notice

title: Corporate & Executive Events Manager
description:

We are looking for a results-driven event manager to plan and oversee the corporate and executive events.

**About the Team**


You will work cross-functionally to create a portfolio of events targeting executives, analysts, and internal sales organizations.

**Responsibilities**

* Creating the annual and quarterly strategic event plans that align with revenue org’s priorities and goals.
* Managing end-to-end event cycles. This includes a timeline and program planning, budget management, vendor management, logistics handling, day-of-event management, and post-event analysis.
* Having experience with B2B Account-Based Marketing and Enterprise Marketing strategies.
* Working with teams for event alignments, including Zoom executives, field marketing, brand team, sales teams, partner teams, and technical teams.
* Understanding analyst community and able to tailor events to attract industry analysts.
* Building KPI dashboards for event reporting and track metrics and Return on Investment post-event.

**What we’re looking for**

* 8+ years B2B event marketing experience within enterprise software/SaaS company
* Have a Bachelor's in Marketing, Business Administration, or related field, or equivalent experience preferred.
* Experience building and delivering field marketing campaigns, events, executive and key account programs, and sales-oriented events.
* Experience with communication technology: Zoom, Webex, Microsoft Teams

03/07/24

**Benefits**  

As part of our award-winning workplace culture and commitment to delivering happiness, our benefits program offers a variety of perks, benefits, and options to help employees maintain their physical, mental, emotional, and financial health; support work-life balance; and contribute to their community in meaningful ways. We’re problem-solvers, working at a fast pace to design solutions with our customers and users in mind. Here, you’ll work across teams to deliver impactful projects that are changing the way people communicate and enjoy opportunities to advance your career in a diverse, inclusive environment.

title: Marketing Strategy & Operations Manager
description:
**ABOUT RETOOL:**

Nearly every company in the world runs on custom software: Gartner estimates that up to 50% of all code is written for internal use. This is the operational software for refunding orders, underwriting loans, onboarding employees, analyzing transactions, and providing customer support. But most companies don't have adequate resources to properly invest in these tools, leading to a lot of old and clunky internal software or, even worse, users still stuck in manual and spreadsheet flows.



At Retool, we're on a mission to bring good software to everyone. We're building a new type of development platform that combines the benefits of traditional software development with a drag-and-drop UI editor and AI, making it dramatically faster to build internal tools. We believe that the future of software development lies in abstracting away the tedious and repetitive tasks developers waste time on, while creating reusable components that act as a force multiplier for future developers and projects. The result is not just productivity, but good software by default. And that's a mission worth striving for.



Today, our customers span from small startups building their first operational tools to Fortune 500 companies building mission-critical apps for thousands of users across their business. Interested in joining us? Let us know!

**WHY WE'RE LOOKING FOR YOU:**



Retool's GTM teams are growing in size and complexity in order to support extremely ambitious growth in the coming years. We're looking for a Marketing Strategy & Operations Manager to join the Revenue Operations team. Our team is responsible for accelerating Retool's revenue growth by building the ultimate GTM machine. We help the sales, marketing, success, and support teams track and deliver against operating goals, design and implement key cross-functional initiatives, perform root cause analysis to diagnose challenges, and build / maintain the core GTM systems these teams use to collaborate and succeed every day.


**WHAT YOU'LL DO:**



We'll look to you to bring your experience to own the marketing pipeline and top of funnel plans, as well as track and improve our execution against those plans. You'll be very familiar with best practices of a modern B2B marketing organization and can partner with our CMO and VP of Demand Generation to diagnose and improve the marketing team's project execution. You'll support strategies from PLG to paid media to ABM. You will be responsible for improving our visibility into the performance of our marketing funnel(s) and ensuring the health and integrity of marketing metrics on an ongoing basis. You'll be a key contributor to our planning process, providing analysis and reporting to our marketing, finance, and exec team to help us understand the ROI of our marketing spend and opportunities for growth.


**IN THIS ROLE, YOU'LL:**


* Own the planning process for the marketing team
* Use quantitative and qualitative insights to inform growth strategy, roadmap, and prioritization for the Marketing team
* Work with the data and web engineering team to properly instrument and measure our funnels
* Be the right hand to the Head of Marketing for quarterly and annual planning, as well as key strategic initiatives
* Own regular reporting on the overall health of marketing initiatives and top-of-funnel performance across marketing
* Partner with finance to provide visibility into ROI on marketing spend


**THE SKILLSET YOU'LL BRING:**


* 8+ years of marketing experience, with 4-6 years of direct experience working in marketing operations for a B2B SaaS business, preferably with both a product-led and saled-led sales motion, and 6-8 years of total experience including related teams
* Expertise in implementing modern B2B demand gen strategies including ABM
* Aptitude for using data to drive better decision making, including familiarity with SQL
* Exceptional problem solving and analytical skills; demonstrated ability to structure complex problems, navigate challenging data sets, develop solutions, and craft high-quality narrative and executive-level presentations
* Ownership mindset with strong attention to detail
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills
* Highly collaborative style with strong influence skills


For candidates based in the United States, the annual base salary range is listed below. This salary range may be inclusive of several career levels at Retool and will be narrowed during the interview process based on a number of factors such as (but not limited to), scope and responsibilities, the candidate's experience and qualifications, and location.



Additional compensation in the form(s) of equity, and/or commission/bonuses are dependent on the position offered. Retool provides a comprehensive benefit plan, including medical, dental, vision, and 401(k). Pay and benefits are subject to change at any time, consistent with the terms of any applicable compensation or benefit plans.

**United States pay range**


$126,600—$160,100 USD
Retool offers generous benefits to all employees and hybrid work location. For more information, please visit the benefits and perks section of our careers page!



Retool is currently set up to employ all roles in the US and specific roles in the UK. To find roles that can be employed in the UK, please refer to our careers page and review the indicated locations.

title: Marketing Manager
description:
**About us**

Established in 1994, No Starch Press is a San Francisco-based independent publishing house with a fully remote workforce. We specialize in quality technical content that educates and enlightens. Our readers, passionate about computing, and our authors, industry experts, consistently challenge the status quo. We take pride in publishing seminal works across various tech fields.

**The Role:**

Join us as a Marketing Manager to energize and lead our team. Your role includes developing strategies, creating engaging copy, and managing marketing campaigns. You'll be integral in shaping No Starch Press's image, driving digital marketing, and expanding our social media presence. Your efforts will focus on enhancing our marketing and sales, evolving existing programs, and introducing innovative initiatives aligned with our company goals.

**Your Impact:**

* Develop and implement strategic marketing plans that align with our brand ethos, engage diverse audiences, and boost sales.
* Execute targeted email marketing campaigns to connect with customers and prospects.
* Collaborate with sales to create effective collateral and support sales initiatives.
* Leverage marketing tools and analytics for process efficiency, campaign evaluation, and strategy adjustment.
* Conduct market research and competitor analysis to identify trends and business opportunities.
* Craft campaigns tailored to our knowledgeable, tech-savvy readership.
* Manage product launches and coordinate with cross-functional teams for smooth execution.
* Oversee advertising sales, including print and digital marketing channels.
* Stay informed about industry trends and marketing best practices.

**Who You Are:**

A dynamic learner immersed in digital marketing and social media trends. You're a multitasking pro, managing various campaigns effortlessly while meeting deadlines. Your strategic thinking turns data into actionable insights.

**Requirements:**

* Bachelor's degree in Marketing or a related field.
* At least 5 years of marketing experience, including 3+ years in management.
* Proven track record in developing successful marketing campaigns.
* Proficiency in email marketing, marketing tools, and analytics platforms.
* Exceptional project management skills with a focus on prioritization and meeting deadlines.
* Experience in product management is beneficial.
* Knowledge of advertising sales, digital marketing, and analytical skills for data-driven decision making.
* Demonstrated understanding of the tech industry, particularly cybersecurity, and commitment to staying updated on industry trends.
* Strong copywriting and excellent communication skills, with an emphasis on collaboration.

**Join Us:**

As our Marketing Manager, you're key to shaping the future of technical publishing. At the heart of our marketing efforts, you'll have ample opportunities for growth and impact. If you're ready to engage with a global tech community and make a significant mark in technical publishing, apply now.

*Note: Responsibilities may extend beyond this description to meet organizational needs.*

* 401(k)

* Health insurance
* Life insurance
* Paid time off

Schedule:

title: Marketing Manager - Global Digital Health Partnerships
description:
About Dexcom


Founded in 1999, Dexcom, Inc. (NASDAQ: DXCM), develops and markets Continuous Glucose Monitoring (CGM) systems for ambulatory use by people with diabetes and by healthcare providers for the treatment of people with diabetes. The company is the leader in transforming diabetes care and management by providing CGM technology to help patients and healthcare professionals better manage diabetes. Since the company’s inception, Dexcom has focused on better outcomes for patients, caregivers, and clinicians by delivering solutions that are best in class - while empowering the community to take control of diabetes. Dexcom reported full-year 2022 revenues of $2.9B, a growth of 18% over 2021. Headquartered in San Diego, California, with additional offices in the Americas, Europe, and Asia Pacific, the company employs over 8,000 people worldwide.


**Meet the team:**

As a Partner Marketing Manager, you'll play a pivotal role in supporting our global commercial digital health products and partner marketing initiatives. You'll collaborate closely with partner marketing leads to develop and execute marketing plans, ensuring the ongoing success of our commercial products through strategic partnerships.  



This role is essential in supporting Dexcom's partnerships worldwide, working closely with cross-functional teams and geographies to align product strategies, track performance, and accelerate our partnerships. We're seeking a leader with extensive marketing experience in consumer technology, wearables, and digital health apps to drive innovation and success in this dynamic industry.  



If you're passionate about leveraging downstream partnerships to drive the success of innovative digital health products and thrive in a fast-paced, collaborative environment - we want to hear from you !


**Where you come in:**

* Identify user acquisition, engagement and retention opportunities based on partner offerings and performance
* Drive thought leadership and innovation in partner marketing strategies, experimenting with new tactics and approaches to enhance brand awareness and drive business growth.
* Support the d evelop ment and execut ion of downstream partner marketing strategies and campaigns to drive awareness, adoption, and engagement
* Stay abreast of industry trends, competitive landscape, and emerging technologies in the digital health and consumer technology space - proactively identifying marketing opportunities
* Collaborate closely with cross-functional teams to integrate partner initiatives into overall marketing plans and campaigns
* Support the optimal marketing spend mix across channels, media, and geographies, regularly evaluating results and taking corrective actions to maximize marketing and commercial spend impact for partners
**What makes you successful:**

* Bachelor’s degree in marketing or related field required and MBA preferred.
* Typically 8 years of marketing experience with at least 2 years of experience in partnership marketing preferred
* Experience in the digital health and consumer technology space (product or service)
* Creative thinker and problem solver who thrives in a fast-paced, dynamic environment .
* Strong communication skills, high energy ; with a collaborative m indset.

**Learning Agility and Innovation Mindset**

* You demonstrate curiosity and a continuous learning mindset.
* You proactively share knowledge with others for continued improvement.
* You exhibit willingness to test and learn from new approaches, advancing our products and markets.
* You have an eagerness to understand areas beyond functional accountabilities, including the technology and science behind our products.

**Problem Solving and Results Orientation**

* You proactively address strategic and operational challenges.
* You use business judgement to make decisions based on facts and data, advancing problem-solving in uncertain times/ambiguous situations, balancing risk with value-creation opportunity.
* You connect functional accountability with broader business outcomes.
* You have the intentionality to "zoom out and zoom in" as needed: challenge broadly on big, longer-term possibilities, while being 'hands on' and persistent in delivering today's business results.

**Collaboration, Team First Mindset, and Company-Wide Impact**

* You start with a team first, global mindset to deliver superior results.
* You celebrate individuals and teams for achieving significant milestones and goals.
* You demonstrate the ability to "zoom in and out" to meet situational leadership demands, driving broad impact.

**Communication and Credibility**

* You translate company and team business imperatives to specific prioritized actions and deliverables.
* You create and foster a culture of empowered accountability, enabling others to deliver at their fullest potential.
* You motivate high performing teams through this exciting period of growth and transformation.
* You set clear expectations and deliver on commitments.

As we look to our future, we envision an opportunity to help a much larger population. In 2022, motivated by evidence supporting broader use of glucose sensing technology, we magnified our mission: Empowering people to take control of their health. Our commitment to people with diabetes has not wavered. But as we contemplate our future, we are challenging our employees and stakeholder s to embrace bigger possibilities for our best-in-class glucose sensing technology. We see a world in which our care for customers includes not only the treatment of chronic conditions, but the potential to prevent the onset of disease by contributing to better overall health. At Dexcom we are guided by four core values: Listen, Think Big, Be Dependable, and Serve with Integrity.


**What you’ll get:**

* A front row seat to life changing CGM technology. Learn about our brave #dexcomwarriors community .
* A full and comprehensive benefits program.
* Growth opportunities on a global scale.
* Access to career development through in-house learning programs and/or qualified tuition reimbursement.
* An exciting and innovative, industry-leading organization committed to our employees, customers, and the communities we serve.

**Travel Required:**

* 25 - 50%

**Experience and Education Requirements:**

* Typically requires a Bachelor's degree with 8 - 12 years of industry experience.
* 2 - 5 years of previous management or lead experience.

**Remote Workplace:** Your location will be a home office; you are not required to live within commuting distance of your assigned Dexcom site (typically 75 miles/120km). *If you reside within commuting distance of a Dexcom site (typically 75 miles/120km) a hybrid working environment may be available. Ask about our Flex workplace option.*

Please note: The information contained herein is not intended to be an all-inclusive list of the duties and responsibilities of the job, nor are they intended to be an all-inclusive list of the skills and abilities required to do the job. Management may, at its discretion, assign or reassign duties and responsibilities to this job at any time. The duties and responsibilities in this job description may be subject to change at any time due to reasonable accommodation or other reasons. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform essential functions.


An Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, national origin, or protected veteran status and will not be discriminated against on the basis of disability. Dexcom’s AAP may be viewed upon request by contacting Talent Acquisition at talentacquisition@dexcom.com.


If you are an individual with a disability and would like to request a reasonable accommodation as part of the employment selection process, please contact Dexcom Talent Acquisition at talentacquisition@dexcom.com.

title: Retention Marketing Manager
Digital Marketing Manager
description:
Kiva Confections (www.kivaconfections.com) is a world-class cannabis-infused edibles company in California, the largest cannabis market in the world. Kiva's line includes Kiva Chocolate Bars, Terra Bites, Petra Mints, Lost Farms Gummies & Chews, and Camino Gummies. Our products are crafted from premium ingredients and thoughtfully combined with California cannabis. Since our beginning in 2010, our goal has been to create confections that redefine what a cannabis confection ought to be. By applying art and science, we ensure a deliciously consistent experience.  

We have high-reaching growth plans as the legal market and consumer adoption expand. Key growth initiatives include ambitious platform innovation, outstanding marketing, geographic expansion, strategic partnerships, and more. We are resourced for this spectacular growth and looking for great people to help take us to the next level.  

Are you a digital marketing enthusiast with a proven track record of developing and executing successful cross-channel strategies? Do you have a passion for the cannabis industry and a drive to lead innovative digital initiatives? If so, we have an exciting opportunity for you!  

We are seeking a Digital Marketing Manager to drive our digital and web marketing strategies for Kiva confections, Camino, Lost Farm, Petra and Terra. In this role, you will be responsible for implementing content strategies, overseeing digital growth initiatives, and collaborating with internal and external teams to achieve business goals on both the cannabis and hemp digital platforms. Your role will be vital in enhancing brand presence, optimizing customer engagement through digital channels, and supporting our DTC efforts.
### **As Digital Marketing Manager, you will...**

* Execute omni channel marketing strategies from optimization to reporting, ensuring alignment with company objectives.
* Manage digital advertising efforts, including budgeting and collaborating with Brand, Creative and E-Comm teams on ad creative for both cannabis and hemp sites
* Manages and grows the Digital Marketing Associate shared with the Director of E-Commerce
* Implement marketing strategies for third-party cannabis listing/ordering sites (e.g., Weedmaps, Leafly, I Heart Jane, Dutchie) to enhance brand presence and value for retail partners.
* Work with the Director of E-Comm and agencies to maintain and update best-in-class websites for our brands.
* Develop and implement SEO strategies to improve organic rankings and search traffic, with ongoing performance reporting.
* Maintain a monthly digital marketing calendar aligned with overall marketing initiatives and promotional activities.
* Collaborate with the creative team and brand managers to develop campaign assets that adhere to brand guidelines.
* Coordinate campaigns, and report on performance in collaboration with the Social Media and PR team.
* Analyze digital channel performance metrics to drive future marketing decisions.
* Generate monthly reports and assess the performance of all digital marketing campaigns on both cannabis and hemp sites.
* Understand technical limitations and opportunities working with a compliant heavy landscape

### **What we're looking for...**

* Bachelor's or Master's degree in Marketing, Communications, or a related field.
* Proficiency in digital marketing tools (e.g., Web CMS, Google Analytics, etc.).
* 5+ years of experience in digital marketing, website management, and social media.
* Strong knowledge of social media platforms (e.g., Instagram, LinkedIn, Twitter, etc.).
* Proven track record of managing SEO/SEM, marketing database, email, and social media campaigns.
* Experience with third-party and e-commerce platforms.
* Strong numerical and analytical skills for data interpretation.
* Effective communication and project management skills.
* Genuine passion for and interest in the cannabis industry.
* Prior cannabis or hemp industry experience is a plus.


Please note, we consider a number of factors such as internal pay parity, relevant experience/skills, geographic location, etc.
Kiva Confections provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws.
